story:
Who, what, where, when and why?

Hello! My name is Tess Krasne.  I'm an environmental biology major at Washington University in St. Louis with minors in anthropology and applied microeconomics. I spent this past summer on the small island of Isla Mujeres, Quintana Roo, México.  Of the four species of sea turtle on the island, Leatherbacks, Greens, Loggerheads and Hawksbills, three are endangered and one is vulnerable (IUCN 2015). While on Isla Mujeres, I volunteered for Tortugranja, the island's sea turtle conservation group and aquarium, and conducted anthropological research on the island's relationship to marine conservation.  Consuming sea turtles and their eggs is still a strong part of the island culture, despite it being illegal in Mexico. Increased human population on the island has led to coastal development and large amounts of trash and pollution.

 

The Project

Mis Amigos Del Mar

A bilingual children's book emphasizing sea turtle conservation.

Children's books have the ability to educate not only children on conservation issues but also their families.  Students come home and share what they've learned, or ask for help with reading books which gets their parents and older siblings involved.  What one student learns, an entire family can learn.  Proficiency in English is a highly valued skill on the island and recognized as an opportunity for economic success; the bilingual aspect of the book will draw interest to many looking to learn English.

    


The story follows two characters:  Coral, a young boy who grows into an old man while dedicating his life to sea turtle conservation. Lily is Coral's sea turtle friend who he sets free as a child after hearing his father say she and her siblings would raised to be dinner. Coral's daily actions work to improve conditions for sea turtles. The book addresses topics such as predators, ecosystem services, plastic and other marine debris, by-catch and poaching, through the eyes of Lily and Coral.  Lily swims through her environment, dodging obstacles to eventually reach adulthood and lay eggs herself. Lily and Coral reunite decades later on the beach where it all began, after Coral defends Lily from poachers.  

  


Mis Amigos Del Mar strives to show the value of conservation actions and demonstrate what we can all do to help. Local students who are knowledgable about sea turtle conservation and its importance will become adults who value the preservation of sea turtles. In both Spanish and English, Mis Amigos Del Mar will be donated (with the help of funding from people like you!) to schools on the coastal regions of North and Central America–where sea turtle conservation is still a work in progress.  I also will work with primary schools to include the book in their English or Science curriculums.

The Artist: Maia Chaves is an Argentinean visual artist who loves color and is inspired by nature.  She has and continues to use art as a means to communicate stories and issues. Maia recently completed all the images for the book using vibrant colors and fresh imagery.

Check out her Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/Maia-Chaves-5279608873...

Where is this funding going?

  • 81% Printing, shipping and distribution costs associated with the books that will be donated or given to those who donated significant funds
  • 3% 3-month complete photoshop subscription
  • 6% Purchasing an ISBN number for publication
  • 10% Payment to artist for illustrations

The amount of books donated is directly proportional to the amount of funds we receive. If we do not reach our goal, we can use the money we did raise to still donate copies, it will just be fewer. After this initial fundraising, the books will be available for purchase.  When you buy a copy, a copy is donated to a school in North or Central America.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's ok!  We appreciate anyone who can help get the word out! Share this link on your Facebook page (or any other social media outlet) or email it to you friends and family!



All photos taken by me while in Mexico and Australia spending time at Tortugranja, the laying beaches and on the reef!

story:
Trykk her for norsk versjon (Norwegian version).


The Norwegian government has authorized the disposal of 300 million tons of mining waste in the pristine and vitually untouched Førde Fjord. It is among the fjords that twice have been voted the best preserved attraction on UNESCO’s World Heritage List by National Geographic. The Førde Fjord is also one of the best breeding grounds for fish on the West Coast and two of the country's finest salmon rivers flow into the fjord. 

We need your help to run an effective marketing campaign to inform voters of the monumental consequences, and to help secure a majority against the fjord disposal. Funds will be used for ads in papers, posters and direct marketing.

Please contribute. 

Naturvernforbundet, an environmental organization, has labelled the plans "one of the worst pollution scandals in modern Norwegian history".

The local 21 person strong district council can overturn the government’s controversial decision, given that the five parties against the fjord disposal obtain at least 11 seats following the election on September 14. The county council (one of 19 in Norway) is elected on the same day and have a say too. So do the other three districts alongside the fjord.

This will bizarelly be the first time that voters actually get their say on this major issue. The plans of the mining company were not finalized in 2007. And still the local politicians that were elected that year said yes to the fjord disposal in 2011, without a mandate from voters.  

A new district council can reverse that decision. Other districts and the county can also engage pressure.

The 300 millions tons of waste include 112 kilos of mercury annually. That is almost ten times as much as the 12-15 kilos of mercury which are being emitted in all of Norway per year (divided on 100,000 kilometeres of coastline). The rest of the waste is made up by heavy metals, nano-particles and fine grained dust – all of which negatively affect and kill marine life.  

We find it incredible that Nordic Mining, a company with three employees and a bank overdraft of zero, has successfully managed to lobby local politicians and the government into accepting what will ultimately contribute to destroy Norway's reputation as a pristine, clean and spectacular paradise. Not to mention the effect it will have on Norway's fish exports.

And it is beyond belief that the project has been given the green light by so-called environmental minister Tine Sundtoft. On the date of her ministry's acceptance, Norwegian Prime Minister Erna Solberg was campaigning for Norwegian salmon in Vietnam, giving away free samples of healthy fish from the clean fjords of Norway. All featured on the 7 o'clock national news on Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation.

Oh, the irony.

Can you imagine that beautiful Norway is one of only five countries in the world that actually allow sea disposals? (The others are Papa New Guinea, Turkey, Chile and Indonesia.) Neither can foreigners that hear about these plans. We are met by shock and despair by people who love nature. And only 7% of Norwegians support the practice of sea disposals.  

Someone needs to take responsibility when the government doesn't. We hope that you will help us Save Our Pristine Fjord through local democracy.

Any gift is most welcome and highly appreciated. 

Thank you for taking the time to read up on this.

This madness has been covered internationally by The Guardian, The Telegraph, The BBC and a range of others.

story:
Help us Publish the First

Ukrainian Permaculture Book!

Ukrainian permaculturists work for resilience, and hold a hopeful vision for the future even in the face of ecological disasters, economic strife, and war.  Permaculture (permanent culture + permanent agriculture) is a problem-solving approach focused on finding win-win solutions by designing of our land and social systems based on sustainability principles found in natural systems.

Please help the NGO Permaculture in Ukraine and Permaculture for Peace translate the first-ever Permaculture Design Handbook into the Ukrainian language!



Ukrainian permaculture is relatively young movement - the first certification course was organized in 2011. Since then we have created the NGO “Permaculture in Ukraine” and now the first sprouts of Ukrainian school of permaculture arises. Our country and our organization are now facing the war on the East of Ukraine, but we believe that by spreading the words of permaculture as the holistic wisdom of sustainable harmonic existence with nature and other people we can bring peace and prosperity to our country.

In 2014 we launched the international project Permaculture for Peace to facilitate peacebuilding in post-conflict areas through permaculture workshops that empower marginalized and displaced communities to co-develop long-term food security, energy efficiency, and participatory democratic structures based on permaculture principles. We have been able to run the first course within this project that was free for internally displaced persons without being supported by big donors but due to contribution from many of friends who wish to share their knowledge and experience on the voluntary base. 

However the graduates of our educational courses need further guidance when applying permaculture into their life. Permaculture Design by Aranya, published in 2012, is a 190-page handbook that guides the reader through the entire permaculture design process. Currently, no permaculture books are available in Ukrainian.  Having this book translated and published into Ukrainian would be a treasure in a country where English literacy, unfortunately, is an attribute to youngsters from big cities. Useful materials on Permaculture therefore remains unavailable for the majority of Ukrainian permaculturists - those ones, who want to change this world for better.

In 2014 we bought the right to translate and publish Permaculture Design by Aranya.  We aim to make this translation affordable for the majority of Ukrainians by running this project as a nonprofit venture. Unfortunately our country is now suffering not only from war, but also from terrible inflation as the result. The prices have risen while the population has become poorer, therefore we can not rise the book price. Moreover, we want to distribute this book for free within our Permaculture for Peace program to participants from the regions affected by the war.

We need to gather 1975 $ to pay for translation, editing and makeup, 643 $ for copyright and 318 $ to cover money processing fees and commissions. Once we get this sum (2800 $, which is sufficient to prepare an electronic book), our next goal will be to gather 2280 $ to publish the hard copy of this book - 465 $ of publication cost will be collected by pre-orders (estimated book price in Ukraine - 4,65 $). Now we are on the half way with book preparation and ready to publish it in September - October 2015.

Let’s become the part of Earthcare, Peoplecare and Fairshare permaculture challenge and show, that we can change this world together! Remember, that small donations also matter! Please, share this campaign with your friends!

We have several gifts to raffle among our supporters! 

If your card payment does not proceed you may need to contact your bank or change your card limits for the internet transactions via your internet banking. Please, see also the also the other ways of sending donations.

  Thank you for your support!   

Additional ways to contribute

·  Be the first to order Aranya’s book in Ukrainian!

·  Register for online Permaculture Design Course in Ukrainian!

·  Register for online course Introduction to Permaculture with Christina Zawerucha!

story:
Hi there Facebook friends and family! I am here today to let you guys in on my idea for the future of harnessing wind technology.

I have always had a love for Earth science. As early as the fifth grade I started noticing certain things such as how air gets compressed. In high school I had an epiphany after I learned that the definition of energy is the ability to do work. After that, I started thinking about what was the source of the energy for the things I saw in motion. Soon after I started investigating wind turbines, my first question was “why aren’t these things everywhere?” I found out that a traditional turbine has to be put in high wind areas due to the sheer size of them. Instead of thinking big, I started to think small. I have come up with a wind turbine that, although large in size, is made up of small things. I believe that this new turbine will not only be more efficient than current technology, but can also be used in low wind areas.

Now, before I can let everyone in on the details, I need some help. On December 3rd I’m meeting with two professors at Purdue University, one of which holds a high ranking position with The Richard G. Lugar Center for Renewable Energy. I am starting a crowdfunding campaign so that I can raise money to keep moving forward with my idea. I need the money to get patents, do research, and so on. I think it’s important to say that renewable energy is not a left idea, nor a right idea, but is actually a responsibility of every single one of us. I truly, completely believe in what I am doing here. With my ideas, and your backing, we can do some really terrific things. Please help me out by visiting my Indiegogo page, and chipping in 5 or $10. If you can’t donate, just ‘like’ and ‘share’ this post to help me out. Thank you to everyone that helps me out. I truly appreciate you! Signing off, Doug Robinson.

story:
Short Summary

Led by Professor Bernard Nkongmeneck, an expert botanist (former National History Museum of Paris, visiting scientist at History Museum of London, Kew Royal Botanic Gardens, Smithsonian Institution Museum & The Marie Selby Botanical garden), the Millennium Ecological Museum's (MEM) goal is to protect the biodiversity of Cameroon and the Congo basin for future generations through the collection and conservation of various specimens: plants, animals, minerals. It is the first natural history museum in Cameroon and Central Africa. It's a project led by prof. Bernard Nkongmeneck and professional researchers who came together to preserve Africa biodiversity. The impact of the museum is timeless. The success of the museum will inspire Africans and create awareness on climate change.

The Campaign SupportMEM aims to raise USD $5,000 ( adding to $20,000 already raised locally) to expand the current museum by building a new complex (4000 sq meter) with exhibition rooms, research lab, teaching space and souvenir shop.


What We Need & What You Get

We need 5,000 USD to:

1. Continue the construction of the first building (already started with funds collected locally)

2. Hire an architect to design the museum

3. Organize campaigns to raise awareness on climate change, train researchers and traditional healers on the sustainable use of medicinal plants. 

4- Transfer our current collection to the first building/location


Contributors will receive unique perks:

$50 - Free lifetime admission to the MEM

$100 - Get a signed photo from Prof. Bernard’s unique collection of beauties of Africa 


The Impact

1. The rich biodiversity of Cameroon and the Congo Basin is being destroyed at a high rate by various industries (wood, mining)

2. There is a need to preserve this rich and unique biodiversity for future generations

3. To establish a resource based center of excellence that connects people to their environment.

Risks & Challenges

RISK : Construction delays - Outsourcing 

CHALLENGES: High cost of architect; Hire a good construction company to build the museum on time and within budget; Marketing and communication of the Museum; Raise additional funds to complete the full vision

MITIGATION: Building on my team expertise in securing the initial capital to buy the land and start the construction, we are well positioned to manage this project and will seek additional help when needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this wonderful campaign with friends and families. Spread the word and let's make this project a reality.

story:
Eco House Batu Kapal 


Jungle inspired story

Authentic jungle stretches over North West of Sumatra, Indonesia. There is my house situated close to Gunung Leuser National park (Bukit Lawang). In the middle of  unique ecosystem I live surrounded by jungle creatures. Those include various species of monkeys, birds, lizards and many others almost extinct animals. Most impressive of all are huge orangutans having durian lunch at the treetop in my backyard. Behind the house there is a cave, another spot where animals gather, which has the shape of the ship. My place is named after it, batu in Indonesian language means rock and kapal means ship. Through Eco House Batu Kapal project I wish to preserve the originality of the nature which nowadays is being endangered in our fast changing world.

 

Primary Goal 

My land extends on 6 Ha. On one small part the house is situated and the rest is home for the jungle animals, flora and fauna. My big house consists only of walls and roof. There is still a lot construction work needed to be done. My goal is to obtain origin of habitation of the nature (animals and plants) and to build environmentally sensitive house: no forest will be cut and no hillside will be razed. Beside cement I am mostly I’m using materials which nature is offering, that are mainly wood and rocks which I collect from the river that passes the house. Until now I used my bare hands for work to be done. At this point I am turning to the outer world to help me raise funds for buying equipment and materials to finish the building of the house and other infrastructure.

Approximately expense for the house:  3000 $

Materials and equipment needed:

- Drill , battery based (there is no electricity there)

- Saw, battery based  

- Solar power lamps  

- Cement  

- Toilet and shower

- Kitchen equipment  ( at the time of rainy season, we can cook indoor and not only in outdoor open fire)

- Nails, bamboo, rope, shovel…

- Donations for the workers 

Approximant time of the primary goal completed:   4 months


Long-term goal

I wish my house to become a place where socially responsible and environmentally respectful activities would be held. First of all I want to contribute to environmental awareness of local people which seems to love nature but lack the knowledge of how to treat it: they often come to spent time around my cave, but leave a bunch of trashes. Another problem are the motorbikes that pass by my land, they scare the orangutans and other animals, which drives them away from their original habitat. Moreover they drop sewages into the river which is becoming more and more polluted. Educational workshops and gatherings would be held for this reason. Because I know education is the first and most important step toward awareness I would offer my place as outdoor classroom to students of different age (primary school, high school and university) and as a spot meetings for the volunteers and local people.

Furthermore I will make a garden where I will grow plants for herbal medicine which could be part of the outdoor lessons for students. Through mentioned activities I will establish ecosensitive habitat, where people and animals can live in symbiosis. I will devote more attention to orangutans and other animals which are making their home there. The animals are being endangered with the palm oil plantations and that is why I want to up keep the planting of the trees, which are home habitat and a food providing of their daily menu.

After all I want my place to be art space where people can make nature friendly arts, such as wood carving and batik making, i.e. waxing and colouring textile, using natural colours.

Approximately expense for the long-term goal:  7000 $

- Planting trees and up keeping the surroundings  (Meranti tree (orangutans home and food); Jack fruit; Durian; Bean fruit; Passion fruit; Guava;  Banana;…

- The herbal plantation - planting different types of healing herbs like ginger, lemon-grass, turmeric,…and up keeping it.

- Garden Infrastructure (buying the materials and vegetables for planting)

- Materials for the irrigation (which is connected to the river) (cement,…)

- Materials for building the entry point (wood, nails, rope, cement, shovel…)

- Up keeping the cave (putting the signs- “No litter”, Trash canes,…)

- Materials for building the outdoor classrooms (wood, nails, rope, cement,…)

- Equipment for outdoor classrooms  (benches and chairs from wood, board, markers, books about animals, flora and fauna, projector, computer, speakers,…everything would be generated with the solar power energy)

- Infrastructure for the camping area (covered spaces- tents, roof, bamboo huts, beds, toilets, showers, solar power lamps, cooking area-open space, fire ground camp, but in the rainy season the indoor  kitchen facilities would be used, ...)

- Realizing the workshops for local people (space for workshops, equipment, materials,…)

- Solar power lamps

Approximant time of the long-term goal completed:     Ongoing process


Interest and inspirations

In the more and more urban world I would like to keep our jungle paradise as it is: enjoying simple life without electricity while food is cooked above fire and meal is served with river view in company of jungle breeze from behind. The simple life of Sumatra jungle areas (as well as Kalimantan) is being threatened by enormous palm oil plantations which causes massive deforestation, destroying homes of local people and animals. The simple life is getting disturbed as well by many tourist accommodations without almost any ecodevelopement orientation build nearby my place. I wish to cooperate and inspire them to step forward more planet-friendly tourism.
story_txt:
Eco House Batu Kapal Jungle inspired storyAuthentic jungle stretches over North West of Sumatra, Indonesia. There is my house situated close to Gunung Leuser National park (Bukit Lawang). In the middle of  unique ecosystem I live surrounded by jungle creatures. Those include various species of monkeys, birds, lizards and many others almost extinct animals. Most impressive of all are huge orangutans having durian lunch at the treetop in my backyard. Behind the house there is a cave, another spot where animals gather, which has the shape of the ship. My place is named after it, batu in Indonesian language means rock and kapal means ship. Through Eco House Batu Kapal project I wish to preserve the originality of the nature which nowadays is being endangered in our fast changing world. Primary Goal My land extends on 6 Ha.
On one small part the house is situated and the rest is home for the jungle
animals, flora and fauna. My big house consists only of walls and roof. There
is still a lot construction work needed to be done. My goal is to obtain origin
of habitation of the nature (animals and plants) and to build environmentally
sensitive house: no forest will be cut and no hillside will be razed. Beside
cement I am mostly I’m using materials which nature is offering, that are
mainly wood and rocks which I collect from the river that passes the house.
Until now I used my bare hands for work to be done. At this point I am turning
to the outer world to help me raise funds for buying equipment and materials to
finish the building of the house and other infrastructure.
Approximately expense
for the house:  3000 $ 
Materials and equipment
needed:- Drill ,
battery based (there is no electricity there)- Saw,
battery based  - Solar

story:
Let's face it! We as a global community are waking up to protect ourselves and the planet we inherit from Nature. The recent success of COP21 in Paris speaks magnitudes about our overwhelming collective intent.

2041 is not far away either when the embargo on drilling and mining activities in Antarctica expires.The last great wilderness on Earth needs more than just care and conservation. It needs a strong and sound policy governing its freedom from industrial intervention, read disruption.

I Chandrika, a learner-educator from India, am humbled to embark on the International Antarctic Expedition 2016 (IAE). Under the leadership of Sir Robert Swan, the 2041 Foundation is doing everything it takes to garner international support so that Antarctica gets the protection it deserves and we owe it! In March 2016, a team of selected participants will have the unique opportunity to live and experience the fragile ecosystem of Antarctica in the 13 day expedition. I want to join the expedition because it in sync with my philosophy of leading a sustainable life and doing every bit to combat climate change. This is possible by everyday efforts through our lifestyles. I am looking forward to launch the ‘Each Day, One Little Way Initiative’ addressing ways to achieve the same. 

In partnership with Swan and 2041, together we can build a promising and hopeful future, united in the goal to protect the Antarctic Treaty and to create a better tomorrow, today.

This will be a journey of our commitments, and every cent counts.The cost of the Antarctic expedition is about  $ 15,000 .Your contribution and support to raise funds for expedition will go a long way as citizens of the globe standing up for our environment.

The IAE will resolve my commitment to maintain efforts to work for Nature. Are you willing to take the journey with me?

Join me in Antarctica! 

IAE hosts a flag day in the seventh continent, where I can unfurl the flag of my sponsor to mark their pledge to the fragile ecosystem in the snow-white landscape. 

Your contribution and commitment is significant, so send me across your picture and your quote or any message, and you will see it unfurled in Antarctica! I promise to broadcast your message to the world from the seventh continent! And pass on the word to those who are committed to nature! :) 

Join me  on #StandupforAntartica

My Journey so far

  • As an astrophysicist, environmentalist and educator, I am trained to engage in modelling solutions to develop non-intrusive technological progress.
  • As an ambassador of Global Himalayan Expedition (GHE) 2013, I have pledged to lead a sustainable life and encourage living in earth  structures.
  • As a member of One Million Women Initiative, taking on climate change through everyday lives.
  •  Class of 2007 Goldman Sachs Global Leader, I lead social organisations in the education sector to aid secondary education of Mathematics and Science in low-income schools across India.
  • I have a keen interest in Earth building and Green Buildings after I was a part of the National Building Apprenticeship 2013 at SECMOL, Ladakh-India.

Our journey after the expedition

Post the expedition, I intend to engage in some commitments 

  • Leadership and awareness talks in schools, colleges and universities; workshops to brainstorm ways to reduce ecological footprint.

  • Research projects with Antarctic Research Centres across the world to analyse satellite data that help understand the inter-dependency of natural climatic systems around the globe.

  • Participate and reach out to policy makers, and be one of them too.

  • Channelize ‘Live green communities’ in India to strengthen the resolve in creating promising solutions to concrete jungles. Provide consultation to firms and individuals interested to live in Green or Earth buildings.

  • Advocate the philosophy and promise of 2041, and do everything it takes to protect and preserve Antarctica.

Further information:

  • 2041 Official Website: 2041.com
  • Follow Robert Swan on Facebook - Twitter 
  • Protocol on Environmental Protection to the Antarctic Treaty - Wiki - Full document - ATS website
Thank you in advance for your time, contribution and energy! 

Promisingly, 

Chandrika

story:
Auroville and its Botanical Gardens

In a small experimental city in south India called Auroville, we live by the aspiration to create Human Unity and Peace.  It is the Soul of all our work and life.  In Auroville's Botanical Gardens, we attempt to inspire and create this Peace and Unity by working with Nature to manifest Beauty through growing gardens together.  With members, local workers, and volunteers from around the world, the Botanical Gardens has not only created a space of Beauty and Peace, but also a space for educating children and adults about the diversity of Nature, especially the local indigenous plant species.  Every year, 3,000 students visit our education program and the Gardens, where they experience and learn about over 2,500 species of plants, including 250 species of trees.

A Japanese Garden for Peace and Unity

We have designed a new Japanese Garden with a Pavilion of Silent Reflection to bring the Japanese quality of Beauty into our Botanical Garden space.  It will be a place where people will be able to feel inspired by the harmony of nature and Spirit that Japanese gardens are famous for, while also providing the opportunity for children and others in India to learn more about the diversity of the world's gardens.  Here are the designs developed by Jyoti, our Aurovilian landscape designer from Japan:


The new garden and its Pavilion will also be a place for traditional tea ceremonies and other contemplative social gatherings for the Auroville community. 

Building Peace and Human Unity is a work that must be done through all variety of forms and ways, even in the building of a garden.  The creation of a garden can bring people together for new experiences, where relationships between people grow through a connection with each other and the Nature around.  We hope that much of the work of building this garden will be done by volunteers and the members of the community in order to create a different Spirit in the garden.  It will be a place for all to visit and enjoy once it is created.....So, we invite you to participate and help us manifest this Garden!

What We Need

Auroville is essentially a city of volunteers, people who have chosen to live here and contribute to this adventure in building a city based not upon profit but upon a new Spirit and Intention - for Human Unity and Peace.  So, that means we need YOUR support to succeed in this Japanese Garden project, in the form of:

  • Money!  We need around $13,640 total for the Garden, which includes:  $6,820 for the materials and labor for building the tea house/pavilion; $3,850 for the leak-proof pond; and $2,970 for large boulders/stones, plants and planting, pathways and general land-shaping.
  • Volunteers!  Yes, we would love to have you participate in physically building the garden when the time comes.  Check out the Botanical Gardens website and see how you can volunteer!
  • Spread the word and help us raise the funds needed!  Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or website, or any other social media you use...and if you wish to share our videos, please do so!  Remember to use the Indiegogo sharing tools! 
  • Lots of Goodwill and Smiles!

All funds donated will go entirely to this project, even if we don't make the goal here....We have done preliminary work on the space for this garden and will keep working on manifesting it.  In time, we know it will be complete, as for us there is no real deadline for building this garden!  Our team has built and grown a 44 acre space over 15 years starting from nothing, with our leader Paul, a skilled landscape architect and horticulturalist, who started this place working the soil with his own two hands.  Whatever obstacles may come, financial or otherwise, Auroville is a place where perseverance is rewarded, even if it takes years to happen, though we hope YOU will help us finish much sooner!  When life slows down one can be sure it will eventually speed up again....and lead to new doorways and opportunities!

Please watch our pitch video and our general garden tour video under the Gallery section to see more about the project, as well as the gardens that have been created at the Auroville Botanical Gardens.  You can also see some of the other design work of Jyoti at http://oneasiaproject.org/?page_id=1453

We thank you for visiting our project and hope you will choose to give us your support!

We thank you for visiting our project and hope you will choose to give us your support!

story:
The project description.

The location:  

The place where the project is launched is a country of my origin - Latvia (LV) (Lettland).

Environmental aspect and part of our mission:

The forests are acting as a lungs for the earth, wealthy forests mean more fresh air in future. More fresh air for everyone, None of the innovative and highly intellectual devices can run a 100-300 years and run without batteries, chargers, plastic etc., latest after 10 years they will end up into our landfills and help produce gases. 

The forests can!

The tree will live at least 100 years, no batteries, no plastic, no garbage, and then will turn into eco-flooring, eco-house, eco-table, eco-chair, eco-toys for our kids, anything you can imagine, except a waste garbage or empty battery . We are responsible, how we will hand-over everything to our grandchildren and we think about it. 



  If we do it together, everyone with a little support, this project will be successful and more will follow around the globe. 

The future perspective: 

 Once the trees are planted into ground, it is a very high future perspective for the land and a excellent long term investment for our grandchildren, provided that a forest is properly overlooked and maintained in good condition. Our idea is to grow up a forest from "zero" size and do it together with our son at early age, guiding him from the very childhood "How to..."   look after it. It takes 100 yrs to grow up healthy forest, so we will be proud to do a family tradition for our grandchildren, the price is priceless.     

The drive & motivation:  

 "Dear, mother nature, we came to you with peace and will not do any harm to you". A forest welcomes you then! We are well motivated to act now and for the future of our grandchildren, the world is already facing more and more challenges. A Human health, a climate, urbanization, more and more plastics, non-organic material, exhaust pipes from cars, millions of them doing silently the job, we can't see it in the air, but the evidence is more and more health problems etc.,

You might be surprised:  

  •      One tree produces oxygen for 1 family ( 4 persons ).
  •      Forest cools and conditions air
  •      Forest cleans underground water streams
  •      Forest is a shelter and home to thousands of animals and birds
  •      Forest absorbs carbons and provides material with name letters "ECO" 
  •      Forest gives a shadow and absorbs sun rays, reflections
  •      Forest is a real beauty, not luxurious mega yachts
  •      Forest inspires song writers, book writers, people seeking answers to important questions in life
  •      Forest helps in a rain cycles, read about rain forests 
  •      Materials from forest when properly fabricated, their lifespan can be 1000 years and more.    
How we can help our grandchildren? We can make the planet green, the balance of green on the planet is less and less.  

The scope of work:  

We have already done some pilot-project before starting this campaign, we have planted 300 trees early this summer to study the prices, workload, calendar periods, methods, regulations etc., A project research phase is Completed 

The further plan consists of five phases with a reasonable schedule and adjustable buoyancy scale, depending on funds raised through the campaign.

 The preparation works "A" phase is started already and will continue through winter period. We have to clear up some area from bushes etc. We started it now, as the work has to be completed during winter. 

The "B" phase is to plant 9000 pine trees, 1000 spruce trees in the area of 3,2 ha. The dates will be starting from May and till June 2016. 

The 3rd "C" phase is the core point of the project, The plan is to find and take an ownership of a destroyed forest ( Some people take everything they can, and do not invest back in the nature, lets call them "Temporary visitors of the planet" ), Our mission is to leave the planet better for our children and grandchildren, The mission will be to  save one of the destroyed forests, We will find the place, where the nature has been destroyed by the "Temporary visitors of the planet", we will clean it, prepare the land and plant a required number of pine trees + spruces. The total amount of trees will depend on size of area, it will be more than 3000 trees per 1 ha as a promise and to comply with regulations. The scale of the project depends on funds collected. We hope very much to a success, but it depends on everyone of you, if we have reached to the right people, who can pass the information to friends and have also support by any other way, sharing, contributing, joining us. The dates for this part are set to a reasonable limits, starting from 1st of December 2015 and 18 months forward. 

The "D" phase of the project will be spread through the period of next 12-15 years, a young forest requires much attention, a periodical cleaning, rarefaction, protection against flies etc. We like very much to link our future with it, it is so amazing to see your hard work done and result every year grows higher and higher, so beautiful.

Finally, fifth phase of the project "E" - "The Charity act". The phase will commence, If this campaign grows unseen size ('explodes') and the amount of funds is much higher than we expected. We will find a family(ies), where the parents are fighting for their baby health and handover the remaining funds in to their hands or pay the medical bill,  by clearly indicating the source of the funds and full list of all the backers. If we have reached the "E" phase, everyone of you will be informed of the family and we will make sure the support goes into the right hands, right time. We follow a very simple rule in our life, know how much of everything you need to be happy, do not take away the joy. Forestry and helping others will make us very, very, very happy, join us!


Lets have a look on this human artwork: What do you see in this picture?  UFO's destroying our forests? No, no, no - human are very happy to do this. We destroy our oxygen generating farms around the world. 

When we see a beautiful country forests slowly turning into "bushes" for our grandchildren, we can't leave it like this , young parents full of energy, we spoke often about a way, how we could fight with it. "

 


Next image is our vision. A beauty and inspiration, when people have the right approach to the amazing gift of the nature. We do not destroy the unique oxygen generators, the air we breath and our children will breath. We have to freeze the destruction by planting new and new trees for next generations. Billions of trees around the world. The secret you must now about it is simple, once the trees are planted, they have occupied the place for 100 years at least, no farmers with chemicals, no factories, no landfills, no further destruction, but a continuous oxygen production, recovery of the climate. The "Temporary visitors are powerless there", they can not flood  the place by agriculture chemicals, they can not cut the trees, it is all frozen green area then. Nice? Yes, it is! 

 

 A little one, planted early 2015, beauty, isn't it?  Yes, it is fighting for the sun and already taking out the carbons and generating O2. If we can't reduce carbon emissions, we can increase oxygen emissions, logical approach. 
   

How  do we know, this project will be successful?  

We have a clear vision, motivation, target, we know HOW TO do it. Besides that, we have collected all information and simulated the workload, the costs of materials, inventory, etc. Finally, the most important, we do it with love, unlimited power and energy for our grandchildren. The price is priceless at the end.

The limiting factor here is only one, how many of you will join us and support our idea.

Have a look at this short version of principles of crowdfunding, more people means more trees. More trees mean more fresh air, more healthy children, more of the "ECO" production in future and happiness to all of us. 

 

                              

Make your step forward to live in a more green.  


Dear Folks, There is a very little chance to reach all the goals of this campaign, without your support. Lets have a brief look at the ways you can easy help within the campaign.  You will help a lot by contributing, sharing, copying the link, passing information to a friend and you are inside of the project by any of those steps, do not stay outside & remember, we will do the actual job, and even after +300 yrs everyone on the planet gets more clean and fresh air. Isn't it a perfect deal? 

&

Remember

Greatest things in our lives happen with love!

P.s. If you feel only half way motivated, have a look at our list of perks,
story_txt:
The project description.

The location:  The place where the project is launched is a country of my origin - Latvia (LV) (Lettland).
Environmental aspect and part of our mission:The forests are acting as a lungs for the earth, wealthy forests mean more fresh air in future. More fresh air for everyone, None of the innovative and highly intellectual devices can run a 100-300 years and run without batteries, chargers, plastic etc., latest after 10 years they will end up into our landfills and help produce gases. The forests can!The tree will live at least 100 years, no batteries, no plastic, no garbage, and then will turn into eco-flooring, eco-house, eco-table, eco-chair, eco-toys for our kids, anything you can imagine, except a waste garbage or empty battery . We are responsible, how we will hand-over everything to our grandchildren and we think about it.   If we do it together, everyone with a little support, this project will be successful and more will follow around the globe. 

The future perspective:  Once the trees are planted into ground, it is a very high future perspective for the land and a excellent long term investment for our grandchildren, provided that a forest is properly overlooked and maintained in good condition. Our idea is to grow up a forest from "zero" size and do it together with our son at early age, guiding him from the very childhood "How to..."   look after it. It takes 100 yrs to grow up healthy forest, so we will be proud to do a family tradition for our grandchildren, the price is priceless.     
The drive & motivation:   "Dear, mother nature, we came to you with peace and will not do any harm to you". A forest welcomes you then! We are well motivated to act now and for the future of our grandchildren, the world is already facing more and more challenges. A Human health, a climate, urbanization, more and more plastics, non-organic material, exhaust pipes from cars, millions of them doing silently the job, we can't see it in the air, but the evidence is more and more health problems etc.,You might be surprised:  

     One tree produces oxygen for 1 family ( 4 persons ).


     Forest cools and conditions air

     Forest cleans underground water streams
     Forest is a shelter and home to thousands of animals and birds
     Forest absorbs carbons and provides material with name letters "ECO" 
     Forest gives a shadow and absorbs sun rays, reflections
     Forest is a real beauty, not luxurious mega yachts
     Forest inspires song writers, book writers, people seeking answers to important questions in life
     Forest helps in a rain cycles, read about rain forests 

     Materials from forest when properly fabricated, their lifespan can be 1000 years and more.    

How we can help our grandchildren? We can make the planet green, the balance of green on the planet is less and less.  
The scope of work:  We have already done some pilot-project before starting this campaign, we have planted 300 trees early this summer to study the prices, workload, calendar periods, methods, regulations etc., A project research phase is Completed The further plan consists of five phases with a reasonable schedule and adjustable buoyancy scale, depending on funds raised through the campaign. The preparation works "A" phase is started already and will continue through winter period. We have to clear up some area from bushes etc. We started it now, as the work has to be completed during winter. The "B" phase is to plant 9000 pine trees, 1000 spruce trees in the area of 3,2 ha. The dates will be starting from May and till June 2016. The 3rd "C" phase is the core point of the project, The plan is to find and take an ownership of a destroyed forest ( Some people take everything they can, and do not invest back in the nature, lets call them "Temporary visitors of the planet" ), Our mission is to leave the planet better for our children and grandchildren, The mission will be to  save one of the destroyed forests, We will find the place, where the nature has been destroyed by the "Temporary visitors of the planet", we will clean it, prepare the land and plant a required number of pine trees + spruces. The total amount of trees will depend on size of area, it will be more than 3000 trees per 1 ha as a promise and to comply with regulations. The scale of the project depends on funds collected. We hope very much to a success, but it depends on everyone of you, if we have reached to the right people, who can pass the information to friends and have also support by any other way, sharing, contributing, joining us. The dates for this part are set to a reasonable limits, starting from 1st of December 2015 and 18 months forward. The "D" phase of the project will be spread through the period of next 12-15 years, a young forest requires much attention, a periodical cleaning, rarefaction, protection against flies etc. We like very much to link our future with it, it is so amazing to see your hard work done and result every year grows higher and higher, so beautiful.Finally, fifth phase of the project "E" - "The Charity act". The phase will commence, If this campaign grows unseen size ('explodes') and the amount of funds is much higher than we expected. We will find a family(ies), where the parents are fighting for their baby health and handover the remaining funds in to their hands or pay the medical bill,  by clearly indicating the source of the funds and full list of all the backers. If we have reached the "E" phase, everyone of you will be informed of the family and we will make sure the support goes into the right hands, right time. We follow a very simple rule in our life, know how much of everything you need to be happy, do not take away the joy. Forestry and helping others will make us very, very, very happy, join us!Lets have a look on this human artwork: What do you see in this picture?  UFO's destroying our forests? No, no, no - human are very happy to do this. We destroy our oxygen generating farms around the world. When we see a beautiful country forests slowly turning into "bushes" for our grandchildren, we can't leave it like this , young parents full of energy, we spoke often about a way, how we could fight with it. " Next image is our vision. A beauty and inspiration, when people have the right approach to the amazing gift of the nature. We do not destroy the unique oxygen generators, the air we breath and our children will breath. We have to freeze the destruction by planting new and new trees for next generations. Billions of trees around the world. The secret you must now about it is simple, once the trees are planted, they have occupied the place for 100 years at least, no farmers with chemicals, no factories, no landfills, no further destruction, but a continuous oxygen production, recovery of the climate. The "Temporary visitors are powerless there", they can not flood  the place by agriculture chemicals, they can not cut the trees, it is all frozen green area then. Nice? Yes, it is!  
 A little one, planted early 2015, beauty, isn't it?  Yes, it is fighting for the sun and already taking out the carbons and generating O2. If we can't reduce carbon emissions, we can increase oxygen emissions, logical approach. 
   
How  do we know, this project will be successful?  
We have a clear vision, motivation, target, we know HOW TO do it. Besides that, we have collected all information and simulated the workload, the costs of materials, inventory, etc. Finally, the most important, we do it with love, unlimited power and energy for our grandchildren. The price is priceless at the end.
The limiting factor here is only one, how many of you will join us and support our idea.
Have a look at this short version of principles of crowdfunding, more people means more trees. More trees mean more fresh air, more healthy children, more of the "ECO" production in future and happiness to all of us. 
 


                              
Make your step forward to live in a more green.  



Dear Folks, There is a very little chance to reach all the goals of this campaign, without your support. Lets have a brief look at the ways you can easy help within the campaign.  You will help a lot by contributing, sharing, copying the link, passing information to a friend and you are inside of the project by any of those steps, do not stay outside & remember, we will do the actual job, and even after +300 yrs everyone on the planet gets more clean and fresh air. Isn't it a perfect deal? 
&

Greatest things in our lives happen with love!

story:
Short Summary

The Problem

Household Food Waste (HFW) receives considerable attention worldwide due to the environmental, economic and social impacts it generates. HFW constitutes the largest production source among the different food waste sectors (manufacturing, food service/catering and wholesale/retail), while it also comprises the largest single waste fraction generated by households (reaching up to 61% of municipal solid waste). Future trends show that HFW is anticipated to increase significantly due to population growth and increasing consumption patterns, giving rise to increased environmental impact in cases when unsustainable management techniques are applied.

Research conducted in London proves the following: 

  1. Food Waste, at household level, has a direct relationship with birth defects and reproductive disorders. 
  2.  Increased frequency of Cancers in counties containing Food Waste sites was found in two US studies particularly for gastrointestinal, oesophageal, stomach, colon and rectal cancer.
  3. A comprehensive review investigates health problems (that include respiratory symptoms, irritation of the skin, nose and eyes, gastrointestinal problems, fatigue, headaches, psychological problems and allergies) are caused from Food Waste produced at both, household and landfill sites. 
  4. High levels of dioxin exposure found in workplaces (from Food Waste) and after accidents such as that at Seveso have caused chloracne and an increase in cardiovascular disease.
  5. The organic compounds which have received the most attention relating to incineration are dioxins and PCBs, partly because of their ability to accumulate in the body. 
The Product 
EnviroDryer is a family-sized affordable Food Waste Composter. It converts any organic waste into high quality organic biomass fertilizer. Your kitchen leftovers can turn into 3 kg of organic fruit/vegetable per day. On the other hand, the biomass (whats left from the cycle) can be used as an alternative for fossil fuels to produce high calorific energy (up to 2500 cal).


The main characteristics of household food waste dryer are given below:

  1. Compact household dryer easy to install and operate 
  2. Food waste volume reduction at source by 90%
  3. Food Waste weight reduction at source by 73%
  4. Low energy consumption 0.6 - 0.8 kWh per cycle of food waste treated
  5. Deodorization system composed of multiple active carbon filters which prevents foul odors during drying 
  6. Noiseless three part impeller system for food waste grinding during drying process. The slow movement of the impeller ensures powerful yet whisper quiet operation 
  7. Food waste chamber is coated on both the inside and outside with multiple varnishes, making the pulverization system stronger and more efficient 
  8. No additives required
  9. Suitable for the vast majority of food waste
  10. Established electricity saving auto control system which increases the performance in terms of processing time and energy consumption
  11. Capacity to treat approximately 4 kg of food waste on daily basis (i.e. up to 8 family members)
  12. Kills pathogenic microorganisms contained in food waste so that the dried material is completely sterilized


Bring the Change 

Many of us have tried to reduce the damage being done to our planet, but without addressing the larger issues, it often feels like a drop in the bucket.

This is a small product with a big impact.

By significantly reducing the damage caused by untreated organic waste, including air pollution, water contamination and the use of fossil fuels for energy, EnviroDryer responds to some of our most pressing environmental challenges today.

Our vision is to make EnviroDryer accessible and affordable for everyone. 

Join us and help pave the way for sustainable waste management. We’re in this for the long run

Zero Net Carbon 

Each year that you use EnviroDryer, you eliminate one ton of organic waste, and reduce harmful emissions equivalent to six tons of carbon dioxide (CO2).  

Using EnviroDryer can offset your car’s carbon emissions!

That means that each year you use EnviroDryer you are reversing the hazardous greenhouse gases that your car emits. 

1 EnviroDryer+ 1 car = 0 carbon


Who is EnviroDryer for? 

Have you experienced:
  1. Overflowing trash bins?
  2. Trash bin smells bad? Or leaks often? 
  3. Hotbed of bacteria that causes major diseases at home?
  4. Uncomfortable with throwing away Food Waste for personal reasons?
  5. Insects and mice which carry major diseases that contribute to a dirty environment
Then EnviroDryer is definitely for you!

Industrial EnviroDryer?

Are you a farmer? Do you own a restaurant? Are you producing more than 10 kg of waste a day? Are you paying a lot of money to get rid of your food waste ?
Great news! 
The Commercial/ Industrial EnviroDryer is your answer! 

Did you know? 
A medium restaurant within the Food and Beverage Industry produce approximately 51% food wastage. The waste disposal (collected by third party companies) costs restaurants 460 Dhs (130 USD) on a daily basis, depending on the quantity of waste. 

Unique Solution  

  1. No more smelly kitchen 
  2. Prevent Diseases at home
  3. Throw your rubbish bin every 9-10 days with EnviroDryer
  4. Spend less on bin bags and save money 
  5. Consumes ONLY up to 0.8 kWh per cycle (3 DHS (<1 USD) per month assuming 30 cycles per month)
  6. Clean, Convenient and Safe Environment
  7. Reduce Carbon Footprint 
  8. Reduce Water Footprint 
  9. Reduce Food Waste to Landfill by 90% 
  10. Greener and safer place for our next generation 
  11. Converts Food Waste into high quality byproduct  

Your EnviroDryer will need ?

  1. Electricity: Simply plug into your socket and you are ready to #GoGreen 
  2. Replace your filters every 3-6 months as desired (Optional) to maintain no odor 

Why Pledge Now? 

  1. Save up to 40% off retail price 
  2. Be the first to own EnviroDryer in the Middle-east; own the newest in pragmatic and disruptive sustainable innovation and technology
  3. Take back control of your environmental footprint by minimizing your family’s methane emissions, waste production, and fossil fuel consumption
  4. Prevent Diseases of all sorts from reaching out to your human body 
  5.  With your support, we will be able to streamline production, reducing the cost to make it accessible to households and communities everywhere
  6. You can also donate Industrial EnviroDryer to non-profit organizations who support meaningful development efforts in under-served communities.

Rewards 


Our Vision 

Our vision is to spread knowledge and raise awareness about the issue that we are facing in today's world. Minimal solutions can solve maximal problems. 
The entity will be based in Masdar City Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. Following some great support from the region, we will be able to distribute Household EnviroDryer and Industrial EnviroDryer across the Middle-East. 
On the other hand, with the aid of our partners, supporters from USA, UK and Europe can still contribute on this platform. 

Timeline

Technical Specifications 


Installation: Standalone System, meaning, just plug it in and it is ready to go!

Power Consumption: 0.5 kWh 

Processing time: 3 hours on average 

Product Weight: 9 kg 

Dimensions: 270(W) x 300(D) x 350(H)

Power Voltage 220-240 V:Three pin British system 

Replacement Filters: Approximately 3-6 months depending on frequency of use and the organic food waste being digested. Filters are only replaced to promote odorless conditions.

Team #GoGreen 


FAQ

Q: Do I need electricity to operate the EnviroDryer ? 
A: Yes, just plug in the EnviroDryer into your socket and you will be ready to #GoGreen

Q: How long does it take for my organic food to be safe to dispose?
A:  2-3 Hours depending on the food waste. 

Q: Can I use more than once cycle per day?
A: Yes! You can use as many cycles as necessary 

Q: How loud is the product while in operation?
A: Almost noiseless

Q: Do I need to activate the system initially? 
A: No! Just plug the device into the socket of your house and you are ready to start! 

Q: How much waste can the EnviroDryer consumer per cycle?
A: Up to 4 kg per cycle. Which will reduce your food waste to 0.4 kg.

Q: The end product (what is left from the cycle), does it smell bad? 
A: The biomass (end-product) is completely odorless and safe to either store or dispose. 

Q: What can I do with the end-product ?
A: You can either use it as animal feed or use it as a high efficiency fertilizer 

Q: What is the mixture ratio of the fertilizer-to-soil ? 
A: According to certified research, 1:10 is the most ideal and effective ratio. This means, 1 part of the end-product produced with the EnviroDryer should be mixed with 10 parts of normal soil. 
For example, if you obtain 1 kg of end-product from the EnviroDryer, mix it with 10 kg of soil to produce the fastest and freshest organic fruit and vegetable. 

Q: The fruit and vegetables produced, are they organic ?
A: Yes! 100% organic fruit and vegetables. 

Q: I do not live in a spacious environment, hence I cannot use the end-product as a fertilizer or animal feed, what other alternative can I use ?
A: The EnviroDryer destroys all pathogens and bacteria present in organic waste. So the end-product is completely odorless which does not deteriorate or decompose further. Since the food waste is reduced by 90% you will produce less waste in general, giving you ease from the following: 
1. Throwing your garbage bin on a daily basis
2. Preventing all sorts of diseases that can be generated at home
3. Using less bin bags, saving money 
4. No more smelly kitchen 
5. Future regulations of reducing waste at household level 

Q: Is the EnviroDryer Safe ? 
A: Yes! Completely safe and is also ISO certified with many other safety awards.

Q: Does the EnviroDryer come with a warranty? 

A: Yes. EnviroDryer comes with a 12 month product warranty. 


Q: In terms of electricity consumption, how much will it cost me to run the EnviroDryer ?

A: The electricity consumption is almost negligible 0.5-0.8 kWh per cycle. That is an additional 8 AED per month or 3 USD. 


Q: What is the service life of the EnviroDryer? 

A: The service life is 10 years.

story:
It is a cool and pleasant summer evening. 

You leave the bedroom windows open to enjoy some fresh air during your sleep.  A silent rain steals in.  And ruins your carpet. 

In your frustration, you think, there has to be a good way to keep the rain out, but let the fresh air in. 

And that was the genesis of the Dry Open Window, because that's exactly what happened to the inventor Zack.  It was the first step of a thousand-mile journey. 

Along the way, company executives, engineers schooled at MIT, Ohio State, Michigan, and Wisconsin, and many others came to help. Why?  Because they believe in the green idea.  The great SPARK of Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti MI granted us thousands of dollars to assist in patent application. 

The Dry Open Window acronym is DOW, and our team also take it to mean Do One Wonder.  We worked to make the impossible possible - let fresh air in but keep the rain out.  

   

This is a simple idea, but it's simply great.  In test after test, the Dry Open Window defied rainy weather with winds whipping up to 50 miles an hour.  

  • It lets fresh air in, but keeps the rain out.  
  • It lets you sleep in comfortable privacy in fresh air in the evening. 
  • It is easily adjustable to fit in almost any windows.
  • It has a twist lock that secures it in place. 
  • It saves you energy by avoiding the use of an air conditioner because it lets cool fresh air in - rain or shine. 

The Dry Open Window has a set of V-shaped louvers spaced from each other just so, allowing air to flow through, but stopping rain drops from coming in. The overlapping louvers also give you privacy because no one can peer through the overlapping louvers even as air flows in.

      

Its design has been aided and tested in a wind tunnel by engineers trained at MIT, Ohio State, Michigan, and Wisconsin.  Dennis Nash, an MIT grad, is eager to talk about the Dry Open Window below:

Under the watchful eyes of well trained engineers, we have tested it in real rainy weather.  We can honestly tell you, it works! See the Dry Open Window in Action:


For every Dry Open Window we send out to the world, we plant a tree for you and the world.  We do this in the spirit of Do One Wonder. It may be a small wonder, but a wonder it still is.  And we hope the small wonders will gather force like a forest, blossoming into a bigger wonder of millions of trees. And it all starts with your tree, a small wonder.  

We work with the world-renowned Arbor Day Foundation to make it happen. We have, in fact, already planted a multitude of trees in the Choccolocco State Forest in Alabama through the sales of the Dry Open Window, as evidenced in the link and pictures below, where trees are being planted.  

  

We are proud to be a part of the Arbor Day Choccolocco State Forest tree-planting project, which has huge impacts on the environment, as shown below.

        

https://www.arborday.org/programs/replanting/action/forests/2016/choccolocco-state-forest.pdf

Our goal is simple: reduce our carbon footprint at both ends: 

  • By using the Dry Open Window, you use less energy while enjoying fresh air.
  • By planting more trees, you improve the fresh air we breathe in. 

We think this is a win-win strategy that works marvelously.  We simply make it possible for you to Do One Wonder - you grow a tree for the world while you enjoy fresh air, use less energy, and save money.

It is the peace of mind we aim for: sleep in fresh air comfort and secured privacy, and do something to green our beloved earth and refresh our precious air.  We like to think you will love this state of mind and take part in our movement. We have done our part, so would you help by doing your part, for yourself and Mother Earth? 

Please pick one of the perks, help us to save our planet, and enjoy some fresh air and your privacy at the same time.


What You Get and What We Do for You and the World

To plant a tree for the world and secure your Dry Open Window,  the perk is yours at a mere $49 (a 30% discount of our retail price). 

You then will have contributed to make the world just a little greener. 

In return, you will receive a Dry Open Window - aesthetically pleasing, super functional, a breeze to assemble, and easy to use.  

  

It almost assembles itself - no tools are needed.  Our smart design also makes it impossible to assemble it wrong.  We poke-yoked it, as the engineers would call it.  Seriously, look it up! 

And because of the smart design, you will find it super easy to use.  It fits in almost any single-hung or double-hung window (the kind that slides open up and down), snuggling into window widths from 20 inches to 38 inches. 

And we have a twist lock rod for you to lock the device up so it cannot be removed from the outside.  The intuitive twist lock takes no effort to use. 

    

For our part, when you get your perk, the earth gets its own perk because of you - we will plant a tree.  And we will let the world know that you planted a tree by recording it in our permanent registry of the Dry Open Window Forest Builders.  

Click here to see the growing list of Forest Builders in the Dry Open Window Forest Builders permanent registry

You can share just a first name or your whole life history at the registry.  We want you to be proud, because you should be.  You can always wander on back to see your name there, show it off to your friends, and point it out to your children. And the earth and its inhabitants will be grateful. 

Your contribution, along with contributions from others, will let a tree take root, extend its leaves, absorb carbon dioxide, clean up the air, and rejuvenate the world with fresh oxygen.  

Your funds will be sent to the Arbor Day Foundation, the tree experts, as they plant the trees for us and the world in forests all over the nation.  We will showcase their work at our permanent Dry Open Window Forest Builders registry whenever progress is made, so you can see pictures of the trees planted, the forests established, and the landscape rejuvenated. While the registry is not maintained by the Arbor Day Foundation, but by the Dry Open Window website, we keep in constant touch with the Arbor Day Foundation and will make every effort to keep you abreast of all the wonderful things the Arbor Day Foundation does.


Still not convinced?  Read more! 

The Impact 

So, how does your action impact you and the world? Your action will Do One Wonder for yourself and the world. 

Let's first start with you and your health.  Fresh air means better health for you.  Did you know that indoor air is many times worse than the air outside?

According to the EPA, our indoor environment is more than five times more toxic than our outdoor environment.  Sometimes the air measurements indoors have been found to be 100 times more polluted.

 

Why wouldn't you want fresh air streaming inside your room or house?  Would you rather breathe in the heavily polluted air all day and all night? The Dry Open Window comes to your rescue, even when it is raining cats and dogs outside. 

Furthermore, a household on average spends over $500 a year on air conditioning. Your payback on this little investment is almost instantaneous. You should not hesitate for a second to pick up a perk. 

On top of that, you reduce your carbon footprint by reducing the use of electricity. That is more important than savings on your electric bill.  This is lending a helping hand to green Mother Earth.

When we plant a tree for you and the world, the trees will give off fresh air.  Why fresh air?

  • Fresh air saves lives - trees use photosynthesis to turn carbon dioxide into the oxygen we need to breathe; trees remove pollution from the air, making it healthier for us to take into our lungs.
  • It can boost your immune system - walking amongst trees will give you exercise and feed you fresh air, leading to an increase in natural killer cells, neutrophils and monocytes, which ultimately increases immune function.
  • The smells in fresh air bust stress and increase happiness - smell of roses promotes relaxation; lavender and jasmine lower anxiety and up your mood; scent of pine trees decreases stress and increases relaxation; a whiff of freshly cut grass can help you feel calmer and happier. 
  • Fresh oxygen energizes - spending time in fresh air, surrounded by nature, increases energy in 90% of people.

Easy Assembly

You might be intimidated by assembly.  But don't you sweat it.  

  • First, no tools are required. 
  • Second, a child can put it together.
  • Third, no instructions are really needed.  We have included instructions, but you will see instructions are barely needed

Here is a fun video of our MIT and Michigan engineers trying to assemble our first production Dry Open Window without instructions.  Our users have told us that the assembly is a breeze. 

OK, here is the real assembly instructions video:

Other Ways You Can Help

If you say, I'd rather have a wet and soggy carpet in rainy weather, we say, okay, fine, good luck. But, just in case, if you smartly opt to improve the air we breathe in and to green the earth with us, here is your opportunity to help by picking up this perk: if you donate $5, we guarantee you that we will plant a tree for you.  And your name will be registered in the same permanent Dry Open Window Forest Builders registry.  

And you can still show it off to your friends, children, colleagues, or even strangers who will then become your friends. The earth will be just as grateful. Your tree will be just as green.  The air is just a little fresher.  And the earth just a little greener.

You are then a friend of the earth.  Live on and enjoy!

Share with Others

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:

  • Please share it on your Facebook - show a picture of it in your window in rainy weather; brag about how it brings in fresh air; or even do a little video to tout how miraculously it stops the rain from coming in but welcomes in the fresh air. 

  • We hope you can email the wonders of this little device to 5 friends - tell them if they use it, they will love it, and how they can help to green the earth.

  • Tweet about it - it is always a good thing to use a Dry Open Window and have a tree planted for the world. 

Weather Caution

Warning!  In severe thunderstorms or hurricanes, when winds threaten to pick up your house and the rain comes down in sheets, we ask you to take the Dry Open Window out of the window and close the window for your safety.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We ask you to share the story of the Dry Open Window and tell them how cool, functional, and green it is. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools right at your finger tips.
  • Go on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and every other channel to chat about us.  We love our story to be told.  We want the earth to get greener, and we cannot get there without your help!
  • With your help, this green planet of ours will just get a little greener, thanks to you!
  • Tell them about our quirky line: Fresh air in, rain out; peeping Toms pout!

We are a proud partner of the 60-million tree organization:

We welcome you to help plant the 60 million and 1 tree.
Do One Wonder - DOW - Dry Open Window
story_txt:
It is a cool and pleasant summer evening. 
You leave the bedroom windows open to enjoy some fresh air during your sleep.  A silent rain steals in.  And ruins your carpet. 
In your frustration, you think, there has to be a good way to keep the rain out, but let the fresh air in. 
And that was the genesis of the Dry Open Window, because that's exactly what happened to the inventor Zack.  It was the first step of a thousand-mile journey. 
Along the way, company executives, engineers schooled at MIT, Ohio State, Michigan, and Wisconsin, and many others came to help. Why?  Because they believe in the green idea.  The great SPARK of Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti MI granted us thousands of dollars to assist in patent application. 
The Dry Open Window acronym is DOW, and our team also take it to mean Do One Wonder.  We worked to make the impossible possible - let fresh air in but keep the rain out.  
   

This is a simple idea, but it's simply great.  In test after test, the Dry Open Window defied rainy weather with winds whipping up to 50 miles an hour.  


It lets fresh air in, but keeps the rain out.  

It lets you sleep in comfortable privacy in fresh air in the evening. 
It is easily adjustable to fit in almost any windows.

It has a twist lock that secures it in place. 


It saves you energy by avoiding the use of an air conditioner because it lets cool fresh air in - rain or shine. 



The Dry Open Window has a set of V-shaped louvers spaced from each other just so, allowing air to flow through, but stopping rain drops from coming in. The overlapping louvers also give you privacy because no one can peer through the overlapping louvers even as air flows in.

      
Its design has been aided and tested in a wind tunnel by engineers trained at MIT, Ohio State, Michigan, and Wisconsin.  Dennis Nash, an MIT grad, is eager to talk about the Dry Open Window below:
Under the watchful eyes of well trained engineers, we have tested it in real rainy weather.  We can honestly tell you, it works! See the Dry Open Window in Action:

It may be a small wonder, but a wonder it still is.  And we hope the small wonders will gather force like a forest, blossoming into a bigger wonder of millions of trees.
