story:
Lets Keep It Simple:

Sea level is rising and it is not going to stop!  To island and developing nations this is a threat to unique cultures, families, ways of life, and the future economic systems of a people’s basic sustainability/survivability. 

Yet, there are important things we can do right now to help.  As we mapped Mars for water and minerals, we do the same ‘one-nation-at-a-time’ here on earth for the benefit of the peoples who live there.

The people who live on small islands (and any nation with a coastline) need your/our help to establish both a national drinking water inventory. They also need your/our help to model where rising seas impact their nation, culture, and economy, giving them their own “National Data Sovereignty” and help smash “Digital-Poverty.”

Now lets add-in a majority of our planet’s population is under threat by rising seas, water shortages, and a changing climate.  We all need the best data possible.

·  We want two island nations to be (scientifically proven) the first in the world with a National Water Inventory.  This will greatly aid their future economic status.

·  We want two island nations to become the ‘First Carbon Neutral Nations on the Planet.’ The only thing preventing these nations becoming Carbon Neutral is a planetary data both scientists and Wall Street agree on. 

This is DIGITIZE-A-NATIONTM

The Technical Overview of Digitize-a-Nation:

Every nation is a system-of-systems, from the infrastructure networks that provide food, power, water and information, to the commodity networks of farms and mineral resources. Mapping as if each nation is its own planet, these elements can all be meshed into a single national economic system that provides both balance and a plan for its people’s sustainable development.  Digitize-a-Nation is this first network vivisection that provides ‘information as infrastructure’ to national policy makers to best determine Environmentally Sustainable Growth (ESG) via sustainable investing and effective risk management.

The Non-Technical Overview of Digitize-a-Nation:

We rocket scientists can map a small country as its own planet, give the data to its people, and let them build their future with new tools, and let the people who live there create the nation they think best for their needs and dreams. 

Ok, So What’s the problem? 

In most small and developing nations, policy leaders make decisions using incomplete or outdated national data.  The lack of a sovereign data network let big nations and multinational corporations negotiate with ‘Data Superiority’ over a small nation’s economic future.  This is unfair, and can lead to national bullying of small and developing nations by others. It is their nation, it should be their data.

Ok, So what might a solution be? 

In order for the local island people to manage where sea-level rise is changing the physical and economic environment, the government and the indigenous communities need their own interactive networked sovereign planetary database meshed with Wall Street economics to build their sustainable future. Leaders need National Data Sovereignty.

The network is designed to empower: 

·  A national inventory can become a national identity.

·  A new access to information and applications.

·  Data Sovereignty can be a national treasure.

·  Proactive Risk Management improves microcredit and new business.

·  Improve National Sovereign Credit Rating.

·  Create a new National Water Inventory.

·  Create a new National Coastal Monitoring 24/7.

·  Expanding Environmentally Sustainable Investment Networking.

·  Improving Sustainable Economics to Existing Business.

·  Education, Training, New Employment, engaging an entire population.

·  Create a Minerals, Mining, Earth Commodities Inventory.

·  Create an Energy and Infrastructure Inventory with breathable visual maps.

·  Commercial Agriculture Inventory and Commodity networking.

·  Planetary mapping of Geothermal/Wind/Solar/Tide mapping.

·  Complete Marine Environment Inventory Mapping/Monitoring.

·  New Digital Shepherding and remote monitoring of indigenous animal populations.

·  Eco-Tourism and Citizen Scientist applications with iPLANT.

·  Education at all levels, especially engaging girls to technology.

The success of this project not only empowers the lives of people and sustainability topics yet also prove the viability of local data networks.

Their Value Proposition

Every day small/developing nations pay hidden risk fees to currency and commodity markets, that better data would eliminate and reverse inflationary costs of risk across each nation, and better engage its population into digital systems, micro-economics and new markets.  A Digitized nation’s GDP should increase 3% the first year, recovering the cost of the Digitize program.  In 3-years, a Digitized nation should see +10% in GDP, plus data as a commodity, should become its own income generator.  A public/private-partnership should also stimulate new information networked to business, education, and training.

Why do we list as Entrepreneur not Community?

Working towards a ‘Franchise’ type model, we want the people of a Digitized nation to make money and build new businesses from their own data set; and encourage each nation build a ‘public-private-partnership’ between its sovereign leadership, its academic, and business community.  Let them be the Entrepreneurs with this data.

ABOUT US

Digitize-a-Nation is an LLC based in Washington DC founded and directed by Andrew Cameron and William Brammer both who really like planet earth and all the people here.  Planet earth has more roller-coasters than all the other planets combined.  We need to take the space tools we have and make them work for everyone on the planet, especially those in small and developing nations. 

At Digitize-a-Nation we are using the most advanced SuperComputers to develop a new approach that network satellite data with Wall Street to benefit those on this planet who need help the most.  Fighting Poverty and cultivating long-term sustainable practices begins with empowering the communities living there actually begin with data. Its how we map planets, its how we help our own.

We have collaboration with the Space Agencies, top science, top explorers and oceanographers, top supercomputer people, top economists, and of course a bunch of very fun rocket scientists.  We are serious about what we can do!!

Ok, What We Need from You

We need to get a science plane in the air and collect planetary data and put it into a SuperComputer.  Simple, however airplanes and supercomputers cost money.  The first step will cost $440,000 and help us get the World Bank and Wall Street to cover the rest.  However, the value return for the island nation can be in the tens of millions over time, reducing risk with better data, better their lives, and better their interaction with New Environmentally Sustainable Investing.



To fulfill our 2015 promises to the island nations and keep their data program protected, we need to charter a specialized sensor aircraft, collect that data, buy supercomputer time and create a new data model and connect to a network.  Your donation will go directly to chartering the satellite simulator aircraft and data infrastructure that allows us to put Planetary data into a SuperComputer ‘point cloud’ and made available for the needs of the people, the needs of the nation, and become a new model for the planet. 

Once you the visionary supporters, the people of the islands, the rocket scientists, and we at Digitize-a-Nation have this first mission accomplished, Wall Street will understand economics work better with Planetary data from the nation itself, and then World Bank among other international institutions should begin to fund the needs for more island nations, more developing nations, and ultimately all nation’s water and a sustainable economic future. 

But this can only happen with your help!

2015 Minimum budget

You can help in two ways:

1. Please Donate Here Today! Help us fund this big and challenging, sustainable project.  (If you were/are a Scout feel free to include your troop/den number, or if a student, include your teacher/school name)

2. Spread the word!Tell your friends about this opportunity. Please call a friend, share our campaign link on Facebook and other social media.

Only by working together can we better the only planet we have,

one-nation-at-a-time.

From all of us at Digitize-a-Nation

Thank You

for making a difference!

and

Thank You

to our

space/science/technology/economic

collaborators and supporting organizations!

The Perks: Now 

A Monument to Vision.  No T-shirts, as all money goes to rent the airplane and supercomputer time to crunch numbers, and build the first Digitize model.  Every contributing visionary will get their names etched into a monument to be placed on the island built by local artists.  There will also be an “on-line” monument, which our designers say will be very very cool. 



The Perks: Later 

Though Not Right Away, if we can get this started, maybe 6 months after the first flight and first data, our team likes the idea of having a Big Virtual Party to connect the first visionaries and all the people on the islands in a one hour monster chat room to say hello to everyone.  Lets use the supercomputers and make a world of friends!!  Lets let other people far away from us that we care about them and that their issues matter to us.

a Minerals, Mining, Earth Commodities Inventory.
· 
Create
an Energy and Infrastructure Inventory with breathable visual maps.
· 
Commercial
Agriculture Inventory and Commodity networking.
· 
Planetary
mapping of Geothermal/Wind/Solar/Tide mapping.
· 
Complete
Marine Environment Inventory Mapping/Monitoring.
·  New Digital Shepherding and remote
monitoring of indigenous animal populations.
· 
Eco-Tourism
and Citizen Scientist applications with iPLANT.
· 
Education
at all levels, especially engaging girls to technology.
The success of this project not only
empowers the lives of people and sustainability topics yet also prove the
viability of local data networks. 
Their Value Proposition
Every day small/developing nations
pay hidden risk fees to currency and commodity markets, that better data would
eliminate and reverse inflationary costs of risk across each nation, and better
engage its population into digital systems, micro-economics and new
markets.  A Digitized nation’s GDP should
increase 3% the first year, recovering the cost of the Digitize program.  In 3-years, a Digitized nation should see
+10% in GDP, plus data as a commodity, should become its own income
generator.  A public/private-partnership
should also stimulate new information networked to business, education, and
training.
Why do we list as Entrepreneur not Community?
Working towards a
‘Franchise’ type model, we want the people of a Digitized nation to make money
and build new businesses from their own data set; and encourage each nation
build a ‘public-private-partnership’ between its sovereign leadership, its
academic, and business community.  Let
them be the Entrepreneurs with this data.
ABOUT US
Digitize-a-Nation is an LLC based in
Washington DC founded and directed by Andrew Cameron and William Brammer both
who really like planet earth and all the people here.  Planet earth has more roller-coasters than
all the other planets combined.  We need
to take the space tools we have and make them work for everyone on the planet,
especially those in small and developing nations.  
At Digitize-a-Nation we are using the
most advanced SuperComputers to develop a new approach that network satellite
data with Wall Street to benefit those on this planet who need help the
most.  Fighting Poverty and cultivating
long-term sustainable practices begins with empowering the communities living
there actually begin with data. Its how we map planets, its how we help
our own.
We have
collaboration with the Space Agencies, top science, top explorers and
oceanographers, top supercomputer people, top economists, and of course a bunch
of very fun rocket scientists.  We are
serious about what we can do!!
Ok, What We Need from You
We need to get a
science plane in the air and collect planetary data and put it into a
SuperComputer.  Simple, however airplanes
and supercomputers cost money.  The first
step will cost $440,000 and help us get the World Bank and Wall Street to cover
the rest.  However, the value return for
the island nation can be in the tens of millions over time, reducing risk with better data, better their lives,
and better their interaction with New Environmentally Sustainable Investing.






To fulfill our 2015 promises to the
island nations and keep their data program protected, we need to charter a
specialized sensor aircraft, collect that data, buy supercomputer time and
create a new data model and connect to a network.  Your donation will go directly to chartering
the satellite simulator aircraft and data infrastructure that allows us to put
Planetary data into a SuperComputer ‘point cloud’ and made available for the
needs of the people, the needs of the nation, and become a new model for the
planet.  
Once you the visionary supporters,
the people of the islands, the rocket scientists, and we at Digitize-a-Nation
have this first mission accomplished, Wall Street will understand economics
work better with Planetary data from the nation itself, and then World Bank
among other international institutions should begin to fund the needs for more
island nations, more developing nations, and ultimately all nation’s water and
a sustainable economic future.  
But this can only happen with your
help!
2015 Minimum budget

You can help in two ways:
1. Please
Donate Here Today! Help us fund this big and challenging, sustainable
project.  (If you were/are a Scout feel
free to include your troop/den number, or if a student, include your
teacher/school name)
2.
Spread the word!Tell your friends about this
opportunity. Please call a friend, share our campaign link on Facebook and
other social media.

Only
by working together can we better the only planet we have, 
one-nation-at-a-time.
From
all of us at Digitize-a-Nation
Thank
You
for
making a difference!
and
Thank
You
to
our
space/science/technology/economic
collaborators
and supporting organizations!
The Perks: Now  
A Monument to Vision.  No T-shirts, as all money goes to rent the
airplane and supercomputer time to crunch numbers, and build the first Digitize
model.  Every contributing visionary will
get their names etched into a monument to be placed on the island built by
local artists.  There will also be an “on-line”
monument, which our designers say will be very very cool.  


The Perks: Later  

Though Not Right Away,
if we can get this started, maybe 6 months after the first flight and first
data, our team likes the idea of having a Big Virtual Party to connect the
first visionaries and all the people on the islands in a one hour monster chat
room to say hello to everyone.  Lets use
the supercomputers and make a world of friends!!  Lets let other people far away from us that
we care about them and that their issues matter to us.

story:
Save the bees, save the World!


Sounds challenging, right ? Every project of our starts with that kind of challenge. 
This is me in the middle, and my friends. All of us are biology students at METU, Turkey. (Except the two guy near to me. They are statisticians, we need someone to count the money :P)


It always starts with a problem. What was ours ? Oh, yes, I remembered. Bees are starting to get sicked, get lost and died in worldwide. 

Then, it continues with a question. How can we prevent this problem ? We asked that questions 2 years ago, as a part of our project to iGEM (International Genetically Engineered Machine) competition. We did a project called THE BEE SUBTILIS, catchy, right? We got some results, joined the competition, won some rewards. You know, like science fairs in high schools, but a much larger one. 

Real story started after the end of the competition. After 2 years of iGEM experience, I started to realize something. When someone says biotechnology, what do you think ? Mostly medicine, GMO foods and maybe sometimes robotics, right ?


However, I realized something else. In biotechnology, nearly everything is possible, everything is doable. The real question is can ''YOU'' do it ? With some education and imagination, yes we said yes we can. You can create, computers, batteries, filters, light sources, paintings, decorations, basic components, and much much more. It's like playing minecraft, if you know it.

So after this realization, me and 6 of my friends who have the same idea, started a group and established a little company. 
So, our first goal is building a prototype for our much more developed Bee Subtilis projects and mass produce it.

So, what is this Bee Subtilis ? How it will save the bees ?


Bees are the most important organisms for the pollination of plants, especially agricultural crops. However due to insecticides, parasitic fungis, bacterias and enviromental changes, they are now showing abnormal behaviours and eventually dies. ( http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0006481 ). This phenomena called as Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD) and really important problem in whole world, but especially in  USA and Turkey. 


We are designed a project by using synthetic biology, and created a mutualist bacteria that will protect bees against imidacloprid (one of the most common insecticide material) and reinforce bees immune system. 


We found an specialized gene sequence named as CYP6G1 from Drosophila melanogaster (Fruit Fly), which is confirmed as giving immunity against imidacloprid to flies. (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15245421, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17912692)

We designed a special gene circuit which contains a strong constitutive promoter and CYP6G1 gene. First we will create this gene sequence, then we will transfer this circuit to a mutualist bacteria, which lives at bees gut, Bacillus subtilis.


B. subtilis will synthesis this protein continuously and this protein will give immunity against imidacloprid to bees.

In addition, we also designed another circuit, which improves bees natural immune system, by producing p-coumaric acid. Unfortunately bees couldn't get p-coumaric acid from their food, because of the modern feeding systems, so their immune systems get weaker. We try to stop this event with our project.

We add a kill-switch mechanism to our system, in case of our engineered bacteria escape from bees and spread to the environment. If this happens, our kill-switch mechanism in bacteria starts to work and kill the bacteria. ''Safety first''.

Voila! Now you have the Bee Subtilis and with the help of this we finally summon THE SUPER BEE!!!



In the end, our project will save the bees and all of us can eat more honey. Win-win, right ?

Our goal and what we need

This was our first project, first step to the road, which leads to a world nearly everything is possible. We already have more projects we wanted to do after we make our compony steady. Like, infinite batteries or transportable water cleaners or food freshness detectors, and many more.
We need fundings because these kind of technologies are fairly new to us, the human kind. So, it is little bit expensive (we need mostly laboratory equipments), but with the help of you, our contributors, we are sure that we can succeed. 
We can't offer you much, anything than our deeply thanks for now. However, if you wish, you can contact us and if we will succeed we can send you some samples for free.

Final Words

So, thats it. I hope you liked our project. We are waiting for your contributions. You can also help us not only with funds, but by also spreading the word, sharing your thoughts, helping us to improve. We always think, these kind of helps are much more important than funds to us. We appreciate every kind of help you can give. 
So, thank you and have a wonderful life.

story:
A Short Summary

BC’s “Dead” Pine Forests Are Not So Dead After All! 

With one billion or more pine trees in BC killed as a result of the mountain pine beetle not including many states in the USA,  made more ferocious by warmer temperatures, many scientists believe a significant line has been crossed. Forests that once stored carbon are now major sources of greenhouse gas emissions. Nature’s carbon bomb, as it were.

How many articles have you read about Global Warming or CO2 emissions polluting our atmosphere?  I’ve read them all, and have reached a point in my life that I would prefer to do something positive for our planet instead of just talking about it. My name is Jan Olivier and I’m seeking your help to start reclaiming our earth, one step at a time. Over my many years as an International business executive, I’ve learned multiple times in solving problems that there is typically an abundance of talk and very little action. I’m deeply concerned about the health of our planet and have found a new, patented technology in Austria that can trap up to  100% of harmful CO2 emissions at their source and prevent it escaping into our atmosphere.

 

  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tYQQvz7EA5w

I have spent three years researching and comparing every type of technology in this field, and I have come to the conclusion that this technology is by far head and shoulders above all others. This technology has a wide variety of significant applications, I live in beautiful British Columbia, Canada and I plan to start my initiative to save the earth right here. I plan to take the millions of tons of waste wood that is in our forests  (millions of hectares of beetle kill) and in the cities

           

(hundreds of thousands of tons of waste construction lumber that end up in our land fills) and process it through this new gasification technology, not incineration, no Co2 emissions and create high-grade bio-diesel and charcoal briquettes for the First Nation people of Canada in the USA and third world countries.

I have invested personally three years and hundreds of thousands of dollars in this initiative, but I need approximately $350,000 more to complete the preparation for a lease to have the first product shipped and installed here in B.C. I understand the amount I am asking to raise is significant, but I also know the value of stopping CO2 emissions and helping the First Nations people by far overrides the cost, I am committed, the mere fact that I have spent all this time and money on it should speak for itself.


With success of this project we can acquire additional CO2 elimination products and expand to serve Native North American people, first Canada then the USA and even third world countries where there is abundant waste wood . Imagine improving the lives of indigenous people in North America, the third world countries and at the same time improve the health of Mother Earth for generations to come.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me be candid. I don't want $350,000 to invent something or try something. I need $350,000 to do something. The funds will be used Spartanly to complete the initial planning details to install a 500Kg per hour plant, this plant will process waste lumber with the end products being Charcoal and biodiesel, this plant is modular so I feel for this first one at 500Kg per hour is the right model that can be portable so we can move it to any site and demonstrate its uniqueness.

                                                  

The 500Kg  plant would operate 8050 hours per year and produce 1,500 tons of charcoal and 450,000 liters of biodiesel per year. The plant is low maintenance  as it has very few moving parts and operates at low temperatures. 

This technology has been developed by a European company, The successful negotiations to obtain rights to represent them throughout the Americas are complete.

The European company has agreed to come in for up to 50% of the cost of each plant, I plan to install the first unit in British Columbia Canada to help the indigenous First Nation people economically while eliminating  methane and CO2 emissions and reducing global warming. 

You can help make this a realty through your participation. I am offering some traditional crowd funding incentives for your contribution. Although not a formal business yet, and recognizing that in time this may be a significant business and I cannot offer equity shares for this type of investment... I offer an additional incentive for your contribution. 

Two years from the date of your participation, I will donate (in your name) 100% of your funding amount to the charity of your choice before any profits are taken from the business at that time. Think of it! You can help start an initiative that will help indigenous people, reduce global warming AND as a result have 100% of your funding returned to the charity of your choice. 

The time to help is now!   If not you, who?  If not now, when?

The Impact

There are millions of tons of waste wood available on First Nations reservations. This waste wood is the core resource to provide jobs and a new source of income to First Nation communities, and reduce global warming by converting it into usable products. My vision is to form a First Nations co-op that will market the charcoal and bio-diesel to wholesale or retail outlets. 

The technology we will install from Europe will convert this waste wood, that is passively emitting CO2 into the environment, into products commodities, such as charcoal for barbecuing and agriculture use as well as high quality bio-diesel.

The high quality bio-diesel produces is sulfur free and its production does not take any land that would otherwise be used for food crops as traditional bio-diesel producers do.

Once the first portable unit is up and operating it can then be relocated to different areas of the Reservation, to clean up other waste wood locations. This is a winning situation for First Nation communities and our environment. 

Re-mediating the problem

Important details of the patented technology we will bring to BC are:

  • It is pollution free
  • It is NOT incineration, it is a closed loop, flame less gasification system
  • It is installed and working in Europe
  • It traps harmful CO2 emissions and converts them to usable commercial commodities
  • It reduces Global Warming while providing jobs and commerce. 

Risks & Challenges

From a management control perspective I have identified a small team of seasoned business people to operate the initiative with transparency, especially for review/audits by the First Nation people. The risks I face are not in the technology, which is proven in existing European locations. It's primarily in covering about three months of initial operating costs until revenue returns from outputs to fuel continued operations. I have established potential investors who would consider a bridge loan to the business should that situation arise, however my planning indicates the need for a bridge loan is less than 20%. 

My biggest challenge is just to complete this contribution request on Indiegogo as it will allow me to start my plans.   

                   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're reading this, surely you can afford a small contribution, but if not... you still can help by asking your friends and family if they would visit this site and learn about this important opportunity with so many benefits to societyse about your campaign.

Indiegogo also has share tools that you can use to 'spread the word!

Remember: We don't inherit the earth from our ancestors... We borrow it from our children... and you can help pay it back!

story:
Puretergent’s fun tapped pouch can be even MORE sustainable! The great news is that our pouches, which use 75% less plastic than the average laundry bottle, can be converted back into diesel fuel and kept out of the waste stream completely. Help us collect and convert our pouches back into energy and eliminate plastic waste from the laundry washcycle. Pre-paid mailers and collection bins at retailers will close the  loop on puretergent's new clean for the 21st century. 

    

visit www.puretergent.com



                     


        Quirky, but loveable upside down laundry pouch needs a ride home!

                                Puretergent wants its used pouches back!  

           

visit www.puretergent.com

Americans discard 1 BILLION laundry jugs each year.

And only 9% get re-purchased for post-consumer content because supply outstrips demand. Waste Management recycling centers don't collect #7 pouches: too many different types, all requiring distinct processing. Help us raise the money so we can get them converted ourselves, using pre-paid mailers, and collection bins!


       

There Are Two Ways to Help:

1. Donate! We've got some great perks and the money we raise will help us print pre-paid reclamation envelopes (see above), install reclamation bins (like the one below) in select retail locations, and start a reclamation pilot program in one lucky city's recycling plant!

2. Pre-order Puretergent's Laundry Basket! Puretergent's "laundry basket" is a subscription service customized for your household and includes an online custom re-ordering tool and an emergency panic button, for those help! laundry emergency days. Choose your subscription level: from one to 12 months and customize your formula assortment and quantity according to your laundry needs. You can also order subscriptions for multiple households—a great gift for new parents or sensitive skin families. Our laundry formulas arrive each month on your doorstep with a reclaim prepaid postage mailer included. When you're done with a pouch, you just mail it back to us!

Why Puretergent?

Puretergent doesn't contain any of the 20 known carcinogens in laundry formulas: no fillers, or dyes, or optical brighteners, no chlorine, NPE's, APE's or sodium laurel sulfate. Puretergent is all greywater safe, which means that every drop of wash water can be reused for landscaping. (The average person in the US uses 4,500 gallons of water a year—imagine if we could put all that water to good use?) Plus it costs less than other “green” formulas at $13.99 for 50 washes (which, in case you’re not a math wiz, works out to only 27 cents per load!)


The herbal hypoallergenic formula is kind to your skin (perfect for those with skin sensitivities!) and softens your clothes. It smells like fresh herbs in the machine, yet leaves no lingering scent: Your clothes just smell like clean fabric, and never blow toxic dryer fumes at the neighbors!

Perks

Exclusive Perk: Fresh One for South by Southwest 2015! Limited time only. 

$35 One limited edition Puretergent Pouch T-shirt with 2 Fresh travel samples (for whites and dirty stuff) and a Puretergent sticker + prepaid reclaim mailers.

                           

 

$10  #stopmakingbottles thank you sticker


$25+   Totes (top row) or Laundry Bags (bottom row) are included in most donation levels $25 and over! Just let us know which color you'd like and it's yours!


What We Can Do With the Funds we Raise:

With $10,000, we can print pre-paid reclaim mailers for e-commerce orders.

With $25,000, we can install reclaim bins in existing retail stores.

With $50,000, we can install even more reclaim bins in existing retail stores!

With $75,000, we can start a pouch reclaim pilot program in a city (TBD) recycling plant!

$ Stretch goals: Create an additional city reclaim program at a recycling center, raise awareness about plastic pollution and recycling vs. re-purposing with school outreach contests and education.

Make a Real Impact!
Help us disrupt plastic pollution!  #stopmakingbottles
  • 90%   "Recycled" plastic bottles end up as landfill or dumped at sea.
  • 75%     Less plastic in a pouch vs a bottle. 
  • 44%    Seabirds that have plastic bits ingested 
  • 32          Million tons of plastic waste generated yearly in America
  • 22%     Fish and sea life found with ingested plastic in their stomachs
  • 20         Known carcinogens in mass AND natural laundry formulas
  • 10x       Less emissions than rigid plastic bottles   



Puretergent Challenges

Scent addicts. Smells herbal fresh in the wash, smells like nothing when it's done. We just deliver just soft clean fabric.

Greenwashing. Loads of confusion around 'natural' laundry.

Damaging fabric to clean it.  Many people eat organic but still launder toxic. 

                             

Other Ways You Can Help

No funds to contribute? You can still help! 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and send this campaign to your friends!
story_txt:
Puretergent’s fun tapped pouch can be even MORE sustainable! The great news is that
our pouches, which use 75% less plastic than the average laundry bottle, can be
converted back into diesel fuel and kept out of the waste stream completely. Help us collect and convert our pouches back into energy and eliminate plastic waste from the laundry washcycle. Pre-paid mailers and collection bins at retailers will close the  loop on puretergent's new clean for the 21st century. 



    
visit www.puretergent.com





                     



        Quirky, but loveable upside down laundry pouch needs a ride home!
                                Puretergent wants its used pouches back!  

           
visit www.puretergent.com






Americans discard 1 BILLION laundry jugs each year.


And
only 9% get re-purchased for post-consumer content because supply outstrips
demand. Waste Management recycling centers don't collect #7 pouches: too many different
types, all requiring distinct processing. Help us raise the money so we can get them converted ourselves, using pre-paid mailers, and collection bins!

       
There Are Two Ways to Help:



1. Donate! We've got some great perks and the money we raise will help us print pre-paid reclamation envelopes (see above), install reclamation bins (like the one below) in select retail locations, and start a reclamation pilot program in one lucky city's recycling plant!



2. Pre-order Puretergent's Laundry Basket! Puretergent's
"laundry basket" is a subscription service customized for your
household and includes an online custom re-ordering tool and an emergency panic
button, for those help! laundry emergency days. Choose your subscription level:
from one to 12 months and customize your formula assortment and quantity
according to your laundry needs. You can also order subscriptions for multiple
households—a great gift for new parents or sensitive skin families. Our laundry
formulas arrive each month on your doorstep with a reclaim prepaid postage
mailer included. When you're done with a pouch, you just mail it back to us!





Why
Puretergent?
Puretergent
doesn't contain any of the 20 known carcinogens in laundry
formulas: no
fillers, or dyes, or optical brighteners, no
chlorine, NPE's, APE's or sodium laurel
sulfate. Puretergent is all greywater safe,
which means that every drop of wash water can be
reused for landscaping. (The average person in the US uses 4,500
gallons of water a year—imagine if we could put all that water to good use?) Plus
it costs less than other “green” formulas at $13.99 for 50 washes
(which, in case you’re not a math wiz, works out to only 27 cents per load!)


The
herbal hypoallergenic formula is kind to your skin (perfect for those with skin
sensitivities!) and softens your clothes. It smells like fresh herbs in the
machine, yet leaves no lingering scent: Your clothes just smell like clean
fabric, and never blow toxic dryer fumes at the neighbors!

$35 One limited edition Puretergent Pouch T-shirt with 2 Fresh travel samples (for whites and dirty stuff) and a Puretergent sticker + prepaid reclaim mailers.

and over! Just let us know which color you'd like and it's yours!

With $50,000, we can install even more reclaim bins in existing retail stores!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

PickEco Refills Ltd is Chilliwack’s choice zero waste grocery store, scheduled to open Summer 2018. If we can reach our $8000 contribution goal, PickEco will be purchasing a walk-in cooler. A walk-in cooler will allow us to increase cold storage and ensure that our valued customers have access to a wide range of fresh and affordable products.  A walk-in cooler will allow us to offer:

  • cold foods on tap, think kombucha and tamari.
  • a larger selection of fresh items, like cheese and eggs (or what you plan to store)
  • additional cost savings, since we will be able to purchase products in even larger quantities and pass the savings directly to our customers.

All contributors will receive perks, from high fives to DIY workshops, as a thank you for growing us towards our $8000 goal. Even if we fall short of our goal, any money raised will go towards increasing refrigeration at PickEco because we truly value your access to fresh well-priced products.

Ultimately, we want to ensure we give our customers the products they want, without the packaging they don’t need.

You want to help but you can't contribute?  That's ok!  I understand that not everybody is able to help financially.  Please spread the news "PickEco Refills is coming to Chilliwack, BC!"  We love social media shout outs and good old fashion volunteering.

 

Bring Zero waste shopping to Chilliwack BC.

Have you seen "A Plastic Ocean”?  Have you looked around while driving along Canada's Highways?  We are drowning in single use plastic.  While I encourage everybody to Reduce, Reuse and Recycle, we need more than this to have an impact. We need change and we need it now. Do your part and send less waste to the landfill, start with your groceries and work your way out from there, I promise, its satisfying and doesn't have to be hard.

I have been inspired by other stores in beautiful British Columbia that are giving people options to shop garbage free. "Why not a change in Chilliwack?"   Chilliwack is filled with wide open spaces, trails, rivers, and lakes that all deserve more respect than they are getting.  PickEco is on its way soon and will give people options to shop for groceries and local products with greatly reduced waste.

 

 

 

 

Who is behind PickEco and this fundraiser?

Hi, my name is Salina and I've lived in BC all my life.  At the tender age of 6 I boycotted fast food restaurants that imported beef from South America because that's where I thought all of our air came from.  At 12 I became a vegetarian and although I did start to eat seafood and some poultry 12 years later, I have been beef and pork free for 20 years!  Well my 20's went by and I got out of touch with what I was passionate about, struggling to make my way in the world and figuring out this adulting business took me far off my path.  It's time to go back.  So I decided to open a zero waste grocery store, I don't just want to change my lifestyle, I want to make sure others have the option as well!  So here I am, 32 years old and doing something crazy (again) I hope you'll support our campaign and feel free to drop by the store after we open, don't forget to bring an empty jar and a full heart.

 

Risks & Challenges

With every new business venture there is the possibility of risk.  While we plan to open in June, there are still many hoops to jump through, permits that need approval, walls that need to be put up and fixtures to buy, but rest assured, if we don't open in June we will certainly open in July, just in time for party in the park.

story:
The Ganges River System in India and Bangladesh carries an estimated 100,000 -170,000 tonnes per year of plastic packaging into the ocean from its opening in the Bay of Bengal. This single river system is estimated to account for around 10% of global, river-based plastic pollution. A survey carried out by NGO, Polluting Plastics in June 2017 of Bangladeshi recycling companies indicate that there is a strong market for recycled plastics, fetching $300-$400 US per tonne. The majority of plastic flowing through the world’s waterways are plastic bottles, bags and food packaging, all of which are fully recyclable into products such as clothing fabric, furniture and other useful products. Indeed, because now 90-100% of all plastic is recyclable, a simple calculation puts the net worth of the plastic in this river at between the ranges of $30 million to $50 million USD per year. Trash Wheel interceptors designed and installed by US company ClearWater Mills have been successfully implemented in the USA. The prototype has shown the ability to collect 90-95% of plastic pollution before it enters the ocean from the Baltimore Harbour in Maryland, USA. Rather than allowing this plastic to flow into the ocean, Polluting Plastics, based in Australia - proposes a way to systematically remove the plastic from the river at the Meghna River, near the town of Chandpur. This would be both an environmental and economic victory for the people of Chandpur district and the people of Bangladesh who use the Meghna River system for fishing and aquaculture. The location just south of Chandpur is thought to be ideal due to the river’s narrow shape at this point (2km wide) and relative proximity to the ocean – meaning it will collect maximum amounts of plastic from not only the Ganges/Meghna Rivers but also the Buriganga River (flowing through the Bangla capital of Dhaka) and its tributaries. A number of Bangladeshi recycling companies have already enthusiastically shown interest in processing the waste that comes out of the river at this proposed location. 

A site visit by representatives by Polluting Plastics and a ClearWater Mills consultant is now the necessary next step to ensure backing from the local and federal authorities on the project, as well as obtaining their cooperation. The purpose of this particular crowd-funding campaign is to fund this trip.

 ClearWater Mills, the creators of Mr Trash Wheel are already on board with this project. Polluting Plastics consists of environmentalists, including at least one Bangladeshi national who will join us on our initial visit to engage with the Bangladesh authorities. Once this hurdle is overcome, we will be able to entice new funders, such as the Bangladeshi Government, to invest in the project. With a $50 million dollar annual return, the financial incentive should guide us over this final hurdle to project completion.

story:
Austin Honey Company Urban Farm Bee Hive Tours

ABOUT US:

Local beekeepers Raul Vergara and his son-in-law Mark Bradley are on a mission to help boost local organic farm pollination and production in the Austin area by placing our organically managed beehives on the farms year round and maintaining them at full pollination strength.  Our costs are substantial to achieve this and our only forms of funding are sales of honey and beeswax products which are climate and rainfall sensitive and vary from year to year.  We do not charge the farms to place our bees as it is a mutually beneficial win-win.  Our costs are especially high the first half of each year, as our first harvests of honey and beeswax in a typical year are not until June.   

OUR GOAL:

Our funding goal of $5,000 will help defray our upfront costs of ramping up production and boosting our bees to pollinate and make honey.  That money will go to replacing some of our bees that have died over the winter, and fully managing them and the apiaries on the local farms where they reside through to the summer.  The summer is when we can expect to harvest honey and beeswax and have a new crop to sell at the farmer's markets.  

For a $25 contribution your funds will be pooled together with others to help us accomplish our organic food pollination goals on 10 local organic farms where we have our bees right now.  This includes Green Gate Farms, Tecolote Farms, Springdale Farm, Milberg Farm, Bernhardt Farm, Sunrise Farm, Fruitful Hill Farm, Agua Dulce Farm, Carlson Farm, and Yegua Creek Farm.  We feel that $25 is a reasonable amount that most folks can manage to help get us to our goal.  It actually takes about $750 to start up one new bee hive, build to full strength and maintain it for the year.

THE PERKS OF CONTRIBUTING:

For only $25 you will get:

1.  An 12 oz. honey bear of our raw wildflower honey.

2.  Two hours with us for a "Live & Hands-On Beekeeping Experience" suited up in a bee suit to learn about the bees on an urban organic farm beehive tour!  We will provide the bee suits and all your protective gear and we welcome ages 5 and up.  All bee suits and protective gear will be clean and ready for your use.  You will:

A.  Learn the life cycle of the honeybee

B.  See and learn about all the equipment and tools of the beekeeper

C.  Hands on in the beehive seeing the bees in action and learning what they are doing and holding a frame of bees and getting your picture taken by us as well!  Each contributor will learn how to carefully remove and re-install a frame of live honeybees within the beehive and then do it! 

The first hour we will learn about the bees and the tools and then take a short break and then put the bee suits on for the hands on remaining hour of the tour!  Expect to be at the farm for about 2 hours total!

We intend to offer these bee hive tours at Agua Dulce Farm, just southeast of downtown Austin located at 5015 Maufrais Ln, Austin, TX 78744.  We will have the tours on Saturday's starting April 15th and running through June.  We will have a morning and afternoon time option each Saturday through May and mornings only in June (because afternoons are typically too hot).  We will accommodate 10 people maximum per tour session.  Children 5-13 years of age must be accompanied by their parent/guardian who joins them on the tour as a contributor.  For example, parent/guardian joins their children and pays $25 for themselves plus $25 for each child and each of you will get a honey bear as well.  Although we will do everything we can to ensure the bees remain calm and docile, sometimes they do get agitated.  The bee suits and protective gear work really well at preventing bee stings.  Each person ages 14 and up must sign a liability release waiver prior to the start of the tour, as we cannot be held responsible for possible allergic reactions should you be stung.  Adults will sign for their children under 14.  You need to wear boots or sturdy shoes that cover your ankles and we will provide the rest.  Groups of less than 5 people will be combined with other tour groups, as we need a minimum of 5 people to hold a tour.  We will make every effort to accommodate.  Inclement weather may delay and/or cancel our tours which will require rescheduling to future days/times.  We assure you that we will work with you to make sure you get on your tour as soon as possible.

Thank you and we look forward to having you join us on the farm and in the bee yard!  If you are not able to join us then please pass along to someone who may be interested as well!

Bee Well,

Mark & Raul

story:
“And the turtles, of course...all the turtles are free, as turtles and, maybe, all creatures should be.”
- “Yertle the Turtle,” by Dr. Seuss

Did you know that the ancestors of today’s Sea Turtles coexisted with, and in some cases pre-dated, dinosaurs first appearing in the world’s oceans over 150 million years ago?  These majestic creatures have a complex life cycle that depends on protected reefs, open ocean, and nesting beaches on land all around the world. Because of their unique traits, Sea Turtles are vulnerable to all kinds of things like ocean plastic, beach front development and artificial lighting which confuses nesting mothers and hatchlings, leaving them stranded.  Like many species today, multiple challenging threats are impacting the world’s Sea Turtles making it critical that we get creative and use every tool in the toolkit to secure a future for these beautiful and gentle ancient mariners.

The Wildlife Friendly Enterprise Network is thrilled to announce that we are working on the launch of Sea Turtle Friendly™ tourism—the world’s first global Sea Turtle standards! By partnering with the travel and hospitality industry, as well as local communities, Sea Turtle Friendly™ will give tourists opportunities to contribute directly to Sea Turtle conservation by choosing certified destinations for their journeys.

The Problem: Sea Turtles are Globally at Risk From Human-Induced Threats

Sea Turtles are a much-loved symbol of the tropics and an indicator species for the health of the marine environment.  Adventurous tourists seek out snorkeling or diving opportunities to see them swimming in the wild. We've seen Sea Turtles featured in many movies such as "Finding Nemo," and they are an iconic species in most tropical, coastal regions.  As peaceful and graceful creatures, the world would be a poorer place without Sea Turtles.  But sadly, all 7 species of Sea Turtles are included on the IUCN “Red List” of Threatened Species, and two (Hawksbill, Kemp’s Ridley) are in the category of Critically Endangered. This means that we are at risk of losing these animals forever due to many threats including impacts from fishing, hunting, coastal development, pollution, disease, and climate change.

When tourists visit a place where Sea Turtles visit or nest, they may be adding further stresses to these fragile species--the lights from hotel rooms, plastic pollution, and even stress from snorkelers that come too close can harm these animals and their future. You probably have heard that cutting open plastic rings from soda cans can help save Sea Turtles, but there is much more you can do. 

The Solution: Engaging Tourists & the Hospitality Sector as Partners in Conservation 

Tourists have an opportunity to support Sea Turtle conservation by changing their behaviors and simply selecting resorts and tour operators that care about the future of these species. Sea Turtle Friendly™ will work together with its partners to reduce direct impacts caused by development and recreational activities.

Travelers can also make smart choices in choosing not to purchase carvings or other items made from Sea Turtle shell, and they can instead choose to support smaller businesses that support conservation. Sea Turtle Friendly™ will provide new and sustainable livelihood opportunities for coastal communities that might otherwise turn to an illegal trade in meat, eggs, or turtle parts (e.g. shell).  Tourists can also report egg poaching or the sale of eggs or meat if they observe these harmful activities.  And importantly, tourists can educate their families, friends, and others about the many threats facing these amazing reptiles, including irresponsible tourism. We are developing educational materials for Sea Turtle Friendly™ resorts and tours, which will teach tourists about Sea Turtles and all of the critical actions that they can take to ensure that these species survive for future generations to enjoy.

You Can Help Create a Balance Between Sea Turtles and Tourism!

We are incredibly honored to be collaborating closely with WIDECAST (Wider Caribbean Sea Turtle Conservation Network), which has provided the framework for our conservation best practices. 

We are also fortunate to have received one of only 7 State of the World's Sea Turtles (SWOT) grants awarded in 2016! This grant awarded $1,000 for our project, and we are seeking additional funding to support this important work. Sea Turtle Friendly™ will launch in the Philippines in early 2017, and we plan to expand the project next to Florida, Latin America and the Caribbean if we meet our funding goals. 

By donating to this project, you are directly supporting:

  • Certification of the very first Sea Turtle Friendly™ hotels and tour operators through our expert driven standards; 
  • The creation of educational materials for tourists; 
  • Trainings for field staff; 
  • Expansion of the program to the other hotspots where Sea Turtles live

We are a very small non-profit organization. We rely on grant funding and philanthropic donations to support our work. This allows us to have a maximum impact on the species we work to save. 100% of your donation will directly support our conservation work--our standards, trainings, educational materials, and audits of the sites that we hope to certify. Our work is unique among conservation organizations because we aim to change private industry practices, which often have the largest effects on wildlife and the environment.

We invite you to envision a world where wildlife and communities not only coexist but thrive, where tourists are engaged as partners in conservation, and where consumers, companies and communities are empowered to be catalysts for change.

Even if you can't donate, please help us by spreading the word about our efforts to save Sea Turtles through tourism! Thank you!

[Bahasa Melayu Di Bawah]

 

The Motive

We are from the remote rainforest region of Ulu Papar, in Sabah, Malaysian Borneo. In Ulu Papar, there are few opportunities to earn an income, and recently, this has led more and more young people to seek job opportunities in the city. We refuse to follow that trend. Instead, we have chosen to create new opportunities in our community. 

We love our home and we value the traditions that our parents and grandparents have taught us  — like the importance of living in harmony with nature. We want to continue these traditions and share them with other people, like you.

Through Ulu Glamping, we want to share the natural beauty and tranquility of Ulu Papar with the world, while promoting sustainability. Ulu Glamping will not only create opportunities to keep our youth at home, but will also strengthen our traditions, helping our community to thrive for a long time to come. 

The Business

Ulu Glamping will offer guests the opportunity to experience the natural wonders of the rainforest in a comfortable, luxurious setting. 

At Ulu Glamping, we are dedicated to catering to all sought-after experiences, from rest and relaxation to outdoor adventures and environmental appreciation. We want to share with you our village, our way of life, and the beautiful rainforest that we get to enjoy every day.

Come and soak in the beauty of our pristine river and enjoy the tranquility of this stunning setting. Or, why not embrace your adventurous side and take advantage of the many fun activities we have on offer?

Activities:

  • Rafting
  • Jungle trekking
  • Fishing
  • Bird watching
  • Night walks
  • And more!

Guests will be amazed by the incredible biodiversity in Ulu Papar, which is in the Crocker Range Biosphere Reserve. You will not only get to see incredible flora and fauna, but also learn about the traditions we have in place to protect them. Going beyond typical ‘ecotourism’, Ulu Glamping will promote cultural-ecotourism, allowing guests the opportunity to learn about the traditional knowledge of our tribe, the Kadazan-Dusun.

The Impact

Guests will rest assured that their vacation contributes to positive social change in Ulu Papar. The primary aim of the Ulu Glamping Project is to create opportunities and promote sustainable development in our community. 

 

Ulu Glamping will promote sustainable development in our community by:

  • Creating opportunities
    • The job opportunities created by Ulu Glamping will allow youth, like us, to stay in Ulu Papar and raise our families here. We see Ulu Glamping playing an important role in the future well-being of our community.
  • ​Generating income
    • Revenue will not only support employees via salaries; a percentage of the company’s profits will go into a shared Community Fund which will support collective needs and initiatives in Ulu Papar. 
    • A revolving employment system will also allow many households to benefit directly from Ulu Glamping; each month, a different household will be employed to support cooking and other labour for Ulu Glamping.
  • Protecting the environment
    • Ulu Glamping will combine the concept of “ecotourism” with our community’s traditional environmental knowledge and practices to ensure that our business supports the wellbeing of the local environment. Environmental appreciation, education and conservation will be central to our business plan.
    • We’re committed to making Ulu Glamping a Zero Single-Use Plastic business!
    • The site will use clean energy — electricity generated by our local micro hydro system, as well as solar lighting and solar-powered water heaters. 

Your Support

Please consider supporting our dream to create a healthy, thriving community in Ulu Papar, for generations to come. By supporting our Indiegogo Campaign, you will not only contribute to a very worthy cause — you could also receive a free night’s stay at Ulu Glamping! We’d love to meet you in person!

If you’re unable to give financially, you can still play an important part in helping us reach our goal! It would mean a lot to us if you would share our campaign on social media and help us make some noise about Ulu Glamping. You can find sharing links at the top of the page.

 

Terima kasih!

-- Bruno, Malvin, Cosmas and Bede

 

-->Versi Bahasa Melayu<--

 

Motif

Kami berasal dari kawasan hutan hujan terpencil Ulu Papar, di Sabah, Borneo Malaysia. Di Ulu Papar, peluang untuk mendapatkan pendapatan adalah kurang, dan baru-baru ini, lebih ramai orang muda telah keluar untuk mencari peluang pekerjaan di bandar. Kami enggan mengikuti trend itu. Sebaliknya, kami telah memilih untuk mewujudkan peluang baharu dalam komuniti kami.

Kami mencintai kampung kami dan menghargai tradisi yang diturunkan oleh ibu bapa dan moyang kami—antaranya, kepentingan untuk hidup bersama dengan alam. Kami mahu meneruskan tradisi ini bersama orang lain seperti anda.

Melalui Ulu Glamping, kami ingin berkongsi keindahan semula jadi dan kedamaian Ulu Papar dengan dunia, sambil mempromosikan kemampanan. Ulu Glamping bukan sahaja akan mewujudkan peluang untuk menarik belia kami untuk kekal di kampung, tetapi turut memperkuatkan tradisi kami dan membantu komuniti kami untuk berkembang maju untuk jangka masa yang panjang.

Perniagaan

Ulu Glamping akan menawarkan para tetamu peluang untuk mengalami keajaiban semula jadi hutan hujan dalam suasana yang selesa dan mewah.

Di Ulu Glamping, kami berdedikasi untuk memenuhi segala pengalaman yang dicari, dari keinginan untuk berehat dan bersantai, ke pengembaraan luar dan penghargaan alam sekitar. Kami ingin berkongsi dengan anda kampung kami, cara hidup kami, dan keindahan hutan hujan yang dapat kami menikmati setiap hari.

Datanglah dan berendam dalam di dalam sungai kami yang bersih dan indah dan nikmati ketenangan suasana yang menakjubkan ini. Atau penuhilah keinginan seorang pengembara di dalam diri anda dan ambil kesempatan ini untuk menikmati pelbagai aktiviti yang kami tawarkan!

Aktiviti:

  • "River rafting"
  • Merentas hutan
  • Memancing
  • Memerhati burung
  • Kembara malam
  • Dan banyak lagi!

Para tetamu past I akan berasa kagum dengan kepelbagaian biodiversiti yang luar biasa di Ulu Papar, yang terletak di Rizab Biosfera Banjaran Crocker. Anda bukan sahaja dapat melihat flora dan fauna yang luar biasa, tetapi juga mempelajari tentang tradisi yang sedia ada untuk melindungi mereka. Berbanding 'eko-pelancongan' yang tipikal, Ulu Glamping akan mempromosikan pelancongan eko-budaya, yang memberi peluang kepada para tetamu untuk mempelajari ilmu tradisional kaum kami, iaitu Kadazan-Dusun.

Kesan

Kedatangan anda akan menyumbang kepada perubahan sosial positif di Ulu Papar. Matlamat utama Projek Ulu Glamping adalah untuk mewujudkan pelbagai peluang dan menggalakkan pembangunan yang mampan dalam komuniti kami.

Ulu Glamping akan menggalakkan pembangunan mampan dalam komuniti kami dengan:

  • Mewujudkan pelbagai peluang
    • Peluang pekerjaan yang dicipta oleh Ulu Glamping akan membolehkan belia seperti kami untuk terus tinggal di Ulu Papar dan membina keluarga di sini. Dengan cara ini, Ulu Glamping dapat memainkan peranan yang penting dalam kesejahteraan masa hadapan komuniti kami.​
  • Menjana pendapatan
    • Pendapatan bukan sahaja akan menyokong kehidupan pekerja kami melalui gaji; sebuah peratusan daripada keuntungan syarikat akan masuk ke dalam Dana Komuniti bersama yang akan menyokong keperluan kolektif dan inisiatif di Ulu Papar.​
    • Sistem pengambilan pekerja secara bergiliran juga akan membolehkan ramai keluarga untuk mendapat manfaat secara langsung dari Ulu Glamping; setiap bulan, keluarga yang berlainan akan diambil kerja untuk memasak dan menyumbang tenaga kerja yang lain untuk Ulu Glamping.​
  • Melindungi alam sekitar
    • Ulu Glamping akan menggabungkan konsep "ekopelancongan" dengan pengetahuan dan amalan tradisi komuniti kami yang berkaitan dengan alam sekitar untuk memastikan perniagaan kami menyokong kesejahteraan alam sekitar. Penghargaan, pendidikan dan pemuliharaan alam sekitar akan menjadi elemen-elemen utama di dalam rancangan perniagaan kami.​
    • Kami komited untuk membuatkan Ulu Glamping sebuah perniagaan Sifar Plastik Sekali Guna!​
    • Tapak ini akan menggunakan tenaga bersih daripada elektrik yang dihasilkan oleh sistem hidro mikro tempatan kami, serta pencahayaan solar dan pemanas air bertenaga solar.​

Sokongan Anda

Kami berharap anda akan menyokong impian kami untuk mewujudkan sebuah komuniti yang sihat dan maju di Ulu Papar untuk generasi akan datang. Dengan menyokong Kempen Indiegogo kami, anda bukan sahaja akan menyumbang kepada sebuah tujuan yang amat bermakna⁠—anda juga boleh menikmati penginapan percuma di Ulu Glamping! Kami akan berbesar hati untuk bertemu dengan anda!

Sekiranya anda tidak mampu memberi kewangan, anda masih boleh memainkan peranan penting dalam membantu kami mencapai matlamat kami! Ini bermakna banyak kepada kami jika anda akan berkongsi kempen kami di media sosial dan membantu kami membuat bunyi bising tentang Ulu Glamping. Anda boleh mencari pautan perkongsian di bahagian atas halaman.

 

Terima kasih!

-- Bruno, Malvin, Cosmas dan Bede

 

FAQs 

 

Q: Apakah sebenarnya yang akan dibiayai oleh $ 15,000 USD?

A: Kos permulaan. Ini termasuk bahan binaan, peralatan, perabot dan perabot untuk dua 'kabin', bilik air dan komponen tapak yang lain. Jika terdapat dana tambahan, dana ini akan diperuntukkan ke arah pengangkutan dan dua 'kabin' tambahan.

 

Q: Jika dana yang diperolehi melebihi sasaran, apakah yang akan dilakukan dengan dana berlebihan tersebut?

A: Semua sumbangan akan jelas digunakan untuk membiayai kos permulaan dan operasi syarikat Ulu Glamping. Sekiranya sasaran pembiayaan diatasi, dana berlebihan akan menyumbang kepada pengangkutan, dua kabin tambahan, dan kos operasi berterusan untuk Ulu Glamping. Ini akan banyak membantu kami, kerana menyumbang kepada daya maju dan keselamatan kewangan ketika kami melaksanakan projek ini, lalu berpotensi untuk mengurangkan masa pemulihan pelaburan.

 

Q: Apa yang akan terjadi kepada dana yang dikumpul jika jumlah yang disasarkan tidak dipenuhi?

A: Kempen kami ditetapkan sebagai "matlamat yang fleksibel", yang bermaksud bahawa kempen ini akan menerima semua dana yang dikumpul walaupun matlamat asal tidak dicapai. Jika jumlah sasaran $ 15,000 USD tidak dipenuhi, sebarang dana yang diperolehi melalui Indiegogo akan digunakan untuk menampung kos permulaan untuk Ulu Glamping.

Dalam kes ini, kami akan menjalankan sebuah kempen crowdfunding kedua dan / atau mencari sumber dana tambahan untuk mencapai sasaran kami. Jika kami menjalankan kempen kedua, kami akan kembali dengan lebih besar dan lebih baik setelah belajar daripada percubaan pertama kami—oleh itu, kami berharap anda akan terus menyokong kami.

 

Q: Apakah jenis aktiviti yang akan ditawarkan di Ulu Glamping?

A: Di Ulu Glamping, kami ingin memenuhi segala keperluan dan kehendak anda. Oleh itu, kami akan menawarkan pelbagai aktiviti, dari aktiviti rehat dan santai ke penghargaan dan pengembaraan alam sekitar. Pengalaman yang ditawarkan termasuk merentas hutan, arung jeram, memancing, memerhati burung, dan kembara malam. Para tetamu juga akan berpeluang mempelajari tentang pemuliharaan alam sekitar dan tradisi Kadazan-Dusun.

story:
Health, safety, and environmental risks with current medical waste management methods

The current medical waste management methods appear to be effective, but the problem is that medical sharps – and any harmful pathogens they may carry (HIV, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C) – remain intact and are prone to accidental injuries long after they’ve been placed in a medical sharps waste container. Because of this, healthcare workers and waste management employees are subject to life-threatening injuries. This same threat extends to the general public, as we see news reports of syringes and other medical waste washing up on our shoreline, also known as “syringe tides”.

The health, safety, and environmental threat of used medical sharps doesn’t end when the medical sharp is placed in a sharps waste container.

Our improvement on medical sharps waste management

The SafeSharp Dissolver Gel contains patented active ingredients that immediately destroys harmful pathogens (HIV, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C) and quickly dissolves the stainless steel in the medical sharps such as needles, syringes, and scalpels.  This eliminates the immediate and downstream risks and extreme hazards to our health, safety, and environment.

The unique formulation of the SafeSharp Dissolver Gel is delivered in widely-used medical sharps waste containers. 

Following a standard disposal process, a medical sharp is placed in a sharps waste container.  The SafeSharp Dissolver Gel makes contact with the medical sharp as it is put into the waste container, immediately destroying the life-threatening pathogens and activating the dissolver.  Within an hour the metal sharp dissolves. Charlottesville Open Bio Labs of Charlottesville, Virginia has performed the verification tests.

“The SafeSharp Dissolver compound is effective in quickly dissolving medical sharps such as needles and syringes, and has the ability to eliminate accidental and hazardous punctures after disposal.” – Shaun Moshasha, Founder of Charlottesville Open Bio Labs

The Dissolver Gel is made of natural compounds and safe to the environment, and with medical sharps dissolved and pathogens destroyed through its use, it greatly improves our ability to protect the environment, our health and safety.

Please participate in our crowdfunding campaign

We are entering our initial public fundraising round, to fund additional patents and to begin field testing of the SafeSharp Dissolver Gel and optimal delivery methods. 

SafeSharp is inviting the public to consider the impact of the health, safety, and environmental issues surrounding used medical sharps, and visit our website at www.safesharp.com to learn more.

This crowdfunding campaign is not a tax-deductible donation.
story_txt:
Health, safety, and environmental risks with current medical waste management methods
The current medical waste management methods appear to be effective, but the problem is that medical sharps – and any harmful pathogens they may carry (HIV, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C) – remain intact and are prone to accidental injuries long after they’ve been placed in a medical sharps waste container. Because of this, healthcare workers and waste management employees are subject to life-threatening injuries. This same threat extends to the general public, as we see news reports of syringes and other medical waste washing up on our shoreline, also known as “syringe tides”.

The health, safety, and environmental threat of used medical sharps doesn’t end when the medical sharp is placed in a sharps waste container.
Our improvement on medical sharps waste management
The SafeSharp Dissolver Gel contains patented active ingredients that immediately destroys harmful pathogens (HIV, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C) and quickly dissolves the stainless steel in the medical sharps such as needles, syringes, and scalpels.  This eliminates the immediate and downstream risks and extreme hazards to our health, safety, and environment.
The unique formulation of the SafeSharp Dissolver Gel is delivered in widely-used medical sharps waste containers.

“The SafeSharp Dissolver compound is effective in quickly dissolving medical sharps such as needles and syringes, and has the ability to eliminate accidental and hazardous punctures after disposal.” – Shaun Moshasha, Founder of Charlottesville Open Bio Labs
The Dissolver Gel is made of natural compounds and safe to the environment, and with medical sharps dissolved and pathogens destroyed through its use, it greatly improves our ability to protect the environment, our health and safety.
