story:
Make an important contribution to the preservation of our environment and our oceans and
help thou mine SurfArt project to reach a new level.

Hello my friends
My name is Michel and I'm surfing artist. My work as an artist is next to my family the most important thing in my life and the ocean my greatest inspiration.
SurfArt is a mixture of my oil paintings, Tikis, sketches, driftwoodpaintings and my dudes. The Dudes are wall sculptures bring radical and stylish surfmaneuvers to the wall.
Each Dude (along with my images) are individual pieces, wherever they are seen absolute eye-catcher.
So
I think that it`s time for art to take responsibility and face the major issues much more. My art deals with nature for a long time and from now on I will contribute with my art to protect it ..

My biggest goal is to allow my daughters and their children a beautiful and inspiring life in a healthy environment. I'm sure by now everyone knows how sensitive systems our oceans and our climate are and how strong our survival depends on them.
My SurfArt project supports 50% !!!! of each work of art sold to an ecologically important project which the lucky buyers can choose from my website.
SurfArt works together with selected projects and all have one thing in common: save our oceans and our climate.
Examples:

http://www.surfrider.org

http://www.greenpeace.org/usa/oceans

http://www.theoceancleanup.com/
http://www.s4cglobal.org/
http://www.sea-shepherd.de/
I want to really get things moving in this direction and lift together with you my art label to a higher level.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I want a website and an online gallery to reach as many people as possible. And in the social networks in which I am already well connected I will spread my vision ..
I will rent a beautiful studio to create a place where my creativity can unfold fully and I have the necessary space to realize my big goals.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reasonable work materials are extremely important and essential for any artist.
But I also need canvas, paints, brushes, carvingknives and also a useful computer, printer and scanner.

A professional photographer will bring my work into perspective and also the necessary promotional materials like flyers will be done by a professional graphic design studio.

To find a partner gallery where you can see my work first hand in surf capitals around the world is another big task

That is why I will be traveling to the hotspots to establish new contacts or renew old ones .

I will position my art at prestigious SurfArt festivals and trade shows.

I invite you to join me on this exciting adventure and to be a important part of the SurfArt project

It really is incredibly important to act quickly and purposefully. It's literally everything.


Each support is important, so everyone who contributes something to the success of my project received a great perk. Even for one dollar. Each  supporter is mentioned by name on the website and in the networksfor sure.

Please check my facebook site https://www.facebook.com/surfartmichel.freyer
for updates and pictures of my perks

story:
What We Are Asking For

We are a relatively small non-profit, and we need your help to continue our mission to increase the popularity and use of California’s native plants, educate children and adults by incorporating eco-literacy lesson plans, and preserving, protecting and restoring native ecosystems.

With your contribution you will :

  • Support our teaching gardens in the heart of San Jose and beyond!
  • Help fund more school yard conversions from asphalt to teaching laboratories like our flagship ELSEE garden at 76 Race Street.
  • Help sponsor our events at The Middlebrook Center, Sustainable Saturdays, Living Neighborhood Series, class field trips, workshops, and Eating California events.
  • Help fund our grant writing, community outreach, garden teaching, and event planning staff.
  • Help fund a full time garden educator that will help us develop a curriculum and expand our education program.


What Are We

We are the California Native Garden Foundation, a small nonprofit with a mission to educate students about four core values: life sciences, sustainability, eco-literacy, and healthy eating. We partner with schools throughout California to build native and edible gardens in their yards, where we teach healthy eating, gardening, sustainability, and environmental science.  We also host weekly community sustainability events and workshops at the Middlebrook Center, the site of our model teaching garden and the CNGF office.

Where we started

California Native Garden Foundation started ten years ago when I had a vision in a parking lot: Why not form a non-profit foundation to help current and future generations realize the importance and benefits of native plants? From that idea we turned a bus parking lot into a teaching garden that has become a model for schoolyards all over the San Francisco Bay Area. Since that time we have worked with over 50 schools in California to install teaching gardens.

story:
Deforestation along the Tarapuyo river

The Project

Ecuador has more species of plants per area unit than any other country in South America. 18% of the total discovered birds in the world, 1,655 birds, are found in Ecuador. The 382 mammal species that exist in this country, comprise 7% of the 5,490 species registered in the world. It is, in summary, a rich tropical region, with wetlands, due to its privileged geographic location in the Neotropics, which makes it form part of this privileged list of biodiversity.

The National Park Cuyabeno is located in the provinces of Napo und Sucumbíos, originally encompassed an area of 603,380 hectares. Due to an increasing indigenous population and non sustainable practices more and more forest areas are being converted into agricultural lands. This in turn is causing a devastating effect on the fragile flora and fauna of the region. As the natural beauty of the area is attracting every year lots of tourists, more and more Tourist lodges get constructed within the reserve and indigenous communities in the vicinity are more and more making a living from the booming tourist industry which in turn effects their traditional way of living adversely.

This project is a demonstration project of sustainable living in the indigenous community of Puerto Bolivar. It consists of establishing a botanical garden whith over 100 endangered plant species  of the Amazonas. At the same time we will introduce viable sustainable tree crops to the surrounding indigenous communities like the breadfruit tree to reduce deforestation and habitat loss of plant and animal species. 


How it started

  • "Originally from Germany, I  embarked on a path of inner search and spirituality more than 35 years ago. I became a Yogic monk 25 years ago and have being practicing and teaching Yoga since then. I always had the idea to combine healing  ourselves, improving our subjectives states of mind, while at the same time healing the planet.  I am convinced that many ills of the modern society can be cured by tapping deep into our inner resources which in turn will bring about our own flourishing as well as a more coherent and rational management of the environment. For two years I have been traveling in the Amazon in search of a place to start a sustainable development project that will exemplify and validate this theory.  
    Traveling the     river ways of the Cuyabeno National Park I was enchanted by its natural beauty and at the same time appalled by the destruction that is happening within and in the surroundings of the park, and of the hardship and suffering that indigenous villagers confront on a day to day basis. Witnessing this catastrophe, my desire grew even stronger  to do something concrete for the people and the environment there."   Dada Vidyananda

  • "I got involved in this project, because I believe that a better life is possible. I think there is an urgency to take action in saving the planet.  The earth can no longer support  the  pollution and over exploitation of the land. The best way of changing the world  is by teaching the small and poor communities how to produce in  sustainable ways."   Gustavo Redin (Environmental Lawyer)

  • " I am an ecuadorian and have lived + 8 years  in Europe and the US.  Currently I am an entrepreneur in many fields and also an active volunteer with children in risk.  Two years ago  I quit the corporate world and came back to my home country to dedicate myself to work in projects that aggregate more value to the society and the world.  I am a nature, earth and yoga lover, this is why I want to help preserve Rainforest, that is the home of so many beautiful species."  Daniela Carillo 

  • "I became part of  this project because I am an advocate of animal rights. I feel the strong need to save our home - mother Earth. Every time a natural catastrophe happens it is like a wakeup call that our survival depends on the survival of the whole of nature."  Juan Ponce

  

What we need and what you get!

We need to save the biodiverse rich rain-forest in Cuyabeno NOW  before it's too late!

As a missionary monk I'm donating my  time, skills and money to save the Amazon and its people. 

I'm personally covering my accommodation, gear and food and any other expense needed to make this happen for the two year duration of the project. With our donation you will help amazonian communities as well as contribute to preserve endangered species in our botanical garden.

We need your help for:
1. Purchase of  trees and setting up of a tree nursery: $8,000 (minimum to establish a tree nursery of 3,000 trees and import 1000 superior in vitro Breadfruit trees from Breadfruit Institute USA) 
2. Road and river transportation to and within the Cuyabeno National Park in search of unexplored rare tree species: $1,500  (minimum amount to conduct 10 field exploration trips within the Reserve within the two year duration of the project) 
 3. Rainforest Academy and Lodge to accommodate 20 adolescents of the Siona tribe along with visiting Yoga students and volunteers: $4,000 (minimum amount to build a basic shelter for students using ecological materials) 
4. Consulting services: $500 (minimum amount for consulting services that are not provided by the team members)
5. Volunteer program:$4,800 (minimum amount for providing lodging, food and transportation from Quito Airport to the site and back, for 1 year volunteer program with 2 volunteers)
6. Educational materials: $1,000 
Total funds needed: $19,800

ALL YOUR HELP WILL GO TO THE AMAZON AND ITS PEOPLE. If we exceed our goal, We WILL EXTEND OUR MISSION AND VOLUNTEERING WORK IN THE AMAZON as well as continue sharing the projects results with you. 

LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN - BE PART OF THE CHANGE THAT WILL BRING NEW HOPE FOR THE NEW MILLENNIUM

Every little bit helps. Please contribute, show your support, jump on board!


     
    The Rainforest Academy - An example of sustainable Living 
  • We believe that the most important thing we can do for conservation worldwide is to invest in the training of men and women to manage their own natural resources. For us the environmental condition of an area is greatly influenced  by the state of the collective consciousness of the people living there. It can either propel people to live in harmony with nature and respect it, or otherwise see it merely as a commodity that is waiting to be exploited. 
  • With the rainforest academy our focus is to provide training opportunities in sustainable living for indigenous people and to build the human capacity and motivation for a balanced development of environmental, personal, social, cultural and economic resources. In this way we hope to achieve an well rounded  sustainability platform which will serve as a model for other communities regionally, nationally and even globally. The inner resources that are needed to draw upon in order to bring about an inner attitude of benevolent leadership and respect to all forms of life will be facilitated by the incorporation of yoga and meditation within the training program. 
  • While fostering long term conservation with environmentally sound practices, we will introduce new under explored tree crops and provide training in building character strength, moral and yogic training. 
  • Concrete Project activities;
  • A group of 20 young adults of the community of Puerto Bolivar will be trained in  yogic and other psychotherapeutic practices that will help them to regain control over their lives. As they will develop their inner resources, they will receive training in sustainable land management, leadership training, plant propagation, biology and botany. 
  • During field trips seeds of under explored rare wild edible plants will be collected for later planting in a tree nursery throughout the two year project lifespan.
  • In a 3 hectare deforested land  1000 mostly Wild fruit trees will be planted to research the unknown potential of those trees and its products.

  • Deforested land of village families will be surveyed and a total of 10 hectare of land  will be selected and demarcated for reforestation 

  • We will import improved InVitro Non GMO Breadfruit saplings  the United States that will produce the first harvest after the second year. 

  • Monthly workshops will be held on sustainable land management, botany, plant propagation and how to improve nutritional needs with wild edible plants

  • Research in Sustainability

 

Rare fruits found in the Amazon

P.R. Sarkar founder of Ananda Marga has given many detailed instructions in his scriptures on how society as well as animals and plants can live a more harmonious life. In this project we aim to research several of his suggested approaches.

1. Rootgrafting and plant propagation

We intend to  propagate plants sexually and asexually as well as graft and root graft them. Asexually reproduced plants can produce abandoned crops in a short period. Selected superior strains of  wild edible plants with a high potential to contribute to the nutritional needs of the population will be propagated by grafting them onto ordinary varieties.  

With root grafting we aim to improve the overall fruit quality of selected wild plants and evaluate their potential  to be domesticated.

(Root grafted sapling above  and 3 month after the process below)


2. Sacred Garden

In the ancient past Yogis used to plant 5 trees in a circle to create a magnetic field of healing energies. Our intend is to create several of those spots and research its effect on human consciousness and how it can help bringing about the healing of the planet.

3, Cooperative Development

The trees that will be raised in the nursery will be distributed to a newly formed cooperative. By doing this we will strengthen the collaborative values within the community.

  • With this project we do not seek to patch up symptoms but instead to remedy the root causes of the  socio-economic,  cultural degradation, and environmental destruction of this area, by providing a tangible implementation of real sustainable living.
  • I strongly believe that this approach is viable and workable as farmers will be given the so much needed tools to defend their cultural identity and become good stewards of the environment.
  • With your contributions we will be able to empower indigenous lives by providing them with the knowledge of working hand in hand with nature and not against it. The hard field work that is required until the moment of harvesting will be made worthwhile by planting  crops that are highly nutritious and highly productive.  Some of them, like the breadfruit trees from the US, produce their first crop after the second year  and the quality of the fruit is superior to the local strains of breadfruit. In the long run this will reduce deforestation as farmers will learn to cultivate more in less land and with better quality.
  • It will bring about a change and inner reorientation in the minds of the people by reconnecting  them to the bigger forces of life  and thereby the idea of interconnectedness  and respect to all expressions of life will emerge.  
  • Some years back,I have worked with  rural communities in Nicaragua and Guatemala where we planted more then 10,000 multipurpose trees. I learned a lot during this time on how to work with communities and about plant propagation and management.
 

Risks

  •  The only risks that are worth mentioning here, will be heavy flooding, excess raining and human error. These risks are minimized as the planting site  has been selected carefully and young seedlings are kept under a protective roof until they are ready to be transplanted and withstand the heavy rains.  
  • In the unlikely event that the project will not meet its total objectives funds will be donated to the ASA Foundation.
 

Other ways you can help

    If you can't contribute with money, you can still contribute with love. Our collective Intend to do something positive and concrete for the environment and the people brings us together in this and that is what is really important.  We appreciate other contributions like:

    • Please Spread the message, tell people what's happening to the Ecuadorian rainforest.
    • Please like/share my campaign on facebook 
    • Help us to connect with other people who want to join in!
    • Do you wanna join forces with this campaign to save the Amazon? Contact me!
    • help us getting the word out and sharing the project idea with other people - share this campaign using the tools on Indiegogo and social media

story:
I am Paolo Enrique Go Rosero, an Artist and a Dive Instructor. I want to create an underwater museum to help enhance a marine protected area. I want this to be a study on how I should go about and further create more marine reserves. To see if by creating one, I could help the local economy by creating avenues for eco-tourism. By contributing to my cause, you would give me the budget to create more and sink them with the rest. I spent a lot by sinking five sculptures and I find it hard to do it on my own.

        The funding you give me would go to buying the raw mareials I need to create more sculptures. I buy junk metal, and also soldering rods. It also helps pay for the electricity I use while welding them together. I also need to transport the sculpture from my studio in Metro Manila to the waters of Barangay Hugom, Laiya Batangas. It is about 180 kms away. Your funds would also help by providing me a means of transporting them there.
       There are perks to donating as well. A new perk worth $5 is up for grabs. Donate $5 snd you can adopt a fish that lives within my sculptures. For a mere donation of $30; I will send you photos and videos of new pieces, and the same to see how the old ones are thriving. For every $150 you donate, I will give you a free tour around the museum I am making. If you do not know how to scuba dive, I will give you a free Discover Scuba Diving experience just so you can see it first hand. If you are very generous and donate $750. I will also be generous and certify you as a PADI Open Water Diver myself. You can use this license to go scuba diving anywhere in the world.
         If I do not reach my campaign goals, then anything I receive will be sent to my bank account and I will use it to create more sculptures.
       Global warming and over fishing are two big concerns that we face each day. By helping me make this underwater museum, you help tackle both problems. The artificial reefs will be a sanctuary for juvenile organisms that will later leave the marine reserve as they mature. The algae that grow on the sculptures help absorb the carbon in the atmosphere. It will also serve as a tourist attraction which will help the local economy. It will create alternative livelihoods for the locals, in turn they will no longer have to go fish that far just to feed their family. Other jobs like being a dive boat will open up to them.
        I have already sunk five sculptures, and the first three are showing unbelievable progress.  I think I know what the critters need to thrive. You can see videos of these at the gallery section of this site.  Also, cuttle fish have laid eggs on my lucky buddha. I need help so I can make more. I will find like minded people along the way who can help me in anyway possible. I already have found a few, that's why I was able to sink three. I hope the next person I find will be you. Even a $5 donation would do. ;)
         As an Artist and a Scuba diver, I try to find ways to mix my two favorite disciplines.  Being an Environmentalist as welI, hitting three birds with one stone is all i can ask for. I know that if I just follow my heart, I will succeed. 
        Remember, donating is not the only thing you can do to help  with my cause. You can also tell your friends about it, and they in turn can tell their other friends. The more people that know about this campaign, the more chances it will be successfull.  Remember to use the share tools in the indiegogo website if you want to speak about this.
         Thank you for sparing some of your time. Lets  make a greener brighter future, for our children, and their grand children..

story:
Scrapped tire is not rubbish 

                        but our Passion and Fun

 

Exclusive tire recycling, choose the most unique accessories

What do you think if you see scrapped tire in a forest? Would You have any idea how to use it? Would You bring it at home ? Imagine how can You reuse it. 

I found a solution to solve this problem. We truly believe to have a fantastic project, where we can mix our creative side with the strong desire for fashionable stuff and our deep karmic calling to do something important for our planet and for the next generations who will inherit this world from us. 

Some month ago I found the most interesting environment friendly hobby in my life: recycling bike and car tires on the most exclusive way, doing belts and other accessories. So, I created a brand, which makes unique, unrepeatable, designed and personalized fashionable products.

 

 

 

Tires are by their very nature a recycling headache, they are difficult to break down and reuse and often just pile up becoming an eyesore and taking up valuable space, holding precious resources.  The abundance of trash is a tremendous problem for our planet, and we need make more room for ideas that help us get rid of it or those that transform the excess – instead of producing more and more.

 

 

 

 

UNDER PROCESS :) SELFIE TIME

                       

                        

      ...after the cleaning process. starting to fix the buckles... 

 

We prepare belts with bracelets and earrings, rings from inner tubes.

 

 

 

 

Creative colleagues are already involved to help my project, making even more belts, dog accessories, and thanks to the ingenuity, other good ideas like suspenders from inner tubes are already prepared by myself and our team. With my first collection, I went for a short business trip to Amsterdam, London and I already have my first partners there as well. I love to see the surprised faces when people realize that my beautiful belts are made from recycled tires.

 

 

We collect, cut, clean and paint the tires in South Hungary. I travel between Budapest, Amsterdam and London to visit local markets and shops to sell my handmade products. 

 

 

Why I would like to raise money?

By creating a crowdfunding project I hope to raise funds for the production and marketing as well and share this fantastic artistical and recycling project with the world.

Because of the workflow, some machines should be bought for easy cutting and collecting,  moreover 2 employees should be applied to clean and collect the tires. 

 

My First RESULTS 

 

My tribe and the passion for recycling is just growing every day. And we recycle every day more and more tires. Our techniques and designes are always renewed and we always give you our best.

 

 

 

 

 

How TukTuk was born

I’ve been living in London until May, working in Marketing and graphic materials, but I get bored with the weather and felt the needing to change something in my life. I had a great friend who moved to Tanzania a couple of years ago, and he needed some help in his business. So, one day I just decided to move close to Kilimanjaro.

 

                                          

 

       

 

Some weeks after my arrival, one day when I visited the market, found a lady selling beautiful and colorful painted slippers made from car and motor tires. 

 

 

 

                           

I immediately fall in love with her products, I bought some pairs and started to show it to my friends. 

 

I knew that my life has changed, I found a crazy strong interest and curiosity for tire recycling. I liked the idea to reuse  and create perfectly designed fashionable stuff.

The tire recycling idea captivated be instantly, a stunning combination of beautiful items and a recycling solution to a persistent problem. 

 

 

Coming back to Europe, to my hometown in Hungary, I already decided to follow the deep calling in my heart : I had my brand name (TukTuk Designer Tribe), my website, and next day after my arrival I immediately run in the first service to ask for some bike tires. From that moment I started to organize my hobby, my job, my passion and my dreams in the same project. And this plan is growing dynamically.

 

                             

  

The past 4 month I recycled almost 200 tires. It's such a big quantity already.

My mother started to work with me, she is an artist, painting oil pictures, but she likes so much this idea, so she started to paint my belts artistically.

 

                                      

 

Recycling tires is not the most exclusive hobby and job, but it’s a really big fun. Not many women choose such a hard and dirty dream to manage, but I love to collect, cut and clean the tires, and do the other tasks until it becomes a fashionable item. 

 

 

 

Founders of TukTuk TRIBE

 

 

 

 LAURA 

Founder of TukTuk Designer Tribe, Dreamer, Entrepreneur

 


 

ZSOKA

My mother, artist, painter of TukTuk belts

 

 

 

 

PETER

Communications, Business Strategy, Dreamer2

 

 

KRISZTI and TIBI

Environmentalists, Tire Hunters, Creatives

 

 

Why to BUY PERKS?

You will have some accessories like anyone else :) You help us :) You will help the environment :) You may say that you are one of our international backers.:) You may say to be one of the first people who own TukTuk accessories. 

 

 

Support Our TIRE HUNTER             Program

 

 

 

We look for scrapped tires in nature, unfortunately many people leave the trash there. But we can use this tires to prepare our fabulous collections. 
You can support our program with an only 5USD. 
 

Why your ordered belt will be even more special ?

I really would like to thank your help. Your choosed accessories will be unique, unrepeatable, numbered with a special inner message. I will show everyone your help on my Facebook page and homepage.

FREE GIFT 

Would you like to have our Secret TukTuk Package? Some great, unique product for you and for the people you love. Belts, and bracelets, and still.... Who knows :) So, someone who help us to spread the word and will refer the most contributors to our campaign will get our special gift. 
Please use the sharing tools and invite your friends :)
 
Thanks for your support, thanks for reading :) 
 
Some articles in Hungary about us :
http://bebudapest.hu/tuktuk-designer-tribe/
http://kornyezetvedelem.weebly.com/blog/gumiabr...
 

Enjoy Life, Enjoy TukTuk

Thanks                                                                      Laura

story:
About the Project

• Solarizing the radio station will be a major step toward promoting solar power to all the villages throughout the Simanjiro District.

• Ongoing and future solar applications include: solarizing maternal health dispensaries, health clinics, solar home systems, primary schools, and solar water pumping systems.

 • Young people are especially interested in connecting to the Internet and using smart phones!

• Women entrepreneurs want to grind their corn, operate sewing machines, make cheese, and improve their handicraft products.

 

About Our Team

• The Maasai Village Solar Radio Project is a volunteer program helping Maasai Community Leader Lukas Kariongi develop an NGO organization and solar projects through worthwhile grass-roots efforts.

• In 1997, Lukas was in eager young Maasai from East Africa who traveled to Solar Energy International (SEI), a nonprofit organization Johnny co-founded in Colorado. There he began his training to be a solar technician as a tuition-funded scholarship student.

• For nearly 20 years, Lukas has been working to fulfill his goal of solarizing his home village of Terat, Tanzania. Now a district-wide progressive village leader, he recently started and is the Managing Director of Rural Community Support Organization (RUCOSUO), a community-based NGO focused on solar development.

Lukas’ solar accomplishments to date include:

• Starting a training school for Maasai youth that features hands-on practical solar training and computer skills.

• Working with local entrepreneurs selling/installing pico solar and home PV systems.

• Lukas and RUCOSUO are developing a plan to re-vitalize a dysfunctional generator powered mini-grid, to turn it into a model solar battery-based microgrid.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $25,000 to build the solar-powered radio station, a step in powering other village applications in the future. With your generous donation, you kindly receive:  

$25                      Listed as a sponsor on our website  

$75                      SEI winter beanie hat

$150                   SEI winter beanie hat and a Nokero light

$1000                 Any SEI renewable energy online course

$2000                Any 1-week SEI face-to-face course

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you find that you can't contribute to our campaign at this time, that doesn't mean you can't help. Instead, you can:

  • Help us get the word out that we need donations thru word of mouth and social media.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to promote and encourage this worthwhile campaign!

 

Interested in how the funds will be distributed in the project to solar power the radio station? Here’s the breakdown:

story:
Short Summary

Seagulls is a true grassroots Social Enterprise, established by me (Cat) and Kate around Kate’s kitchen table back in 2001. A Social Enterprise addresses social problems with a commercial response, there are no share holders and all profit goes back into the business to help more people.

Neither of us had business experience but we were (and still are) passionate about the local and global environment and social justice.   Two things we were sure on: we wanted to raise awareness of recycling and reuse in Leeds and we wanted to create jobs, training and volunteering opportunities for ourselves and others. We have always held the belief that if we can do it (and we still are) then anyone can and this is the message we pass on daily to our staff and volunteers.

Over the last 18 years we have grown organically into a thriving, colourful and friendly place. Paint and people are at the core of what we do. Since paint collections began we have diverted 900,000 litres of reusable paint away from landfill, provided employment for 18 people (90% having previously volunteered at Seagulls) and worked with over 500 volunteers.

The volumes of paint we are collecting and reusing continues to grow. Last year we collected 375 tonnes of paint all together, that’s double the volume from seven years ago, and it keeps on growing. One thing we can be sure of; there will never be a shortage of unwanted, reusable paint!

We also run a community arts project: Seagulls Mosaic and have undertaken numerous community mosaic installations and our work can now been seen across the city. We have worked with over 1000 Leeds residents to make these projects happen and created meaningful and long lasting public art.

We have reached a pivotal point and have the confidence and capacity to expand Seagulls, making it bigger and better and essentially able to reach more people. With bigger volumes of paint, the need to diversify our income streams and with more people wanting to get involved we need to expand our floor space and build capacity.

We have a vision, we have taken on additional space at Aire Place Mills and intend to do the following:

  • Build a new paint reprocessing and storage area that will enable us to move the majority of the paint mixing out of the paint store
  • Improve the paint store
  • Build 2 workshops for screen printing, upcycling furniture and woodwork
  • Establish and build a plastic refill shop, starting with basic refills but looking to expand product range of reusable and environmentally friendly products
  • Create a social area for volunteers and staff to encourage engagement

 

Most importantly we want to create more space to help more people. We know it sounds cheesy, but Seagulls is a place where people grow and build their confidence; learning life skills, teamwork and work experience. Our volunteer program We Grow People works and we want to do more of it.

What We Need & What You Get

These are exciting and busy times for Seagulls. Increasing volumes of paint means we need to make sure we have resources to cope, this means more space and more manpower. We have taken on additional units in our yard and now need the funds to make the place function better and build our capacity.

The increasing volume of paint means 3 things: 1. we have more volunteer opportunities 2. We need to expand our paint store and paint mixing/ storage areas to meet the demand and 3. we need more people to buy our paint.

We want to adapt and kit out some of the new space for better changing rooms and an additional social area. Work at Seagulls is messy and physical so we need to look after our staff and volunteers. Seagulls is under pinned by team work and we need space to allow this to happen. To blow our own trumpet; we have an excellent track record in engaging with people, building their life skills, knowledge and confidence.

This year we have seen an increase in demand for our volunteering opportunities; primarily people living with mental health problems, ex offenders and young adults with learning disabilities. We offer bespoke support, training and work experience opportunities. We have the funds for an additional staff member to support this demand and we anticipate working with an additional 20 volunteers per year. Because of the increase in paint we have the capacity within the paint store and collections to keep all volunteers meaningfully occupied. It’s a win win situation if we can make the space work.

With an increase in people power we can introduce a Plastic Refill Shop. In the first phase we will offer 3 of the most popular liquid refills and look to expand the range as funds allow. This initiative will take some staff time but we also think it will open up good volunteering opportunities.

We also plan to separate the new space to accommodate 2 workshop studios; 1 for screen printing and the other as an upcycling workshop. Funds will pay for the design and structure of these. These spaces will be a way of bringing more income into the enterprise.

Because we are a Social Enterprise we aren't able to offer shares in the business; any profit we make goes back into Seagulls to work with more people and support our environmental work. We have however put together various perks and gifts when you donate; we are most in love with the enamel pin badges which are limited edition's for this campaign. We are also working to offer more perks as the campaign progresses. As well as a perk  you also get to bathe in a warm glow, knowing that you are helping a social enterprise reach more people and do more good work in the community.

The Impact

Seagulls is a unique and off the wall business; we are passionate about finding ways to help the local and global environment whilst working with some of the most marginalised people in society. As one of my friends said ‘Seagulls is special and you are important to the fabric of Leeds, you’ve created a good thing where people know they have somewhere to go and feel valued and welcome, Seagulls gives people purpose and picks people up’.

Being part of Seagulls is like being part of a family. Because of our humble beginnings, we have created a place where people feel at ease almost straight away.

We work with a huge range of people, most living on the margins of society and disadvantaged for many different reasons; ex-offenders, young adults with learning disabilities, young people not in education or training, people living with often very serious mental health conditions. Many lack confidence, life skills and suffer extreme anxiety. Everyone at Seagulls is made to feel equal and part of the team. 

As well as playing an important role within the community we also have a positive impact on the environment. To date:

  • we have diverted and reused 900, 000 litres of paint away from landfill since 2005
  • people store an average of 17 tins per household
  • poorly disposed of paint poisons water sources
  • our paint brings colour to many homes and communities

With the addition of a plastic refill shop our environmental impact on Leeds will increase significantly. Plastic is a huge problem and we know we are well placed to help Leeds achieve higher reuse and reduction rates:

  • there are over 5 trillion bits of plastic floating in the sea
  • Plastic at sea breaks down into smaller and smaller bits contaminating sea- life
  • Plastic debris is eaten by around 50% of sea birds, 30% of turtles and 30% of fish in certain areas from where they can enter the food chain and be consumed by us
  • we can't filter the ocean, the only way to clean up this mess is to stop throwing plastic away

Kate and I have been on one big learning curve, navigating the highs and lows of a social enterprise. At times we have wanted to run away, but our passion for Seagulls drives us forward and we are now part of the fabric of the city; working with a vast range of people, providing a valuable reuse service and cheap source of paint for Leeds residents.

In 2017 we won Social Enterprise of the Year Yorkshire and Humber and were shortlisted for UK Environmental Social Enterprise in 2016 and 17. We are the leading Third Sector paint reuse scheme in the UK.

In December 2017 we were given the best Christmas present ever, a 5-year contract with Leeds City Council for the collection and reprocessing of unwanted household paint. This has given us some hard fought stability and with it the opportunity to expand the enterprise. We are ready to grow and expand the enterprise.

Risks & Challenges

We are a well-established and respected Social Enterprise, we have a long track record and we know how to grow. We truly are passionate and proud that Seagulls manages to juggle a triple bottom line: Planet People Profit. We need to build momentum for our enterprise and ensure its stability for the next 20 years.  Through this campaign we are looking for support both monetary and time. We need help to ensure we get the building we need to expand and grow. 

Like any other business, Seagulls has weathered many storms along the way, one of the biggest being The Boxing Day Foods in 2015. All of Seagulls was under water with some areas being over 1 metre deep. This was a particularly challenging time made better by people’s willingness to help. With people power we were operational within 2 weeks. The flood tested us on many different levels but we overcame the water and are stronger because of it.

Investment will ensure our capacity to deliver our expansion. Our management team have been in place since conception and we have gained many layers of knowledge over the years. Our track record gives us confidence to move the enterprise forward. We want to build on the goodwill we have gained over the years and promote community ownership and engagement in Seagulls.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand there will be many out there who support what we do but can’t contribute financially. What we ask is you come and buy your paint from Seagulls, tell your friends about us and use our plastic refill shop, would you come to an upcycling workshop or use the screen printing facilities? Have you thought about trying out a mosaic workshop? Would you like to volunteer and help us on our journey? We are always looking for handy people and we will be in need of  people power to make the changes we have in mind. Time is as valuable as money and you will always be well fed at Seagulls (we provide a cooked lunch for staff and volunteers everyday).

So please share and spread the word, we are in need of money but we are also in need of people to help.

thanks for reading :-)
story_txt:
Short Summary
Seagulls is a true grassroots Social Enterprise, established by me (Cat) and Kate around Kate’s kitchen table back in 2001. A Social Enterprise addresses social problems with a commercial response, there are no share holders and all profit goes back into the business to help more people.
Neither of us had business experience but we were (and still are) passionate about the local and global environment and social justice.   Two things we were sure on: we wanted to raise awareness of recycling and reuse in Leeds and we wanted to create jobs, training and volunteering opportunities for ourselves and others. We have always held the belief that if we can do it (and we still are) then anyone can and this is the message we pass on daily to our staff and volunteers.

Over the last 18 years we have grown organically into a thriving, colourful and friendly place. Paint and people are at the core of what we do. Since paint collections began we have diverted 900,000 litres of reusable paint away from landfill, provided employment for 18 people (90% having previously volunteered at Seagulls) and worked with over 500 volunteers.

The volumes of paint we are collecting and reusing continues to grow. Last year we collected 375 tonnes of paint all together, that’s double the volume from seven years ago, and it keeps on growing. One thing we can be sure of; there will never be a shortage of unwanted, reusable paint!
We also run a community arts project: Seagulls Mosaic and have undertaken numerous community mosaic installations and our work can now been seen across the city. We have worked with over 1000 Leeds residents to make these projects happen and created meaningful and long lasting public art.

We have reached a pivotal point and have the confidence and capacity to expand Seagulls, making it bigger and better and essentially able to reach more people. With bigger volumes of paint, the need to diversify our income streams and with more people wanting to get involved we need to expand our floor space and build capacity.
We have a vision, we have taken on additional space at Aire Place Mills and intend to do the following:

Build a new paint reprocessing and storage area that will enable us to move the majority of the paint mixing out of the paint store
Improve the paint store
Build 2 workshops for screen printing, upcycling furniture and woodwork
Establish and build a plastic refill shop, starting with basic refills but looking to expand product range of reusable and environmentally friendly products
Create a social area for volunteers and staff to encourage engagement


 


Most importantly we want to create more space to help more people. We know it sounds cheesy, but Seagulls is a place where people grow and build their confidence; learning life skills, teamwork and work experience. Our volunteer program We Grow People works and we want to do more of it.


What We Need & What You Get
These are exciting and busy times for Seagulls. Increasing volumes of paint means we need to make sure we have resources to cope, this means more space and more manpower. We have taken on additional units in our yard and now need the funds to make the place function better and build our capacity.
The increasing volume of paint means 3 things: 1. we have more volunteer opportunities 2. We need to expand our paint store and paint mixing/ storage areas to meet the demand and 3. we need more people to buy our paint.
We want to adapt and kit out some of the new space for better changing rooms and an additional social area. Work at Seagulls is messy and physical so we need to look after our staff and volunteers. Seagulls is under pinned by team work and we need space to allow this to happen. To blow our own trumpet; we have an excellent track record in engaging with people, building their life skills, knowledge and confidence.
This year we have seen an increase in demand for our volunteering opportunities; primarily people living with mental health problems, ex offenders and young adults with learning disabilities. We offer bespoke support, training and work experience opportunities. We have the funds for an additional staff member to support this demand and we anticipate working with an additional 20 volunteers per year. Because of the increase in paint we have the capacity within the paint store and collections to keep all volunteers meaningfully occupied. It’s a win win situation if we can make the space work.
With an increase in people power we can introduce a Plastic Refill Shop. In the first phase we will offer 3 of the most popular liquid refills and look to expand the range as funds allow. This initiative will take some staff time but we also think it will open up good volunteering opportunities.
We also plan to separate the new space to accommodate 2 workshop studios; 1 for screen printing and the other as an upcycling workshop. Funds will pay for the design and structure of these. These spaces will be a way of bringing more income into the enterprise.


Because we are a Social Enterprise we aren't able to offer shares in the business; any profit we make goes back into Seagulls to work with more people and support our environmental work. We have however put together various perks and gifts when you donate; we are most in love with the enamel pin badges which are limited edition's for this campaign. We are also working to offer more perks as the campaign progresses. As well as a perk  you also get to bathe in a warm glow, knowing that you are helping a social enterprise reach more people and do more good work in the community.


The Impact
Seagulls is a unique and off the wall business; we are passionate about finding ways to help the local and global environment whilst working with some of the most marginalised people in society. As one of my friends said ‘Seagulls is special and you are important to the fabric of Leeds, you’ve created a good thing where people know they have somewhere to go and feel valued and welcome, Seagulls gives people purpose and picks people up’.
Being part of Seagulls is like being part of a family. Because of our humble beginnings, we have created a place where people feel at ease almost straight away.
We work with a huge range of people, most living on the margins of society and disadvantaged for many different reasons; ex-offenders, young adults with learning disabilities, young people not in education or training, people living with often very serious mental health conditions. Many lack confidence, life skills and suffer extreme anxiety. Everyone at Seagulls is made to feel equal and part of the team. 
As well as playing an important role within the community we also have a positive impact on the environment. To date:

we have diverted and reused 900, 000 litres of paint away from landfill since 2005
people store an average of 17 tins per household
poorly disposed of paint poisons water sources
our paint brings colour to many homes and communities


With the addition of a plastic refill shop our environmental impact on Leeds will increase significantly. Plastic is a huge problem and we know we are well placed to help Leeds achieve higher reuse and reduction rates:

there are over 5 trillion bits of plastic floating in the sea
Plastic at sea breaks down into smaller and smaller bits contaminating sea- life
Plastic debris is eaten by around 50% of sea birds, 30% of turtles and 30% of fish in certain areas from where they can enter the food chain and be consumed by us
we can't filter the ocean, the only way to clean up this mess is to stop throwing plastic away

Kate and I have been on one big learning curve, navigating the highs and lows of a social enterprise. At times we have wanted to run away, but our passion for Seagulls drives us forward and we are now part of the fabric of the city; working with a vast range of people, providing a valuable reuse service and cheap source of paint for Leeds residents.
In 2017 we won Social Enterprise of the Year Yorkshire and Humber and were shortlisted for UK Environmental Social Enterprise in 2016 and 17. We are the leading Third Sector paint reuse scheme in the UK.
In December 2017 we were given the best Christmas present ever, a 5-year contract with Leeds City Council for the collection and reprocessing of unwanted household paint. This has given us some hard fought stability and with it the opportunity to expand the enterprise. We are ready to grow and expand the enterprise.


Risks & Challenges
We are a well-established and respected Social Enterprise, we have a long track record and we know how to grow. We truly are passionate and proud that Seagulls manages to juggle a triple bottom line: Planet People Profit. We need to build momentum for our enterprise and ensure its stability for the next 20 years.  Through this campaign we are looking for support both monetary and time. We need help to ensure we get the building we need to expand and grow. 
Like any other business, Seagulls has weathered many storms along the way, one of the biggest being The Boxing Day Foods in 2015. All of Seagulls was under water with some areas being over 1 metre deep. This was a particularly challenging time made better by people’s willingness to help. With people power we were operational within 2 weeks. The flood tested us on many different levels but we overcame the water and are stronger because of it.

Investment will ensure our capacity to deliver our expansion. Our management team have been in place since conception and we have gained many layers of knowledge over the years. Our track record gives us confidence to move the enterprise forward. We want to build on the goodwill we have gained over the years and promote community ownership and engagement in Seagulls.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand there will be many out there who support what we do but can’t contribute financially. What we ask is you come and buy your paint from Seagulls, tell your friends about us and use our plastic refill shop, would you come to an upcycling workshop or use the screen printing facilities? Have you thought about trying out a mosaic workshop? Would you like to volunteer and help us on our journey? We are always looking for handy people and we will be in need of  people power to make the changes we have in mind. Time is as valuable as money and you will always be well fed at Seagulls (we provide a cooked lunch for staff and volunteers everyday).

So please share and spread the word, we are in need of money but we are also in need of people to help.
thanks for reading :-)

story:
Enweave gets profits out of the picture so nobody has to choose between price and the planet. We’re creating an online marketplace where you can find everything you need, believe in the brands you find, and afford the brands you believe in.

 

...that’s all it takes to get you green brands at prices comparable to traditional brands.  How is it fair to expect someone to be concerned about our planet when they are concerned with how to pay rent, keep their family healthy, or face discrimination? Other subscriptions get you access to movies or music, but $5/month at Enweave builds an economy that meets people where they're at. We're making people- and planet-friendly products ordinary, by making them affordable. 

 

Corporate America needs a little kick in the ass. Big retailers profit by marking up products and charging sellers fees to use their marketplace, both of which increase prices. Enweave gets its customers green products in the simplest, most affordable way possible— by eliminating retail markups and seller fees. Here's how it works:

 

 A no-profit model isn’t just good for the planet, it makes business sense. When we put every dollar toward our mission, we’ll have the resources to produce an unparalleled platform and an unprecedented commitment to the planet. No other retailer can commit to keeping prices low or improving their marketplace like we can, because no other retailer is completely eliminating financial influence. Instead of shareholders who expect profits, we’ll be owned by a nonprofit that expects change.

Green brands deserve to profit for making good products, we just won’t add another layer of profits getting them to you. $5/mo may not seem like enough to do all this, but subscription models are really powerful. Some businesses use the subscription model and others use the nonprofit model, but we're combining both to revolutionize how business is done.

 

When responsible brands are affordable, there isn’t much of a market for companies acting without integrity. Nearly 90% of customers want ethical products, but most can’t spend more to get them. By finally reaching these customers, Enweave's prices push competitors to do better by the planet in a way they can’t ignore. Creating this kind of competition means our potential can reach far beyond our platform. We can build a new wave of better brands and spark an economy that commands respect for equity and the environment. 

 

We are on a mission to make green mainstream. From our nonprofit to our marketplace, we’ll use the economy to weave environmental action into the everyday. By doing so, we can turn environmental consciousness into systems that help extinguish injustice and form a more equitable, prosperous society. Here’s how: 

How we’ll use your contribution 

This campaign is primarily to determine demand and identify potential subscribers. It will help us gain a core of early-adopters and build out a platform accordingly. The $120,000 goal is equivalent to 2,000 subscribers. 

Donations will go to the following:

  • Hiring interdisciplinary experts to create product criteria
  • Finding a board of directors to form Enweave's parent nonprofit
  • Web development/annual fees for running website
  • Marketing efforts to more narrowly define our target customers
  • Seeking & hiring talent to build the platform
  • Revenue always funds efforts to operate a carbon-negative business, and profits go to reducing pollution in communities that have experienced environmental injustice. 
  • 10% of all funds are set aside to go straight to our parent non-profit!

 

Challenges & Potential Solutions

Enweave’s business model is meant to mitigate some of the common risks associated with retail and e-commerce. We don’t claim to have all these challenges figured out, but here’s what we are facing and how we think we can overcome it. For the sake of transparency and conciseness, below is a summarized list of challenges and full explanations are located in the the FAQs. 

  • Low margins in the retail industry can be mitigated with a reliable subscription model. 
  • High shipping costs can be mitigated by tying shipping costs to referral bonuses. 
  • Making large investments on products that don’t sell can be avoided by using a marketplace and drop shipping model until we have the data to inform such investments.  
  • Decreasing green brands’ margins with lower retail prices can be prevented by increasing overall demand and expanding the potential customer base for such brands.

 

    Other ways to help

    If you can't contribute, but care about our mission, here's how you can help out:

    • Share this campaign on social media, through email, or at work!
    • Ask questions/provide critique in the campaign page so that we can fine-tune our business model.
    • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Youtube. 
    • If you own a responsibly-made brand, check the FAQs to learn how to become a seller on Enweave.

     

    About Jacob

    You probably want to know who's running this thing before you start throwing cash around.  I'm a Chicago-based entrepreneur and a graduate of the University of Washington's Program on the Environment. I worked as a consultant in Seattle, where I created the city's first zero-waste coffee shop. I'm focused on solutions that make sustainability more accessible by making it more affordable. You can visit my profile & LinkedIn for more info. 

     

    Logo and branding designed by the fabulous Just Good Creative Studio in Seattle, WA!

Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Youtube. 
If you own a responsibly-made brand, check the FAQs to learn how to become a seller on Enweave.

I'm focused on solutions that make sustainability more accessible by making it more affordable. You can visit my profile & LinkedIn for more info. 
 

Logo and branding designed by the fabulous Just Good Creative Studio in Seattle, WA!

story:
Short Summary

As we are pleased to announce the Beta release of FreeMental Festival and we are moving to island of Cres, in the heart of the Croatian Adriatic sea.  This year festival door will be opened for 4 days and 3 nights from 15th of August until 18th of August where you will become one with "untouched" coast of beautiful island Cres.  
We have been working on organizing parties and festivals, as a crew of young enthusiasts, for many many years now and we have seen one common problem on all of them - litter. So even though our untouched nature hasn't seen that many people, the pollution is wast and present. The amount of rubbish brought on by the sea is noticeable so we as a crew decided to act on it.

We will be organizing a clean up action and go to Tarej beach and clean it all up, with a help from you.

Our goal is to clean Tarej beach but more than that, we wish to educate people into Green-Way of life, recycling, Zero Waste life and reuse culture. It is important to show festival goers that we can have fun in the nature and not pollute it or leave massive amount of rubbish after all. The money will go into items, people and education. It's important to educate people and show them just how much festivals generate litter and waste material.

Please help us make a change and donate! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Mostly we need people to act with us, the more volunteers the merrier. The money will be spent on supplies, cleaning equipment, garbage truck rent, gas for transport and all of the people who come with us will get a proper lunch.

All the money that is left will go to education of the people, we will have educational workshops, show-and-tell, as well as being a prime example on our own festival. 

For the festival, we will purchase biodegradable cutlery,  plates and of course reusable cups. Also we will provide to each visitor a reusable ashtray/bud dispenser as well as natural hand-made organic soap so the visitors don't pollute the ground or the sea.

Each campaign contributor selects item to receive for their donation. We have festival merchandise for each contributor - bags, backpacks, t-shirts, hoodies, tickets and bundles.

 

The Impact

The World is starting to wake up, the people are going green and we just cannot stand on the sidelines and wait. Our generation is the one that makes a difference!

Zero Waste is about reducing what we need (like single-use plastic), about reusing what we use (like festival decorations, stage designs and materials), recycle all waste material (plastic, glass, paper) and compost organic material. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks are foul weather that can set us back with our plan to clean up Tarej beach but for maximum of week or two.

Challenge is to get maximum number of volunteers to come and help us.

Also our biggest challenge is to succeed in Zero Waste philosophy, but we are determined to make it work.

 

About us

We are a group of young enthusiasts from Zagreb, Croatia. We love music and organization and after years of experience, hard work making our own parties, working on other festivals, we have decided to make our own festival. In 2018 we had Alpha Edition on river Mreznica in Generalski Stol. This year we decided to go to beautiful island Cres and be a permanent resident there. 

Our primary goal is to promote electronic music and also connect local unknown artist with worldly known artists. 

Our secondary goal is to connect all visitors, all artists and us with nature, show how to preserve this nature and to promote Eco way of life, through Zero Waste movement.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow our FreeMental festival FB event and page for more information. Or visit our web page freemental.eu.

story:
Hi, we are Louise and Will...with Isaac, Quinn & bump!

]

We live in a fabulous little seaside village called Kinghorn on the beautiful Fife coast in Scotland. 

As keen scuba divers and having both worked within the non-for-profit and environmental sector for many years, we are passionate about the Ocean and appalled at the devastation being caused by plastic pollution.  Approximately 8 million pieces of plastic end up in our Oceans every day,  with 100,000 marine mammals & turtles, and 1 million sea birds being killed annually by marine plastic pollution.  We are literally choking our planet to death.  

Recent studies found plastic pollution in 100% of marine turtles examined (Reference:  Surfers Against Sewage).  Image Credit:Shutterstock/RichCarey

We want to be part of the solution to reverse that trend and we want you to be too!!  Just a few simple changes can help individuals and families to massively reduce their plastic consumption.  Our mission is to provide the means to help that to happen by providing healthy, nutritious organic wholefoods, household cleaning products and bathroom products which people can refill into their own containers.  Zero packaging waste and with people only taking what they need, less food waste too.  We'll also be filling our lovely wee store with loads of super cool products to help people on their journey to 'reduce, reuse, recycle', as well as being a creative hub which supports independent artists & crafters who make fabulous handcrafted artifacts and gifts that fit right in with our plastic free, zero waste ethos.

 

So, what do we need? What will you get? And what will we spend your cash on? 

In short, we need you!  We need your ideas, your feedback, your support...and, if you can manage it, some dosh to help us get set up would be absolutely amazing. Setting up this kind of enterprise properly is an extremely costly undertaking, because of the sheer amount of specialist equipment required and the number of different stock items. We are taking out a personal loan and using savings to fund the significant majority of this project.  But any additional support would be so very welcome.

  • Donations of £10:  A unisex vegan cord bracelet with a turtle charm OR a reuseable shark keyring and bottle opener, and voucher for 20% off your first shop with us.
  • Donations up to £25:  A scrummy argan and olive oil soap bar (handmade, cold pressed, vegan, cruelty free, nasties free), a jute soap bag which doubles up as an exfoliator, and a handmade fused glass soap dish, plus a voucher for 20% off your first shop with us.
  • Donations £50 or over: A sterling silver turtle charm necklace with a turquoise howlite semi precious gemstone OR a Bamboo and recycled paper notebook and pen set, plus a voucher for 30% off your first shop with us.

Your donation will be used to fund: 

  1. Specialist zero waste scales and a bespoke point of sale system designed especially for Zero Waste shops; 
  2. Specialist food standard safety tested BPA free gravity dispensers and scoop bins designed especially for Zero Waste shops; 
  3. Stock.

The Impact

So what is the impact that we hope the shop will have and that you will be supporting? 

  1. As well as building a business for our wee family and for our fabulous artist in residence, the shop will be supporting approximately 35 - 40 independent artisans and craftspeople.  So your support will: help to build a network of independent British businesses, provide investment for a local community, provide jobs, support our British suppliers (we do not import any of our good from outside the UK although the source of origin for some products may be), help the growth of an independent High Street store, and help to support the local economy.
  2. We see this venture not just as a commercial venture but also as community based initiative.  So we will be working with local environmental charities and community groups to support a sustainability revolution and encourage agents of social change.  We see our role not just as providing the means to effect behavioural change but as an educational resource to help people understand better the environmental and human impact that their spending decisions have.  By encouraging ethical consumerism and the principles of circular economy, we can collectively have an enormous impact on reducing and reversing the destructive environmental impact that is taking place at an alarming rate.
  3. We have a robust Corporate Social Responsibility and Environmental policy which will be embedded into all of our decision making.  We pride ourselves on only working with reputable suppliers who share our ethical values.  We ensure that our products are packaging free as far as possible (and where packaging is necessary that it is recyclable and plastic free), cruelty free, made from natural ingredients (where at all possible), fair trade, palm oil free, and where the country of origin is outside the UK that they are sourced from companies which are not involved in child labour and that embrace fair trade principles.  We try to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible by buying from British suppliers and sourcing as much as possible locally from independant businesses.
  4. We will also be supporting our local food bank through a pay it forward scheme where our customers can add to their shop with a donation in kind, and we will add a further 25%.
  5. We will be selling bags and containers that have been donated to us to be reused for those who forget their own or decide to buy more than they had anticipated, and any money raised from that will be donated to Lend with Care - a microfinance initiative which supports entrepreneurs in developing countries to recognise the comparative privilege that we enjoy here in the UK. 
  6. And of course by cutting down our packaging and food waste we will be supporting our planet and building a normative framework of ethical consumerism, which we hope will have a positive generational change.

Risks & Challenges

We know that no business is without risk and this one is no exception.  Whilst we are at the forefront of the Zero Waste Revolution, which has made reusable and eco friendly products a trending market for 2019, we are by no means alone in our vision with several Zero Waste Stores a year cropping up across the UK.  That is why we feel it is important to establish ourselves quickly and fully into this emerging market.  Currently we have no direct competition within 30 miles as a bulk refill provider on a like for like basis (there are however fantastic offerings in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Dundee).  There are a few shops within a 10 mile radius that stock similar products and have a commitment to eco friendly products and a handful of refill options, but none which do what we are aiming to do. However, that could very easily change we are mindful of that so we need to act quickly!!

So why should you trust us in this emerging but competitive market?

Louise's background initially was as a commercial lawyer specialising in financial services litigation, before she moved professionally into the charity and not for profit sector.  She has spent nearly twenty years undertaking voluntary, consultancy, senior management and Director level roles both within the UK and in developing countries (most recently as the Country Director of an International NGO, in Papua New Guinea, where she also grew up). So Louise is responsible for understanding legalities and crunching the numbers.  But she also has a strong background in advocacy and business & strategy development (both with commercial organisations and community based societies).  For the past three years, whilst they have been building their family, Louise has been running a successful home based ecommerce business creating and selling handmade jewellery.

After studying Geography and Earth Sciences at University Will completed a Masters in Climate Change and Risk management, and has worked exclusively within environmental, climate change adaptation and conservation roles since then.  So he provides the environmental technical expertise which supports this initiative, whilst working full time in his professional role.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for getting this far.  If you can't contribute financially there are loads of other ways to get involved:

  1. You can help us out by sharing this crowd funding initiative on social media and amongst your friends; 
  2. Please like and share our facebook page: www.facebook.com/grainandsustain
  3. If you have any ideas or suggestion please get in touch and share them with us:  grainandsustain@outlook.com

And that's all there is to it.  Thank you so much for your interest.  If you have any questions or suggestions please pop us a message via facebook or to grainandsustain@outlook.com 

Lou & Will
story_txt:
Hi, we are Louise and Will...with Isaac, Quinn & bump!
]
We live in a fabulous little seaside village called Kinghorn on the beautiful Fife coast in Scotland. 

As keen scuba divers and having both worked within the non-for-profit and environmental sector for many years, we are passionate about the Ocean and appalled at the devastation being caused by plastic pollution.  Approximately 8 million pieces of plastic end up in our Oceans every day,  with 100,000 marine mammals & turtles, and 1 million sea birds being killed annually by marine plastic pollution.  We are literally choking our planet to death.  

Recent studies found plastic pollution in 100% of marine turtles examined (Reference:  Surfers Against Sewage).  Image Credit:Shutterstock/RichCarey
We want to be part of the solution to reverse that trend and we want you to be too!!  Just a few simple changes can help individuals and families to massively reduce their plastic consumption.  Our mission is to provide the means to help that to happen by providing healthy, nutritious organic wholefoods, household cleaning products and bathroom products which people can refill into their own containers.  Zero packaging waste and with people only taking what they need, less food waste too.  We'll also be filling our lovely wee store with loads of super cool products to help people on their journey to 'reduce, reuse, recycle', as well as being a creative hub which supports independent artists & crafters who make fabulous handcrafted artifacts and gifts that fit right in with our plastic free, zero waste ethos.


 
So, what do we need? What will you get? And what will we spend your cash on? 
In short, we need you!  We need your ideas, your feedback, your support...and, if you can manage it, some dosh to help us get set up would be absolutely amazing. Setting up this kind of enterprise properly is an extremely costly undertaking, because of the sheer amount of specialist equipment required and the number of different stock items. We are taking out a personal loan and using savings to fund the significant majority of this project.  But any additional support would be so very welcome.

Donations of £10:  A unisex vegan cord bracelet with a turtle charm OR a reuseable shark keyring and bottle opener, and voucher for 20% off your first shop with us.
Donations up to £25:  A scrummy argan and olive oil soap bar (handmade, cold pressed, vegan, cruelty free, nasties free), a jute soap bag which doubles up as an exfoliator, and a handmade fused glass soap dish, plus a voucher for 20% off your first shop with us.
Donations £50 or over: A sterling silver turtle charm necklace with a turquoise howlite semi precious gemstone OR a Bamboo and recycled paper notebook and pen set, plus a voucher for 30% off your first shop with us.



Your donation will be used to fund: 

Specialist zero waste scales and a bespoke point of sale system designed especially for Zero Waste shops; 
Specialist food standard safety tested BPA free gravity dispensers and scoop bins designed especially for Zero Waste shops; 
Stock.


The Impact
So what is the impact that we hope the shop will have and that you will be supporting? 

As well as building a business for our wee family and for our fabulous artist in residence, the shop will be supporting approximately 35 - 40 independent artisans and craftspeople.  So your support will: help to build a network of independent British businesses, provide investment for a local community, provide jobs, support our British suppliers (we do not import any of our good from outside the UK although the source of origin for some products may be), help the growth of an independent High Street store, and help to support the local economy.

story:
Short Summary

Wounded Nature – Working Veterans is unlike most other environmental and veterans oriented non-profits.  They are a remedial environmental organization that uses veterans and volunteers to remove debris and derelict boats from tidal marshes, rural coastlines and other hard to access areas on a year round basis.  They do not do token cleanups on Earth Day, World Ocean Day or other similar awareness holidays.

Wounded Nature - Working Veterans  has removed more debris tonnage than all other environmental non-profits combined.  We venture into the hard to access barrier islands and tidal marshes where debris from past storms resides and has never been cleaned up.  We have always done so with a lack of the right equipment and funding.

  You can help us significantly increase our effectiveness by purchasing a supportive and cool t-shirt to help us buy the equipment we need.  Or you can have your name or the name of your business listed on the new aluminum work boats.  It is a great way to show everyone that you are helping us make a Real Coastal Difference.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to buy two customized aluminum workboats for use in removal of large pieces of treated wood and tires from the tidal marshes, In order to restore and revive our wildlife habitat.  We need two custom built aluminum boats and trailers with assorted equipment such as power winches, compressors (for air bags and tools), including expense for insurance and fuel.

  Wounded Nature has a  goal to raise $440,000.  If we raise more money, we will use the funds for dumpster and disposal fees and to remove some abandoned boats.  If we raise less, we will buy the equipment we can afford based on the amount raised. 

Our basic budget is:

Aluminum work boats w/double axle trailers:  $240,000

Boat special modifications:  $48,000

Motors:  $32,000

Motor cabling, steering, batteries and console:  $22,000

Tools, accessories, equipment for outfitting the boats:  $18,000

Operating costs including insurance, fuel, maintenance and overhead operating costs: $80,000

The Impact

You do not hear about the old treated wood, tires and other large debris problems because we are a remedial action group verses an advocacy organization.  We work on fixing the problem, rather than creating new laws that may be unnecessary or never get enforced.

  We get into the tidal marshes and areas behind the high tide line, where trash and storm debris get washed up.  These areas are where our coastal wildlife live and nest.

  Unfortunately, it’s the same area where treated wood from washed away docks, old tires and past storm debris reside.  Two things happen in these areas once they accumulate a lot of trash and debris that results in wildlife populations decreasing in our coastal areas.   First, rats and snakes move into these debris piles and start feeding on hatchlings.  The second is that the creosote and arsenic in old treated wood and petroleum chemicals from old tires leech into the water ways.  Young shrimp and baby fish are extremely sensitive to these chemicals.

  This debris is totally hidden since it is on the ground and pushed back behind marsh grasses and behind the coastal dunes.  So what looks like a pristine area by boat may well be a hidden debris field that is limiting wildlife and seafood populations from thriving.

  Wounded Nature  has 10 plus years of experience removing debris up and down the East Coast.  We do it year round.  On large cleanups our volunteers know the pain and yet feel the gain!  Dealing with insects, they get dirty, may obtain some minor cuts and scrapes, get cold and wet, but together we get the debris out and the job accomplished.

 You can make a real coastal difference without having to get dirty, wet or cold - leave that to us.  

For $50, we will send you a "Making a Real Coastal Difference" t-shirt.  For $100, we will send you a sea turtle boat/beach/shopping bag plus a t-shirt.  For $500, we will place your name or the name of your business on Our Wounded Nature boat and send you a t-shirt. 

Risks & Challenges

Our risks and challenges have always been money and equipment.  No matter how small of a donation you make, it will help us make a real coastal difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot buy a t-shirt to support what we do, would you please share this campaign on all of your social media sites?  It will make a difference.
