Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF) of IUCN, Fondation Ensemble and ASN Foundation for their financial support for this project.




Go to www.bring-the-elephant-home.org 
for more information about this project.

story:
Synopsis

OOLYGALLIES is in development to be a TV series introducing little creators who live in the forest.  Their skin is green, their ears looks like that of an elves and their hair sticks straight up like a long haired crew cut. They have four fingers and three toes that point outward with long yellow toenails. The Oolygallies must do whatever they can to protect the forest from the bark beetles: Just one problem: they're only two inches tall!


       


Deep within 9200 acres of the San Bernardino National Forest is a small village called Lake Arrowhead. There is about 14 miles of shoreline, which is about 100 feet deep. The sun can be seen through the trees as the wind blows back and forth and only the sounds of the water can be heard within the forest. Suddenly, you hear Carnego yelling “Lady Rose had two babies... two babies the Lady had,” while he is running through the forest.

Oolygallies stand about two inches tall, their skin is green, their eyes look like that of an elf while their hair sticks up like a long haired crew cut. They have four fingers and three toes, which point outward with long yellow toenails, and the only clothes they wear is that of a skirt type wrap around which is made from plant leaves.

The Oolygallies get along with everyone and they don’t have any enemies until new bugs arrive in the forest. These bugs are the bark beetles, which begin to destroy all of the trees, jeopardizing the future of the Oolygallies’ homes and the forest.

At the same time they are trying to save their home and the forest, history is made in the Oolygallie family when the head council, Master Bay and Lady Rose give birth to twins, a boy and a girl. With it being a new generation, Lady Rose would like their daughter to be part of all the head council decisions, but Master Bay refuses.

The twin daughter, Lady Roxy overhears her parents arguing one day and they appeared to be arguing about her. Lady Roxy was upset so she went for a long walk and she gets lost. It is at this time that Lady Roxy discoveries another tribe of Oolygallies that already lost their homes. Lady Roxy becomes close friends with one of the children, Misha and a special friendship begins. Can Lady Roxy's new found friendship together stop the bark beetles from destroying the rest of the forest?


The Impact

We want this film to have a lasting impression not only on children, but on adults as well. The message of this TV series is to show the differences in all of us through the eyes of the Oolygalies. They teach us to protect our environment, our wildlife, the forest disease and pest infestations and what they need to do to protect the forest. At the same time, they find new friendship and together they fight the bark beetles.


Budget





If you want to help, but can't afford to contribute money, you can still pitch in by sharing this campaign with as many people as possible: with friends and family, on your social media, and all over the Internet. Not only will you help raise awareness for this campaign, but you might help someone who wants to support 3D animation, find out about the project and make Oolygallies a reality.


                                       

                                       

                         JOHN PETROVITZ

                                             PRESIDENT


John Petrovitz is a producer, director and a designer with more than twenty years of multi -cultural and diverse industry experience in all aspects of animation production including development, preproduction, production and post production with credits in more than forty projects.

John has more than fifteen years’ experience in overseas production. He produced, directed and supervised production of more than 100 half hour TV episodes, two features and a number of short films, specials, commercials and pilots in 2D,3D and Flash for Cartoon Network, Discovery Kids, Film Roman, Marvel, Felix the Cat Productions and Cinegroupe (Canada) and others.

John has extensive experience as an executive who founded production studios in US, Korea and Russia. Served as a director on LA Visual Artists Association Board, President at ZIS Productions, President at NIC Entertainment, President at UNART production, Korea and Chief Creative Officer at Digicon Media.


                                     

                                              

                                          BECKY ALTRINGER

                                       VICE PRESIDENT


Becky has been a business entrepreneur for over 20 years. She founded and is the President of Ariel Investigations and Digicon Media. She has recently been brought on as Vice President of NIC Entertainment.

Becky is best known for exposing the Motion Picture Association of America when Academy Award nominated documentary film director Kirby Dick and producer Eddie Schmidt hired and cast her as herself in "This Film Is Not Yet Rated", an investigation into the MPAA film ratings system and its impact on American culture. Becky also worked with Kirby Dick on documentary "Outrage" and "The Invisible War". 

The Oolygallies was written and created by Becky over 15 years ago. She is thrilled to have met John almost four years ago and overwhelmed to see her dream of the Oolygallies in develop through animation due to the efforts and friendship of John. 

Becky created the village of Oolygallies, which she hopes to become the new environmental heroes. She believes that the most important message this story should convey to the children in a very simple and entertaining way is the protection of our very fragile environment where even the smallest creatures like the Oolygallies are able to accomplish a lot.

The Oolygallies are peace loving creatures living next to all types of of insects, little birds and other small forest animals. The Oolygallies use big beetles as ground transportation and dragonflies and little birds as aircraft.

The beetles and some other big insects help them protect their land from a different kind of invader including the most dangerous Bark Beetles which are killing the trees which are causing fire and droughts. Their other daily fight is protecting their homes from the invasion of the human civilization. 

Becky's dream is to see the Oolygallies become an animated television series. Becky cares about her grandchildren’s future and global warming. She would like to see Oolygallies become the new environmental heros who teach children about protecting our environment while learning the important life lessons of saving the future of mother earth. 

 

                        

                                               Click House

                    Co-Developer and Animation Producer 

                                                     Click - House

Click-House (UK ) Ltd is a UK based high-end graphic and animation production studio having its offices in London, USA and Bangladesh. They are capable of pilot your graphic and animation related project from start to finish, leading you through every step of process from initial design and planning stage through implementation.

From their state of art facility with a very talented team of CG artists and roaster of Directors/Producers combining with strong management support, they offer full range of 3D and V/FX services. They work with production companies, game developers, independent filmmakers, broadcasters, producers as well as the world’s leading agencies on commercial and cross-platform campaigns. Clients come to them for their ability to solve creative challenges and value their creative input at any stage of their production. They have perfected a service that ensures efficiency, flexibility and quality within a competitive budget.


        AN ENORMOUS THANK YOU !

We can't thank you enough for visiting our page and checking out the campaign. We hope that you become a part of this journey with us on making the best animated TV series possible. 

This is a big project and it's going to have it's risks and challenges just like any other film. It is also going to take us a lot of time and effort to make it great. 

Whether we raise $100 or our goal of $80,000, we are going to pour our hearts and souls into making it the best. And it will be because of you that we can do it.                                 


     "Animation offers a medium of story- telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world." 
Walt Disney

story:
The Challenge:

Is to protect Ka'Kabish, an ancient Maya city, from agricultural development that would see the site stripped of trees and the ancient temples and buildings leveled by bulldozers.  The land on which the site sits, as with virtually all of the surrounding area, was divided up into land parcels decades ago and sold to private buyers.  Today most of this land is either already cleared or slated to be cleared for agricultural activities.  We are working with the Institute of Archaeology, a division of the National Institute of Culture and History, in Belize, to buy back this section of land and stop the impending destruction.

What is Ka'Kabish?

Ka'Kabish is an ancient Maya city located in what is now north-central Belize.  Archaeological investigations show that the site was first occupied around 800 BC and that it survived until AD 1500.



Campaign Update:

Last year we raised just over $20,000 CND with your help.  In co-collaboration with the Institute of Archaeology, NICH, we were able to make a down-payment on the site of Ka’kabish.  However, we still need to raise $34,000 CND to finish the sale.

What have we done so far?

In 2015, we worked with the Institute of Archaeology to have the forest area that covers Ka’kabish surveyed. This allowed the section of land the ruins sits on to be excised from the larger parcel of agriculturally-zoned land on which it sits.  Once it was identified as a separate parcel of land the Institute of Archaeology, with the funds provided by our donors, was able to make a down-payment on the ruin that effectively removed it, for now, from danger of development.

Why We Need More:

While we were able to secure the site from impending development we still need to raise funds to complete the purchase of the project.  If we are unsuccessful the land will be vulnerable to development.

What is our plan?

Once we raise the additional $34,000 CND necessary to complete the purchase of the property, the ruin will be incorporated into the National Archaeological Reserve system of Belize. This will afford the site protection from clearing and development in perpetuity.  As part of the Archaeological Reserve system it will be accessible to the people of Belize and tourists who want to learn about ancient Maya culture.  Through continued archaeological work at the site and engagement with the surrounding communities we will promote a better understand of the value of cultural heritage and make future rescue efforts like this one unnecessary.

The campaign to raise the funds is an on going process.  This is our second fundraising drive, and If we are unsuccessful in meeting our target we will continue trying through Indiegogo and by working with other agencies until we get the money necessary.  


The Backstory:

Once upon a time . . . all of this section of north-central Belize was covered by dense jungle forest and you could drive all the way from the ruins of Lamanai to Ka’Kabish and beyond and see nothing but trees.  Today, this is not the case as every year more and more parcels of land are cleared for agricultural development and settlement leaving little remaining in the way of forest cover or tree lines. This development now threats to destroy the 3,000 year old ancient city of Ka’Kabish. 

Who are we?

I am Dr. Helen Haines, a professor of anthropology at Trent University Canada, I also am the director of the Ka’Kabish Archaeological Research Project, this is an international team of researchers and students who work with our Belizean colleagues and community members in Indian Church Village to not only investigate the history of the 3,000 year old ancient city of Ka’Kabish but also strive to protect it for future generations.

What we want:

We want to save Ka’Kabish from agricultural development that would strip the forest and level the ruins.

What your contribution will fund:

All of your money will go directly towards the purchase of the site.  The perks that you received are supplied by KARP and paid for by Dr. Haines as part of her commitment to preserving the site.  

Funds raised above the currently needed amount will be used to purchase additional lands to the north of the site on which additional courtyard complexes are located and are still under forest coverage.

Please note, that this campaign is not tax-deductible in Canada.  

How you can help:

We realise that not everyone can financially support causes no matter how worthy.  However,  you can still help by helping us get the word out about our cause. Please share this link or like us on Facebook.

of your money will go directly towards the purchase of the site.  The perks that you received are supplied by KARP
and paid for by Dr. Haines as part of her commitment to preserving the site.  Funds raised above the currently needed amount will be used to purchase additional lands to the north of the site on which additional courtyard complexes are located and are still under forest coverage.Please note, that this campaign is not tax-deductible in Canada.  How you can help:
We
realise that not everyone can financially support causes no matter how
worthy.  However,  you can still help by helping us get the word out about our
cause. Please share this link or like us on Facebook.

story:
So what's going on?

The Mongol Rally is perhaps one of the craziest and wackiest motorist events out there. Each summer for the past decade and a half enthusiasts have flocked from all over the world to participate in what is essentially a grand celebration of human stubbornness (or stupidity): a crazy drive from Prague in Central Europe to Ulan-Ude near the Russian-Mongolian border, looking for as much trouble along the way as possible.

A stereotypical mongolrallier (from the Adventurists website)

There are only three rules, which elegantly sum up the spirit of the Rally:

The first is that the vehicle must be small and rubbish, so as to maximize the chance of something going wrong along the way.

The second: you must make your own way, with no help from the organizers when something does inevitably go wrong.

Finally and most importantly, you must raise at least £1000 for charity. This is the tender soul of the rally and is the primary reason why it was organised in the first place.

Today we are asking you to help us participate in this life-changing adventure!

 

The Team

Let us properly introduce ourselves: Ilya and Vanya, two cousins hailing from Saint-Petersburg, Russia. Ilya, the cool guy and the captain of our little team, is working day and night in a small chain of coffee houses which he has recently opened in Saint-P. Vanya is our team's translator and is a student at Cambridge University and an aspiring Materials scientist.

The Team: Ilya (left) and Vanya (right)

The Charity

Charity is a core part of the Mongol Rally. We will be sponsoring the Cool Earth charity, one of the most respected climate change and humanitarian organisations, endorsed by the likes of David Attenborough. It is an oversimplification to just say that Cool Earth is "protecting rainforests". Their complex strategy in fact accomplishes three goals at the same time.

The rainforest we are trying to help protect (from the Cool Earth website)

Cool Earth's approach centers around working with local communities living in the forest. Providing funding for education, food and water, local businesses and small industries, Cool Earth ensure that it is the local's interests to keep the rainforests healthy. This 1) protects the forests and the incredible biodiversity they contain, 2) relieves poverty in some of the poorest areas of the world, and 3) provides excellent opportunities to study local wildlife.

Check out their website if you want to know more: https://www.coolearth.org/

 

What will you be funding?

Our funding goal will be broken into three parts. One third of the funds we collect will go directly to Cool Earth. The second third will go towards funding all the nasty paperwork that we unfortunately need to participate in the rally: the rally entry fee, visas, permits etc. etc... The rest will help us to actually complete our journey safely: as you can imagine, driving 14 000+ km isn't easy or cheap - petrol, food, maintenance, bribes... and we need all the help we can get! You can either make a kind donation directly to us or get one of the great "perks" listed to the right.

If you cannot help us financially, we will also greatly appreciate if you can help spread the word about your upcoming adventure. Make sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram (and/or Vkontakte): we plan to take many stunning photographs and videos along our journey, and to stitch it all into a cool film in the best traditions of Top Gear specials, so we're sure you'll enjoy coming along for the ride (in spirit at least)!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/rebelswithoutcause2018/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/chudesa_ilya

Vkontakte: https://vk.com/rebelswithoutcause

Finally, if you are interested in a more substantial sponsorship, with more prominence in our pictures and videos, contact us directly to discuss terms.

 

The car and the route

And here is our very own baby, a Lada Niva 1981, proud scion of the USSR automotive industry, which at its respectable 37 years of age will no doubt cause us no end of headaches this summer.

Of course, there are more 'brutal' options of vehicles, but our main motivation in or choice is the relative reliability (nay, repair-worthiness) of the Niva and the optimal elbow-window height ratio!

"But what about the pollution?!"  we hear you cry. Well, firstly, we hope that the money we raise for Cool Earth will more than cover our slight carbon footprint. But more importantly, we want to stress that we in no way promote the use of old (especially Russian) cars. In fact, we hope that by demonstrating the hardships we will undoubtedly suffer in our old baby this summer we will be giving a stark example of why NOT to drive such cars.

As for the route: each team is free to choose how they get to Ulan-Ude: the crazier - the better and the more respect you gain. We will begin our journey going down through the Alps and beautiful Italy, then, by ferry - to the Balkans, through Istanbul and across Turkey. The combination of the Italian and Turkish summers in a car with no air conditioning - "great fun!!"

The route we will take from Prague to Ulan-Ude, with the major points marked out

Then through Georgia, Russia and Kazakhstan towards the Pamir Tract - one of the most difficult and fascinating roads typically picked by ralliers. Afterwards: the Altai mountains and the entirety of Mongolia!

So help us accomplish something grand this summer, as we plod across the deserts of Kazakhstan and plunge through the mountains of Tajikistan, for a glorious adventure and for self-discovery, for charity and to save the planet!

Thank you!

We will begin our journey going down through the Alps and beautiful Italy, then, by ferry - to the Balkans, through Istanbul and across Turkey. The combination of the Italian and Turkish summers in a car with no air conditioning - "great fun!!"

So help us accomplish something grand this summer, as we plod across the deserts of Kazakhstan and plunge through the mountains of Tajikistan, for a glorious adventure and for self-discovery, for charity and to save the planet!
Thank you!

story:
Meet the Saker Falcon, a virtuoso in the air!

 

   

This magnificent bird used to be numerous in Bulgaria in the late 19th century, being one of the commonest birds of prey, especially in the lowlands. Today there are no breeding pairs left in the country. Direct persecution and habitat change caused a sharp decline and eventually extinction of the species in Bulgaria in 20th century. All these were human activities. We believe that human activities will now help the birds return to life!

If you would like to support the Sakers and help us develop our conservation program, we are happy to announce that now we can accept donations and offer perks through this page!

Every dollar raised will go towards supporting our „Saker Breeding and Release Program“. The more funds we collect - the more chicks we can produce and release in the wild!

For further information you can always contact us at info@sciencefornature.org. If you would like to keep up to date with how things are progressing, follow the links below:

Facebook: Science for nature Foundation, Non-Governmental Organization

Web: www.saker.sciencefornature.org

Thank you for your continued support!

 

WHAT WE DID SO FAR?

We implemented Feasibility Study (2006-2009) that assess the chances of success of re-establishing the species population in Bulgaria (link). It includes:

-  investigations of the reasons for extinction of Saker falcons as a breeding species in Bulgaria;

-  assessment of the best places for release of birds in the nature;

-  choice of a proper method for reintroduction;

-  population model that shows how many birds need to be released and for what period in order to establish a breeding population in the country.

Following this study we established a captive breeding program in 2010. We now have three pairs in breeding facility that annually produce 10-15 chicks to be released in the wild.

In the period 2011-2014 we implemented pilot releases of 3-6 birds every year in order to assess their survival rate, reasons for mortality and preferred habitat use. The birds were fitted with satellite transmitters to follow their movement. The flights of some of ours famous travelers are presented on the map below:

Meanwhile we implement various supporting activities to the re-establishment Saker population such as:

-  artificial nest program – to increase the nest opportunities of the species.

-  awareness campaign – to engage local people and conservation community in Saker falcon conservation.

-  habitat management – to increase the prey base of the species (mainly European souslik).

 

OUR AIM

We (Science for Nature Foundation) need resources to continue our work helping the birds return to their habitats and to continue informing people.

Your funding will help us continue our work:

-  Help restore nesting population of the species – breed and release Sakers into the wild.

-  Improving and restoring Saker habitats, protection of the European Sousliks and other important prey for Saker falcons.

-  Raising public awareness and helping stakeholder’s interaction about Sakers protection – issuing of information materials, implementing workshops and meetings, engaging conservation authorities in Saker conservation.

-  Increasing the capacity of Bulgarian organisations in the field of nature conservation through exchange of experience.

 

CHALLENGES AND EXPECTATIONS

Our plan is to produce and release in the wild 20 Saker falcon chicks every year from 2017-2021. Our extensive research on the population model showed that if we do this we will successfully end with re-established sustainable and increasing breeding population in Bulgaria.

Moreover we will focus on protection and conservation of Saker's habitats by purchasing lands with souslik colonies and nesting trees in order to prevent destroying it in the future.

Last but not least - we will continue working with our partners and search  for  new ones in order to establish strong conservation network beyond any borders.

 

FUNDING WE NEED AND WHERE IT'S GOING

- € 6,000 - Feeding and care for captive falcons and maintaining the captive breeding program;

-  € 18,000 - Release of Sakers into the wild (i.e. per-diem for volunteers taking care for falcons for 3 months (May-July); food for the chicks; petrol for traveling);

-  € 5,000 - Awareness campaign (i.e. T-shirts, information materials, meetings and workshops with stakeholders).

-  € 6,000 - Purchase of land with Souslik colonies and proper nesting trees for the Saker Falcon.

This funding is needed for 1 year of our long term plan. 

 

DON'T FORGET

WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

For every donation you will receive a special gift with custom design - postcards, T-shirts, bags, etc.

But mostly you will have the chance to be part of something bigger! With joined forces you can not only contribute to Sakers' family but also be part of it - with "symbolical" adoption or participation in releasing one of those 20 birds at the end of the successful program!

Even if you only support us by sharing our campaign or informing people you will get a warm thank you! from our team and all the birds who will be able to return into the wild!

                                          

 

 

ABOUT US

Science for Nature Foundation NGO is a group of open-minded, creative and responsible people, dedicated to nature conservation and restoration. We are multidisciplinary team of ecologists, biologists, environmental consultants, designers, GIS experts and urban planners. Our collaboration with institutions  (Institute of Biodiversity and Ecosystem Research & National Museum of Natural History) and leading NGOs in Bulgaria helps us preserve the natural ecosystems for future generations and raise public awareness on the environmental problems we are facing today.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US!

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help Saker Falcon any other way! You can inform your friends to share our campaign!

THANK YOU!

story:
Per partecipare - To take part

Traduzione in italiano >>>

Do it with us!

in a marinas and social area for the healthiness of people.

embarked as equipment on transport or a cruise ships for remediation to accidental spills.

to catch spread patterns on the sea.

 

the best and simplest solution for real needs!

 

 

  •  1) Widely usable
  • 2) Restrict pollutants to capture them more easily
  • 3) No pumps and no additional energy
  • 4) No splitting water's surface with the bow of a ship
  • 5) Simple and robust device

  •  1) Little costs, rational project, no risk of breakage.
    OilKiller is for ordinary clean up in the absence of catastrophic spills (that we hope will not happen) but can be used for the damage reduction.
  • 2) With a  catamaran shape.
  • 3) With a patented device to catch a film of water and sends it to a small area.
  • 4) With a patented device in which several filters extract the oily pollutants.
  • 5) With the natural storage of pollutants inside the filters.
    Anyone can cruise, no specialization needed; bridge and operator are never dirty.

Our prototypes:

on left "OK B" (basic) with fixed hulls and on right "OK S" (smart) with foldable hulls

OilKiller is the OK boat

Here how it works:

A large dustpan captures the surface of water

The oily spots float on the surface

Water and oil meet the filters and the graphene bags absorb the oil for contact

The cleaned water flows free and the oil remains in the filter bags

All this with the little power of two small outboards
Done!

The OilKiller story

Everything started when Lombarda Petroli dumped 10 million litres of Diesel oil into the Lambro River. I spent my youth in the Park of Monza and it is still my enchanted garden.

  • The Lambro River
  • The accident
  • Some response
  • Monza: the Park, the autodrome

Technicians were struggling with absorbent placemats and floating barriers put in place to intercept those 10 million litres.

On 20th April 2010 the Deepwater Horizon platform exploded in the Gulf of Mexico.

Both events were tragic: the black wave of the Lambro river for the Park of Monza and for the Po river natural environment and the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico for the whole ocean and the coasts of Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Florida as well as for the marine fauna and birds.

  • Lambro
  • Louisiana
  • Fauna

The TV showed fire and chemical dispersants everywhere and the fishermen collecting oil with their nets. On 4th July 2010 the giant ship “A whale”, specially setted up for this accident, reached the Gulf of Mexico showing the incapability to collect any minimum amount of oil. Centrifugal separators were also purchased by actor Kevin Costner which also prove disappointing.
The fact remains that in front of huge disasters it seems that we can react only thanks to huge, complex and very expensive means like these here below. For myself the fishermen looked to be the most effective and environment respecting operators, lifting oil emulsions out of water with a so simple tool: nets!

  • Bottsand class
  • A Whale
  • Sweeping arm
  • Hull with mouth

Only the mechanical removal of pollutants effectively removes the pollution while solvents, thickeners and chemicals dissolve the pollutant in the water and poison fauna and flora or make it precipitate under the surface destroying its ecosystem and seriously compromising plankton. Fire poisons the air up to the highest altitudes.

It's understood that in tragic situations it's necessary to get compromises among the various methods of remediation with the aim to reduce the damage as much as possible.

At that time, I became
 to deepen the scientific knowledge on how oil leaks live on water and that knowledge supported me in starting to develop to the current OilKiller.

It's important to say something about oily slicks life on water surface.

  • when the spill occurs into water, the oil undergoes significant changes due to exposure to air and sun (here the ITOPF page about weathering effects on oil spills)
  • in the first hour about 25% of the spill evaporates

  • the thickness of the spill decreases rapidly up to a few thousandths of a millimetre even after a few hundred meters from the point where it happened 

  • the slick tells you about its thickness showing its colour

  •   the oily patches are pushed by winds and currents and a part of them reaches the coasts

  • the main responsible for the introduction of hydrocarbon at sea are agricultural, industrial and urban waste (44%) 

  • degradation processes (evaporation, diffusion, etc.) are very fast and after one day the oil spill has already lost a quarter of its volume, has overrun an area of square kilometres and has thinned to thousandths of a millimetre. 

All these scientific considerations allow us to give a

First conclusions:

  • the presence on waters of oil slicks is a reality, even far away from heavy spills and even in the absence of these;
  • the oily sheen that in everyday life can be observed along the coasts, sea front, docks, channels, etc. are the consequence of the drift of oil from large spills occurred far away, or of the routine activities in port areas (maintenance, refuelling, loading and unloading), or for the agricultural, industrial and civil discharges;
  • the presence of oily spots is dangerous to the flora and fauna, affects the healthiness of fish, crustaceans and bivalves (mussels, clams, etc.) that enter in the human food, dirties boats and infrastructure, generates bad smells, ruins the beauty of places and is dangerous for social life, tourism and economy;
  • the oily spots are always very thin except that very near to a disastrous event and nowadays there aren’t devices dedicated to their removal except for absorbent napkins or dissolving sprays;
  • to place absorbent placemats is a long work, requires personal and it is a dirty job; the sprays can be expensive and difficult to apply, they distribute the pollution in the mass of water or make it fall towards the bottom and on the one that it meets in the sinking: fish, miticolture, algae...

Up to the OilKiller

Here a short story by images:

 

Main values of OilKiller

  • efficient
  • effective
  • transportable
  • essential and simple
  • easy
  • free of dirt

EFFICENT

It does the job well and with the least possible consumption of energy. OilKiller performs in a new way or at least better than everything possible today with available tools.
FLOC (FLexible Oil Collector), the interceptor of the water surface, was developed and patented and it represents the introduction of a new system complaint with the criterion of innovation.

The way how FLOC works can be referred to weir skimmer that use gravity and pumps to drain oil from the water surface. Weir skimmers are dropped from a vessel by a crane.

The hole of a weir skimmer is small and the device is designed to work at a fixed point.
Operation requires:

  • a skimmer
  • a pump
  • a source of energy
  • a support boat
  • a crane
  • a settling tank
  • a staff

And here some prices

Here below the graphic description of the connection between FLOC and the weir skimmers. 

FLOC moves with the boat, goes itself to meet the oily slicks, can follow them, doesn't need pumps neither tank, stores the pollutants in its filters, only uses the energy of the outboard engines.

Consider please the advantage of moving rather than being fixed: most skimmers have been designed to work at a fixed point. They are dropped in the middle of the spill with a crane and at that point they take the mixtures of water and oil to send it with a pump on a support vessel. Movement is a real need so that a few years ago some of them have been equipped with push systems to be little moved anyway remaining bound to the mother ship. Ships equipped with sweeper are expensive exceptions and there are few of them around the world. OilKiller autonomously navigates to the areas that have to be cleaned or rehabilitated.
The advantage is evident and I wish to explain this with the pictures here below.


EFFECTIVE

OilKiller uses the flow generated by its movement to convey water and oil mixture towards a restricted area at the stern to meet elements containing strongly oleophilic graphene that captures the oil fraction by contact and absorbs it within itself by storing it.

 

 

The FLOC shape is designed in order to avoid filtering the entire mass of water intercepted. The oils float therefore it is enough to filter only the free surface. FLOC keeps the flow constant so that not to generate a brake on the incoming water, then splits it into two flows: a superficial one with the pollutants that flows through the filters and a lower one with the mass of water directly released. The contact of the oily fraction with the graphene takes place in an area that we have called FilterBox. All this to need the less energy possible to reach the result and make it possible to use only the small outboard engines.

 

 

The filtering system can reach up to 25 litres for each refill of filters; replacing the filter is very simple and easy; new filters are accommodated in the lockers of the boat and the same can be done with the used ones; it's possible to collect more than 200 litres of pollutants in a single cruise. The used filters can be directly conferred in a landfill according with local laws.

TRANSPORTABLE

The goal is achieved through the chance of folding the hulls under the main structure. The hulls are hinged and moved by hydraulic cylinders. The hinges are the legs on which the whole boat rests on a lorry or on the ground. Opening and closing of the hulls is controlled by remote radio.

ESSENTIAL AND SIMPLE

We deleted all those superstructures that could generate a difficulty of use or a possibility of breakages through a lot of analyses, developments and optimizations of all the equipment and assets. The boat is essential in all its parts and everything is very robust and rational. The hulls are bolted to the hinges and the hinges are bolted to the main structure; the train is a subsystem bolted to the supporting structure; the basic motorization is provided by two petrol outboards and the hull and train manoeuvres are managed by a simple hydraulic unit. The boat can be dismantled in all its parts in a few hours.

EASY TO USE

OilKiller requires only one operator that can easily perform all operations. Cruises at 8 knots and works at 3 knots lowering the train and catching the oily patches. Filters can be removed and placed with one hand in a couple of minutes.

FREE OF DIRT

The boat deck is always clean and the operator doesn't perform dirty operations. The only caution is to wear rubber gloves to replace any saturated filters. Pollutants are never deposited on the boat deck.

  • Download the .pdf brochure
  • Scarica la brochure .pdf

____________________________________________________________________________________

 TJP Train

The set of FLOC, FilterBox, connecting frame and levers for suspension forms the TJP Train.

  • characterizing element of the OilKiller project
  • includes the patented devices
  • allows the filtration activity
  • it is autonomous and fixed under the OilKiller main structure
  • it is adaptable to other catamarans or pontoons with a flat bottom and the necessary space
  • it can be used stand alone in a fixed position in the flow of a river or canal

The Train is a subsystem that anyone can use to contribute to the cleaning and maintenance of the water. The control of the levers to raise and lower the interceptor can be obtained with a hydraulic cylinder or with an electric actuator.

  • All developments are completed
  • Prototypes have been made and tested
  • The industrial project is totally defined
  • The supplier chain is defined too
  • The market analysis is running

Now we are going to build the first model of OilKiller.

 

 

You will make the born of OilKiller possible.
You will make the project live.
You will help waters.
You will be proud to be in the part that takes care of our planet.
OilKiller is OK, concrete, simple, effective, not expensive and for this reason widely distributable.

The creation and marketing of OilKiller will be followed by two developments:

  1. first one is about the adoption of vegetable fibers and food resins to substitute the fiberglass and change an old OilKiller from waste to recyclable material;
  2. the second one, ahead in time, is a new vessel for the collection of solids from water, including plastic, being also this new device focused on the simplicity, economy and efficiency of the entire cycle of work.

____________________________________________________________________________________

Now I wish to tell you

  • what we are going to do
  • how we will spend your money
  • how is made the definitive project

The steps for the industrial production are

  • milling of the polyurethane models of every part of the boat
  • obtain the molds from the models
  • laminate the fiber glass in the molds and extract the parts of the boat
  • get the steel parts (hinges etc.) by laser cut and bending unit
  • get control systems (hydraulic, electric...)
  • get engines and its services
  • assembling everything

Every step has its own cost

We put our goal at 40.000,00 € to fund the models milling plus related costs.
The flexible way allows us to complete one step after the other according to the thrust and the trust you give us.

We will be clear with you by a daily sharing of the campaign path and after the growing life of every step till the launch of the first OilKiller.

The definitive OilKiller design

Inspired to rationality and simplicity the design is made as I'm going to show you telling also the main directions that defined our choices.

The base of all is the 3D modelling of the device in every single part

 

Then the lamination sheets (a couple of examples)

The main carpentry

The design takes note about the different setups that could be needed to answer to the 3 main fields of application in which OilKiller could intervene

  1. civil areas
  2. protected naturalistic areas
  3. industrial at-risk areas

This was achieved by providing the necessary room for the subsystems and related services and splitting the hulls into two parts. The aft section houses the instruments (echo, clipper etc.) and the alternative propulsion systems: electric or hydraulic.

Civil areas

It is the most common application and OilKiller is pushed by two outboards fuelled by gasoline

Protected naturalistic areas

In these contexts it is generally forbidden to use endothermic engines and we therefore planned to adopt an electric propulsion by positioning the engines in the hulls and the batteries in the main body. Electric propulsion and petrol outboards can coexist on the same boat.

Industrial at-risk areas

In industrial areas at risk, typically refineries, oil terminals and oil depots the use of devices that can trigger explosions or fires is prohibited. To solve this need we have envisaged the adoption of a diesel engine and a hydraulic unit kept in the main structure and two hydraulic turbines housed in the hulls. This setup too can coexist with gasoline outboards.

____________________________________________________________________________________

  • OilKiller is thought to be useful to environment in a simple, easy and economical way.
  • It is robust and free of any complication that could carry difficulties or breakdowns.
  • There are no chemicals nor pumps or other machines; the only needed energy is the cruising of the boat.
  • It’s realized with 3 independent subsystems; they all three are joined together with bolts and nuts.
  • It’s possible to use different propulsions without the need to produce new parts.
  • The technology can be used in fixed position in the flow of a river or canals.
  • The technology is available for owners that already own a catamaran or pontoon.
  • The boat is transportable on a common light lorry.
  • The size allows to ship the boat inside a standard 40ft container.
  • Oil Killer use is for cleaning up and maintenance, for remediations in near areas, in form of fleets for Oil Spill Response.

We are sure that we have done everything that was possible and necessary to have the maximum security of our project. We also know we have to work but this does not scare and we are ready to work as hard as we have done up to now.

TJP is interested in contacts with potential industrial and/or commercial partners.

  • Share the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

About me?

Here is Luigi Perrella, aeronautical engineer almost seventy still lively and still a dreamer.
I started this project with the idea of creating something effective to collect oil from the surface of the sea. I founded the company, involved young talents, developed the idea up to the prototypes and the final project and now I ask for your help to close the cycle and start the industrial production of OilKiller building the first model.

____________________________________________________________________________________

Feel free to ask for any information you would like to have:
I'll quickly answer.
story_txt:
Per partecipare - To take partTraduzione in italiano >>>Do it with us!in a marinas and social area for the healthiness of people.embarked as equipment on transport or a cruise ships for remediation to accidental spills.to catch spread patterns on the sea. the best and simplest solution for real needs!  
 1) Widely usable
2) Restrict pollutants to capture them more easily
3) No pumps and no additional energy
4) No splitting water's surface with the bow of a ship
5) Simple and robust device

 1) Little costs, rational project, no risk of breakage.OilKiller is for ordinary clean up in the absence of catastrophic spills (that we hope will not happen) but can be used for the damage reduction.
2) With a  catamaran shape.
3) With a patented device to catch a film of water and sends it to a small area.
4) With a patented device in which several filters extract the oily pollutants.
5) With the natural storage of pollutants inside the filters.Anyone can cruise, no specialization needed; bridge and operator are never dirty.
Our prototypes:on left "OK B" (basic) with fixed hulls and on right "OK S" (smart) with foldable hullsOilKiller is the OK boatHere how it works:A large dustpan captures the surface of waterThe oily spots float on the surfaceWater and oil meet the filters and the graphene bags absorb the oil for contactThe cleaned water flows free and the oil remains in the filter bagsAll this with the little power of two small outboardsDone!The OilKiller storyEverything started when Lombarda Petroli dumped 10 million litres of Diesel oil into the Lambro River. I spent my youth in the Park of Monza and it is still my enchanted garden.
The Lambro River
The accident
Some response
Monza: the Park, the autodrome
Technicians were struggling with absorbent placemats and floating barriers put in place to intercept those 10 million litres.On 20th April 2010 the Deepwater Horizon platform exploded in the Gulf of Mexico.Both events were tragic: the black wave of the Lambro river for the Park of Monza and for the Po river natural environment and the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico for the whole ocean and the coasts of Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Florida as well as for the marine fauna and birds.
Lambro
Louisiana
Fauna
The TV showed fire and chemical dispersants everywhere and the fishermen collecting oil with their nets. On 4th July 2010 the giant ship “A whale”, specially setted up for this accident, reached the Gulf of Mexico showing the incapability to collect any minimum amount of oil. Centrifugal separators were also purchased by actor Kevin Costner which also prove disappointing.The fact remains that in front of huge disasters it seems that we can react only thanks to huge, complex and very expensive means like these here below. For myself the fishermen looked to be the most effective and environment respecting operators, lifting oil emulsions out of water with a so simple tool: nets!
Bottsand class
A Whale
Sweeping arm
Hull with mouth
Only the mechanical removal of pollutants effectively removes the pollution while solvents, thickeners and chemicals dissolve the pollutant in the water and poison fauna and flora or make it precipitate under the surface destroying its ecosystem and seriously compromising plankton. Fire poisons the air up to the highest altitudes.It's understood that in tragic situations it's necessary to get compromises among the various methods of remediation with the aim to reduce the damage as much as possible.At that time, I became to deepen the scientific knowledge on how oil leaks live on water and that knowledge supported me in starting to develop to the current OilKiller.It's important to say something about oily slicks life on water surface.
when the spill occurs into water, the oil undergoes significant changes due to exposure to air and sun (here the ITOPF page about weathering effects on oil spills)
in the first hour about 25% of the spill evaporates

the thickness of the spill decreases rapidly up to a few thousandths of a millimetre even after a few hundred meters from the point where it happened the slick tells you about its thickness showing its colour
  the oily patches are pushed by winds and currents and a part of them reaches the coasts
the main responsible for the introduction of hydrocarbon at sea are agricultural, industrial and urban waste (44%) 
degradation processes (evaporation, diffusion, etc.) are very fast and after one day the oil spill has already lost a quarter of its volume, has overrun an area of square kilometres and has thinned to thousandths of a millimetre. All these scientific considerations allow us to give aFirst conclusions:
the presence on waters of oil slicks is a reality, even far away from heavy spills and even in the absence of these;
the oily sheen that in everyday life can be observed along the coasts, sea front, docks, channels, etc. are the consequence of the drift of oil from large spills occurred far away, or of the routine activities in port areas (maintenance, refuelling, loading and unloading), or for the agricultural, industrial and civil discharges;
the presence of oily spots is dangerous to the flora and fauna, affects the healthiness of fish, crustaceans and bivalves (mussels, clams, etc.) that enter in the human food, dirties boats and infrastructure, generates bad smells, ruins the beauty of places and is dangerous for social life, tourism and economy;
the oily spots are always very thin except that very near to a disastrous event and nowadays there aren’t devices dedicated to their removal except for absorbent napkins or dissolving sprays;
to place absorbent placemats is a long work, requires personal and it is a dirty job; the sprays can be expensive and difficult to apply, they distribute the pollution in the mass of water or make it fall towards the bottom and on the one that it meets in the sinking: fish, miticolture, algae...
Up to the OilKillerHere a short story by images: Main values of OilKiller
efficient
effective
transportable
essential and simple
easy
free of dirt
EFFICENTIt does the job well and with the least possible consumption of energy. OilKiller performs in a new way or at least better than everything possible today with available tools.FLOC (FLexible Oil Collector), the interceptor of the water surface, was developed and patented and it represents the introduction of a new system complaint with the criterion of innovation.The way how FLOC works can be referred to weir skimmer that use gravity and pumps to drain oil from the water surface. Weir skimmers are dropped from a vessel by a crane.The hole of a weir skimmer is small and the device is designed to work at a fixed point.Operation requires:
a skimmer
a pump
a source of energy
a support boat
a crane
a settling tank
a staff
And here some pricesHere below the graphic description of the connection between FLOC and the weir skimmers. FLOC moves with the boat, goes itself to meet the oily slicks, can follow them, doesn't need pumps neither tank, stores the pollutants in its filters, only uses the energy of the outboard engines.Consider please the advantage of moving rather than being fixed: most skimmers have been designed to work at a fixed point. They are dropped in the middle of the spill with a crane and at that point they take the mixtures of water and oil to send it with a pump on a support vessel. Movement is a real need so that a few years ago some of them have been equipped with push systems to be little moved anyway remaining bound to the mother ship. Ships equipped with sweeper are expensive exceptions and there are few of them around the world. OilKiller autonomously navigates to the areas that have to be cleaned or rehabilitated.The advantage is evident and I wish to explain this with the pictures here below.EFFECTIVEOilKiller uses the flow generated by its movement to convey water and oil mixture towards a restricted area at the stern to meet elements containing strongly oleophilic graphene that captures the oil fraction by contact and absorbs it within itself by storing it.  The FLOC shape is designed in order to avoid filtering the entire mass of water intercepted. The oils float therefore it is enough to filter only the free surface. FLOC keeps the flow constant so that not to generate a brake on the incoming water, then splits it into two flows: a superficial one with the pollutants that flows through the filters and a lower one with the mass of water directly released. The contact of the oily fraction with the graphene takes place in an area that we have called FilterBox. All this to need the less energy possible to reach the result and make it possible to use only the small outboard engines.  The filtering system can reach up to 25 litres for each refill of filters; replacing the filter is very simple and easy; new filters are accommodated in the lockers of the boat and the same can be done with the used ones; it's possible to collect more than 200 litres of pollutants in a single cruise. The used filters can be directly conferred in a landfill according with local laws.TRANSPORTABLEThe goal is achieved through the chance of folding the hulls under the main structure. The hulls are hinged and moved by hydraulic cylinders. The hinges are the legs on which the whole boat rests on a lorry or on the ground. Opening and closing of the hulls is controlled by remote radio.ESSENTIAL AND SIMPLEWe deleted all those superstructures that could generate a difficulty of use or a possibility of breakages through a lot of analyses, developments and optimizations of all the equipment and assets. The boat is essential in all its parts and everything is very robust and rational. The hulls are bolted to the hinges and the hinges are bolted to the main structure; the train is a subsystem bolted to the supporting structure; the basic motorization is provided by two petrol outboards and the hull and train manoeuvres are managed by a simple hydraulic unit. The boat can be dismantled in all its parts in a few hours.EASY TO USEOilKiller requires only one operator that can easily perform all operations. Cruises at 8 knots and works at 3 knots lowering the train and catching the oily patches. Filters can be removed and placed with one hand in a couple of minutes.FREE OF DIRTThe boat deck is always clean and the operator doesn't perform dirty operations. The only caution is to wear rubber gloves to replace any saturated filters. Pollutants are never deposited on the boat deck.
Download the .pdf brochure
Scarica la brochure .pdf
____________________________________________________________________________________ TJP TrainThe set of FLOC, FilterBox, connecting frame and levers for suspension forms the TJP Train.

includes the patented devices
allows the filtration activity

it is autonomous and fixed under the OilKiller main structure
it is adaptable to other catamarans or pontoons with a flat bottom and the necessary space
it can be used stand alone in a fixed position in the flow of a river or canal

story:
Horses of Gili

My name is Tori Taylor and I helped found the Horses of Gili.  I am a veterinary technician who moved to the island in 2014 to manage a dive resort.  It became quickly apparent that animal welfare was an issue on the island that hit close to my heart.  I began assisting with a spay/neuter program for island cats and soon thereafter became involved in the care of the horses.  The island already had twice annual free horse clinics but more was needed.  In 2015 we founded Horses of Gili and began a comprehensive program providing medical care, education, rescue, and rehabilitation.  In August of 2018 a series of devastating earthquakes hit our island the neighboring island of Lombok.  Our stables were badly damaged and all our funds depleted by purchasing food and medical supplies for the horses of all 3 islands.  Fast forward to now and we have located new property to locate our stables.  It is a more visible location and less prone to flooding.  We just now need to raise funds to build new stables to continue our work.

The plans

We have had a builder help draw up a plan for low cost stables made of mostly natural materials such as bamboo and wood.  The floors will be concrete due to the heavy rains we get here and a tack room and feed storage room is included.  We have planned for 7 stalls each with an individual exercise area off of the back to ensure the horses get the best care possible.  An isolation or stallion stall is also included to keep horses separated if needed. 

Make a difference

These stables will provide a clean and easy to care for environment for sick or injured horses.  They will help us to continue our work of education, medical care, rescue and rehabilitation.  In the last 3 years we have rescued 16 horses and rehomed most of them.  We have also helped with free horse clinics treating hundreds of horses and see 4 to 6 horses per week for minor medical care.  Currently we work mostly out my work and my boss is very tolerant but a dedicated location is needed. 
 

Risks & Challenges

Not only do we have to build stables but we will need to arrange for electricity and fresh water to the stables.  These costs have been included in our estimate.  And we will have to find time to build the stables while we all work our regular jobs since we are volunteers.  Fortunately it is low season so hopefully we can complete them prior to the island getting busy again!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate?  That's ok please share our campaign and like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/horsesofgili/

Tahnks for all of the support!

story:
Welcome,

Our dream is for a village life based in conscious choiceful co-creation in service to a world that works for all.

We are grateful that you have arrived here with us; help us spread this message to those who will resonate by using the share buttons above.

Our research focus is on the application of our inner-connected group listening process at the interface between:

  1. Individual humans and the collective being we enact as community (sublimewe)
  2. The relationship between human society and nature via food systems (permaculture)
  3. And into the relationship between the individual body and consciousness itself (plant medicine)

This winter we will be deepening into our connection with the landscape in the form of a inner-connected participative permaculture group enquiry; listening for the One voice as it speaks through each of us, and all the beings present on the land.

With your help we will:

  • Extend the kitchen [£3000]
  • Build accommodation for 8 guests plus residents [£16,000]
  • Construct a water collection system plus showers and toilets [£4000]
  • Decorate and equip the temple space [£1000]
  • Buy and protect 40 hectares of local forest that will otherwise be cut [£6000]

The core aim of our group process is to learn to reestablish a conscious participative relationship with the foods and medicines we ingest, and the natural systems from which they come.

Running clear through the heart of all of our work are the threads of co-creation, self awareness and nature connection.  We offer presence and process to support each person in living in and through their core values on a dailly basis and to integrate expereinces from cermeony into everyday living.

Living Compassionately

We live firmly grounded in, and grateful for all works based in nonviolence - a reverence and respect for Life itself –honouring the creative healing soul-force within each of us.

Lived experience of community consciousness, alignment with the wild beauty of nature and awareness of the innermost aspects of self are our primary doorways to a life of clarity, connection and choiceful contribution.

You make all the difference

Financial support of the project will :

  • enable the autonomy, quality and precision of our research focus
  • support ceremony being offered from within a priceless modern-tribal village structure
  • increase the inclusivity and fluidity with which we can offer back the permaculture developments and high quality learning environment to the local people

Our needs

Each of you/us has unique gifts, skills, networks and access to resources with which to support our shared dream emerging. 

We have a diversity of needs and needs on many levels . To enable us to move beyond what we currently imagine contact us with details about your skills and experience particularly the following areas:

  • working in the tropics as permaculturist, gardener or eco builder,
  • sharing Restorative Circles 
  • online, social media, website design or other contacts.

We believe:

This generation has in its hands a gift waiting to be given. Our pact is to germinate the seed of an ancient-futuristic way of life that fuses modern day technology with traditional wisdom. To build a step forward by looking backwards. By remembering how we used to live, as one, in harmony with nature we can apply the costly knowledge that we've gained in the service of a world that works for all.

Gifting

For three years we’ve been living a healthier way of engaging with resources – time, skills and money – which doesn’t rely on fixed prices.  Its an inclusive debt-free approach to economy centred in honesty, trust and integrity.

Receiving 'the gift of giving', ‘gifting’ or ‘pay-it-forward’, returns to us, our power to co-create the world we believe in. Your donation nourishes this, the essence of our work; a spark of generosity that will be transmitted onwards and embodied as the core component of our conscious culture.

 

Our Story

The land was purchased in the small village of Santa Maria de Ojeal during a 5 month stay with a local healer working with ayahuasca when Jake first visited the Amazon in 2006.

"I got a clear call to discover how modern knowledge could integrate with ancient wisdom; and a piece of land to do it on; the rest was up to me"

The journey was long and winding.  I discovered first hand that behind the label of 'depression', lay the part of my soul that could never forgot my fundmental interdependence with the natural world.

It was from this place that I rebuilt my self from inside out.  As I did so, I slowly found the right  people around me. People who were willing to invest time and energy in the work of co-creating empathic purpose orientated spaces in which to re-remember these lost gifts.

'No one can do it for me - yet no one need do it alone.'

The core values of our team here at PACT are authenticity, trust and shared understanding.

Contact Isabelle.Wolf(at)gmx.de for more information.

Biographies

Nick Boyce, an experienced permaculturist, brings his 7 years living in various Tropical communities to “PACT”, on the land from November 2016 to March 2017. Previously, directing the day to day operations of Chaikuni Institute in the Iquitos region for two years, he has embodied knowledge of the local landscape, and how to progress toward goals. Prior experiences directing the long-term progression of landscapes in India and Haiti, allows these Global experiences to be brought into the locality of Iquitos. gLoCal.

His life's purpose is to continue the integration of self with various Worldwide homes, co-creating a network of “LighthoUSes”. A keen alLchemical dancer. His experiences of sublimewe have allowed him to fully integrate People care and Earth care into the gifting culture, deepening this life purpose.

Jake Lawy co-launched the sublimewe practice with the work's originator Sarasvati Cee in 2013.  A facilitator, poet and social entrepreneur Jake's passion is to bring together sublimewe with traditional ceremony work. This hub forms part of wider initiative that will use landscpae scale permaculture to create sufficient renewable energy to ignite an Amazon-wide socially and ecologically regenerative movement. Jake is currently co-authoring a book with Robert Gonzales called "Living Compassion", a work centred in nonviolence that supports an expereince of the deep self through conscious connection to the life force with us.

Isabelle Wolf is a professional translator and conference interpreter with 8 years expereince working with German, English, French and Spanish. Isabelle has a passion for conscious communication and has successful held and managed the group finances for three years.  Her creative focus is in preparing and arranging for the  groups food needs especially delicious raw food. Her personal conection to the Pranic lifestyle has been nourished through interactions with Ayahuasca ceremonies. Isabelle is responding to a deep call to work with other women and girls in relation to body, diet and self image, restoring the feminine directly within.

Ian Willink is a qualified sound engineer who has a huge passion for music and the healing properties of sound, he focuses his efforts on blending modern day synthesis and production with traditional sound healing. He has been interested since a very young age in the healing and entheogenic properties of different substances spending extensive time exploring, expanding his consciousness and learning how to hold sacred space with them. A few years ago his path was led to Kambo. After experiencing it's magic he had a clear vision to start serving it to other people. Recieving intensive training under the IAKP (International Association of Kambo Practitioners) he now operates as a fully functional practitioner. His path in life is to help facilitate deep self-healing through the use of medicines and music. Ian has come to the land to deepen his roots and connection to the earth to better be in service of co creating a shift in paradigm.
story_txt:
Welcome,
Our dream is for a village life based in conscious choiceful co-creation in service to a world that works for all.
We are grateful that you have arrived here with us; help us spread this message to those who will resonate by using the share buttons above.
Our research focus is on the application of our inner-connected group listening process at the interface between:

Individual humans and the collective being we enact as community (sublimewe)
The relationship between human society and nature via food systems (permaculture)
And into the relationship between the individual body and consciousness itself (plant medicine)

This winter we will be deepening into our connection with the landscape in the form of a inner-connected participative permaculture group enquiry; listening for the One voice as it speaks through each of us, and all the beings present on the land.
With your help we will:

Extend the kitchen [£3000]
Build accommodation for 8 guests plus residents [£16,000]
Construct a water collection system plus showers and toilets [£4000]
Decorate and equip the temple space [£1000]
Buy and protect 40 hectares of local forest that will otherwise be cut [£6000]

The core aim of our group process is to learn to reestablish a conscious participative relationship with the foods and medicines we ingest, and the natural systems from which they come.
Running clear through the heart of all of our work are the threads of co-creation, self awareness and nature connection.  We offer presence and process to support each person in living in and through their core values on a dailly basis and to integrate expereinces from cermeony into everyday living.
Living Compassionately
We live firmly grounded in, and grateful for all works based in nonviolence - a reverence and respect for Life itself –honouring the creative healing soul-force within each of us.
Lived experience of community consciousness, alignment with the wild beauty of nature and awareness of the innermost aspects of self are our primary doorways to a life of clarity, connection and choiceful contribution.
You make all the difference
Financial support of the project will :

enable the autonomy, quality and precision of our research focus
support ceremony being offered from within a priceless modern-tribal village structure
increase the inclusivity and fluidity with which we can offer back the permaculture developments and high quality learning environment to the local people

Our needs
Each of you/us has unique gifts, skills, networks and access to resources with which to support our shared dream emerging. 
We have a diversity of needs and needs on many levels . To enable us to move beyond what we currently imagine contact us with details about your skills and experience particularly the following areas:

working in the tropics as permaculturist, gardener or eco builder,
sharing Restorative Circles 
online, social media, website design or other contacts.

We believe:
This generation has in its hands a gift waiting to be given. Our pact is to germinate the seed of an ancient-futuristic way of life that fuses modern day technology with traditional wisdom. To build a step forward by looking backwards. By remembering how we used to live, as one, in harmony with nature we can apply the costly knowledge that we've gained in the service of a world that works for all.
Gifting
For three years we’ve been living a healthier way of engaging with resources – time, skills and money – which doesn’t rely on fixed prices.  Its an inclusive debt-free approach to economy centred in honesty, trust and integrity.
Receiving 'the gift of giving', ‘gifting’ or ‘pay-it-forward’, returns to us, our power to co-create the world we believe in. Your donation nourishes this, the essence of our work; a spark of generosity that will be transmitted onwards and embodied as the core component of our conscious culture.
 
Our Story
The land was purchased in the small village of Santa Maria de Ojeal during a 5 month stay with a local healer working with ayahuasca when Jake first visited the Amazon in 2006.
"I got a clear call to discover how modern knowledge could integrate with ancient wisdom; and a piece of land to do it on; the rest was up to me"
The journey was long and winding.  I discovered first hand that behind the label of 'depression', lay the part of my soul that could never forgot my fundmental interdependence with the natural world.
It was from this place that I rebuilt my self from inside out.  As I did so, I slowly found the right  people around me. People who were willing to invest time and energy in the work of co-creating empathic purpose orientated spaces in which to re-remember these lost gifts.
'No one can do it for me - yet no one need do it alone.'
The core values of our team here at PACT are authenticity, trust and shared understanding.
Contact Isabelle.Wolf(at)gmx.de for more information.
Biographies
Nick Boyce, an experienced permaculturist, brings his 7 years living in various Tropical communities to “PACT”, on the land from November 2016 to March 2017. Previously, directing the day to day operations of Chaikuni Institute in the Iquitos region for two years, he has embodied knowledge of the local landscape, and how to progress toward goals. Prior experiences directing the long-term progression of landscapes in India and Haiti, allows these Global experiences to be brought into the locality of Iquitos. gLoCal.His life's purpose is to continue the integration of self with various Worldwide homes, co-creating a network of “LighthoUSes”. A keen alLchemical dancer. His experiences of sublimewe have allowed him to fully integrate People care and Earth care into the gifting culture, deepening this life purpose.
Jake Lawy co-launched the sublimewe practice with the work's originator Sarasvati Cee in 2013.  A facilitator, poet and social entrepreneur Jake's passion is to bring together sublimewe with traditional ceremony work. This hub forms part of wider initiative that will use landscpae scale permaculture to create sufficient renewable energy to ignite an Amazon-wide socially and ecologically regenerative movement. Jake is currently co-authoring a book with Robert Gonzales called "Living Compassion", a work centred in nonviolence that supports an expereince of the deep self through conscious connection to the life force with us.
Isabelle Wolf is a professional translator and conference interpreter with 8 years expereince working with German, English, French and Spanish. Isabelle has a passion for conscious communication and has successful held and managed the group finances for three years.  Her creative focus is in preparing and arranging for the  groups food needs especially delicious raw food. Her personal conection to the Pranic lifestyle has been nourished through interactions with Ayahuasca ceremonies. Isabelle is responding to a deep call to work with other women and girls in relation to body, diet and self image, restoring the feminine directly within.
Ian Willink is a qualified sound engineer who has a huge passion for music and the healing properties of sound, he focuses his efforts on blending modern day synthesis and production with traditional sound healing. He has been interested since a very young age in the healing and entheogenic properties of different substances spending extensive time exploring, expanding his consciousness and learning how to hold sacred space with them. A few years ago his path was led to Kambo. After experiencing it's magic he had a clear vision to start serving it to other people. Recieving intensive training under the IAKP (International Association of Kambo Practitioners) he now operates as a fully functional practitioner. His path in life is to help facilitate deep self-healing through the use of medicines and music. Ian has come to the land to deepen his roots and connection to the earth to better be in service of co creating a shift in paradigm.

story:
About PureWater

My name is Chris Manus, an Army-combat Veteran, member of The Clean Water Corps and Waves for Water, and current resident of the beautiful island of Puerto Rico.

PureWater, formally known as Water on Wheels, immediately began following the devastation of Hurricane Maria, when I boiled and handed out a single gallon of water to a man in need. 

Since, PureWater has grown into an island-wide grassroots effort that has provided thousands of individuals with sustainable and accessible clean drinking water! We're just getting started and with your help, we're ready to officially launch the 'pay-it-forward' PureWater for Puerto Rico campaign. 

For every PureWater Bottle that is pre-ordered, we will donate at least one additional bottle to students in Puerto Rico who takes the PureWater Pledge!  Get this, with your help, we'll be able to accomplish the following with every single PureWater Bottle we deliver to a student in Puerto Rico! 

  • Eliminate the need for 3,000 plastic water bottles. 
  • Eliminate 200 gallons of oil, which would be required to manufacture and transport those plastic water bottles. 
  • Prevent 800 gallons of wasted water, which would be required to manufacture those plastic water bottles. 
  • Provide a student in-need in Puerto Rico who lacks reliable access to clean drinking water. 
  • Not to mention, reduce pollution, save the fishies, protect the environment, etc. 

So, let's do some quick math - Let's say you choose to be a PureWater Legend! Your contribution will eliminate the need for 15,000 plastic water bottles, eliminate 1,000 gallons of dirty oil and save 4,00 gallons of wasted water. Pretty powerful stuff, huh? 

We're not just stopping at schools and throwing water filtration bottles at kids, though. We're taking our time, giving presentations and educating the students on the immediate and long-term issues surrounding the plastic water bottle pollution issue, as well as discussing the risks of consuming non-potable water. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our current goal is $10,000, which will be enough to launch and scale this concept throughout Puerto Rico and eventually the United States. Seems like a pretty small price to pay to help save the world! 
  • Not only does your contribution get you an incredibly awesome PureWater Filtration Bottle, with a carabiner and a nifty built-in compass, you'll also get the satisfaction of knowing that you were able to pay-it-forward, by providing a student in Puerto Rico with their very own bottle! 
  • Rest assured, we are not a profit-driven business and all contributions will be used to cover the cost of your very own PureWater Bottle, as well as the bottles that will be donated to the students in PuertoRico in your honor! 
  • We are also looking for SPONSORS! We don't have a perk setup for this one but feel free to reach out if interested. We're looking for businesses and organizations to sponsor entire school events. 
  • One last thing - We're also looking for schools, sports teams, businesses and pretty much any other large group of people who are interested in taking the PureWater Pledge! If so, reach out to us and we can discuss the details! 

The Impact

We briefly touched on the impact your contribution will have above; however, I'd love to go into a little more detail. As you're probably well aware, the plastic water bottle industry is destroying our planet. 

It is projected by 2050, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean. It takes more than 2 gallons of wasted water and a quarter gallon of oil just to produce a one-gallon water bottle. Also, to purchase that gallon of water, you'd spend more than 2,750 times more than if you simply filtered the water coming out of your tap. 

I could probably write a novel-length book on why we need to kick the habit of grabbing a plastic water bottle when we're thirsty but I know you're an intelligent, well-informed, busy individual, so I won't waste your time. 

While crippling our dependency on the plastic water bottle industry is important, we're also incredibly passionate about providing every single person with accessible, portable, affordable, potable water. Since Hurricane Maria tore through Puerto Rico, I've spoken to hundreds and hundreds of individuals who still lack drinking water, even two months after the storm. 

With the support and assistance of Waves for Water and The Clean Water Corps, we have setup hundreds of water filtration stations throughout the entire island. With your help, we'll be able to add to that success by educating and empowering the future of Puerto Rico and gaining their commitment to take the PureWater Pledge! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute at this time, there's still plenty you can do to help our cause and advance our mission! Most importantly, though, simply share our campaign, generate some buzz and raise awareness to the issues at hand and how we plan to solve them! 

If you've made it this far down the page, you're awesome and I thank you! 

Be the change. Take the PureWater Pledge. - "The last water bottle you'll ever need." 

Additional Info.

Learn more about how this effort got started and how it has evolved over the past two months, please visit the links below: 

  • Interview with WISH-TV
  • News Article from Pharos Tribune
  • PureWater Facebook Page
  • Chris Manus Facebook Page 
  • Telemundo Interview - PureWater Pledge Launch at the Ricky Martin Foundation School. 

PureWater Filtration Bottle - Design and specifications. 

Each PureWater bottle is constructed out of Tritan BPA-Free plastic and contains a two-stage filtration unit, which includes a 0.1 micron hollow membrane fiber filter and a charcoal activated filter. 

The bottle is capable of eliminating more than 99.9% of waterborne bacteria, heavy metal ions, taste, chlorine, and other volatile organic compounds (VOCs). 

The filtration unit can be replaced and has a life-time capacity of 1,500 liters, which is enough drinking water for one person for more than two years!

*Note: We will get around to developing a fancy website and marketing material at some point but currently, we believe our resources and time are better spent helping out around the island! 

**Note: Pre-Orders will be fulfilled and shipped in early 2018, with expected delivery by 2/15/2018.
