story:
Like you, I care about clean water and our natural resources, and that's why I invented the ShowerSmart® system. In the shower I wanted to have water when I wanted it, and wanted to easily turn it off when I didn't. Now, with just a wave of my hand I can turn the water 'on' and 'off' to the showerhead without needing to fiddle with the hot and cold water controls. I get a better shower, and save over 50% of the water I use in the shower, and on my hot water heating bill! I love it, and know you will too!

Why the ShowerSmart® Campaign?

To REALLY make a difference, mass-production is where it's at. But that takes money. We are seeking to raise funds to get final product design, manufacturing, and delivery of products rolling in a big way!

Help get the final product to market, save the Earth, and save money while you're at it. Your support will help the final mass-market design, and help to spread the word about ShowerSmart®.



29% of a Home's Water Use is for Showers!



According to the US EPA...

...the average family could save 2,900 gallons per year by installing water saving showerhead products!  Since these water savings will reduce demands on water heaters, they will also save energy. In fact, the average family could save more than 370 kilowatt hours of electricity annually, enough to power a house for 13 days.

On a national scale, if every home in the United States installed water saving showerhead products, we could save more than $2.2 billion in water utility bills and more than 260 billion gallons of water annually. In addition, we could avoid about $2.6 billion in energy costs for heating water!


18% of a Home's Energy Use is for Showers!


There are a lot of great perks to choose.
Take a look and choose your perk now, and thank you for your support!


FAQS

Will I get charged right away if I pledge now?

Yes. Contributors are charged at the time of the transaction.


How can I order multiples of ShowerSmart®?

To claim multiple perks, please make a separate transaction for each perk. Feel free to leave a comment about any perks you’d like to see on the page!


When will my ShowerSmart® system arrive?

All ShowerSmart® systems will ship by December 2015.


Where does my money go?

Your donation will go towards final production tooling (building the manufacturing equipment) and initial run (purchasing the necessary parts upfront for our first round of production). We’re so close, but we need your help for these final steps.  


How do I upgrade my rewards?

If you’d like to upgrade your perk to a higher-priced perk, you can click "Upgrade to Higher Priced Perk” on the indiegogo page.


How will you know where to send my stuff?

Your shipping information and address will be collect during the check-out process. If you need to upgrade your shipping address, please email support@indiegogo.com.
story_txt:
Like you, I care about clean water and our natural resources, and that's why I invented the ShowerSmart® system. In the shower I wanted to have water when I wanted it, and wanted to easily turn it off when I didn't. Now, with just a wave of my hand I can turn the water 'on' and 'off' to the showerhead without needing to fiddle with the hot and cold water controls. I get a better shower, and save over 50% of the water I use in the shower, and on my hot water heating bill! I love it, and know you will too!Why the ShowerSmart® Campaign?
To REALLY make a difference, mass-production is where it's at. But that takes money. We are seeking to raise funds to get final product design, manufacturing, and delivery of products rolling in a big way!
Help get the final product to market, save the Earth, and save money while you're at it. Your support will help the final mass-market design, and help to spread the word about ShowerSmart®.


29% of a Home's Water Use is for Showers!











According to the US EPA...
...the average family could save 2,900 gallons per year by
  installing water saving showerhead products!  Since these water
  savings will reduce demands on water heaters, they will also save energy. In
  fact, the average family could save more than 370 kilowatt hours of
  electricity annually, enough to power a house for 13 days.
On a national scale, if every home in the United States installed water
  saving showerhead products, we could save more than $2.2 billion in water
  utility bills and more than 260 billion gallons of water annually. In
  addition, we could avoid about $2.6 billion in energy costs for heating
  water!






18% of a Home's Energy Use is for Showers! 





There are a lot of great perks to choose.Take a look and choose your perk now, and thank you for your support!
FAQS
Will I get charged right away if I pledge now?
Yes. Contributors are charged at the time of the transaction.
How can I order multiples of ShowerSmart®?
To claim multiple perks, please make a separate transaction for each perk. Feel free to leave a comment about any perks you’d like to see on the page!

When will my ShowerSmart® system arrive?
All ShowerSmart® systems will ship by December 2015.

Where does my money go?
Your donation will go towards final production tooling (building the manufacturing equipment) and initial run (purchasing the necessary parts upfront for our first round of production). We’re so close, but we need your help for these final steps.  

How do I upgrade my rewards?
If you’d like to upgrade your perk to a higher-priced perk, you can click "Upgrade to Higher Priced Perk” on the indiegogo page.

How will you know where to send my stuff?
Your shipping information and address will be collect during the check-out process. If you need to upgrade your shipping address, please email support@indiegogo.com.

story:
Qui sommes-nous?


Créée en février 2015, Exodes Urbains, est une jeune association qui encourage le développement de formes innovantes et parallèles d’agriculture urbaine.


L’idée d’Exodes Urbains est qu’il n’est plus nécessaire de choisir entre ville et campagne.

L’association cherche à promouvoir toute activité visant à verdir, favoriser la biodiversité et fertiliser les espaces gris et stériles trop présents dans les grandes agglomérations.


Nous voyons en l’agriculture urbaine différents avantages tels que:

  • La valorisation d’espaces urbains inexploités

  • Le développement d'une indépendance alimentaire des villes

  • L'extension de l’offre d’aliments locaux

  • Le rapprochement entre producteurs et consommateurs

  • La réduction des impacts financiers et écologiques liés au transport

  • L'encouragement d'une consommation de variétés locales

  • Le développement d’une vitrine de communication pour l’agriculture en ville


L’aquaponie par Exodes Urbains


Le but de ce projet est de promouvoir l’aquaponie en Suisse romande en installant une micro-ferme  aquaponique au coeur de Genève.


Je sais très bien ce que vous vous demandez à l’instant même où vous lisez ce descriptif:

”Mais c’est quoi au juste l’aquaponie?”


L’aquaponie est né de l’union des termes aquaculture - élevage d’organismes aquatiques - et hydroponie - culture de plantes dans un substrat enrichi. La contraction de ces deux termes résume bien le principe de symbiose entre les deux techniques. En effet, une relation d’interdépendance se crée entre la production de plantes et de poissons.

Le principe de l’aquaponie consiste à associer l’élevage de poissons et la culture de plantes dans une même production sur des surfaces hors-sol réduites. Il s’agit d’un système vertueux où les déchets engendrés par les poissons sont utilisés comme engrais pour les plantes qui de leurs côtés jouent un rôle de filtre biologique en purifiant l’eau des effluents engendrés par les poissons, et la boucle est bouclée.



L’aquaponie s’inscrit comme une réponse écologiquement et économiquement viable aux besoins et aux envies des consommateurs d’aujourd’hui. En effet, elle assure une production avec une rentabilité optimale de l’espace, associée à une consommation d’eau réduite et un rejet de déchet minimisé. De plus, les aliments produits sont d’une qualité supérieure grâce à la non-utilisation d’engrais et la culture en milieu fermé qui permet de maîtriser les intrants de la production.


Pourquoi faire de l’aquaponie en ville?

Rendement optimum de l’espace

Sur des expériences existantes à travers le monde, on trouve une productivité de nourriture au m2 allant jusqu’à 250 kg par année.


Faible consommation d’eau

Par rapport à une culture en pleine terre, l’aquaponie engendre une économie d’eau de plus de 80 %.


Pas d’apports chimiques extérieurs

Il s'agit d'un petit éco-système très sensibles à tout intrants extérieur; seul les engrais organiques tolérés dans la culture biologique peuvent être utilisée et ce avec parcimonie.


Rejets de polluants quasi nuls

Le traitement des déchets fécaux dans l'élevage de poissons est un vrai fléaux qui est encore peu traité. Selon Beth Hunter, coordonnatrice de la campagne Océans de Greenpeace, une ferme de 200 000 saumons libère une quantité de matières fécales «aussi importante que les nutriments rejetés dans les eaux usées d’une localité de 65 000 personnes».


Péservation de la faune locale

En élevant les poissons dans des parcs clos tel que dans le modèle aquaponique on évite les risques de contamination du milieu sauvage.


Adaptabilité des structures

Un système aquaponique s’adapte à toutes les contraintes liées à l’espace, toit,  parking, balcon, trottoir….tous ces espaces stériles peuvent être repensés pour accueillir une culture aquaponique.


LA MICRO FERME AQUAPONIQUE

Notre projet est de construire une vitrine sur l’aquaponie ouverte à tous au coeur même de Genève.


Concrètement, le projet prendra la forme d’un espace de culture aquaponique éphémère. Cette micro-ferme d’environ 15m2 se composera d’un container coiffé d’une serre. Ce projet, pensé par la designer Damien Chivialle, a déjà été présenté dans de nombreuses villes européennes. 


Le container abritera une cuve pour l’élevage des poissons ainsi que le système technique composé d’une pompe et d’un filtre à sable. La serre qui accueillera les plantes sera reliée par un système de tuyaux au local technique et recevra ainsi l’eau souillée des poissons.


Le laboratoire sera dans un premier temps installé sur le parking du Impact Hub Geneva, au 1 Rue Fendt, juste derrière la gare Cornavin.


Sur une période d’exploitation de 6 mois, nous projetons une production de poissons et de légumes de respectivement 60kg et 120kg, sans chauffage ni lumière artificielle.



Qu’est ce qu’on va offrir?


La micro-ferme aquaponique sera accessible aux visiteurs, grands comme petits.

Ils se verront présenter le système ainsi que les problématiques économiques, sociales et environnementales globale entourant le projet telles que:

  • L’autonomie alimentaire des villes

  • La construction d’un système alimentaire durable

  • Les dégâts écologiques engendrés par la production alimentaire

  • L’importance du développement de production alimentaire en circuit court

  • Les défis autour d’un retour du rural au coeur des villes


Si tu nous files un petit coup de mains, nous avons 2-3 trucs sympas à t’offrir:


25$ Coup d’œil

Une entrée pour deux personnes pour une visite du container avec un explication complète de la culture aquaponique.

L’aquaponie se développe très vite et de plus en plus de métiers autour de ce mode de culture sont en train de voir le jour. En visitant la ferme aquaponique d’Exodes Urbains, tu auras peut-être l’occasion de découvrir ta nouvelle vocation d’agriculteur urbain.



50$ Tu nous auras sur le dos

Un sac à dos en toile au logo d'Exodes Urbains plus la contrepartie "coup d'oeil"!

                                                      



150$ Dégustateur aquaponique!

Invitation à la soirée de dégustation de la première récolte des poissons et légumes cultivés dans le container.

Notre chef vous concoctera un menu local à 100 km à la ronde; Ceviche 100% genevois mais pas du lac et déclinaison de légumes d’ici et surtout pas d’ailleurs.

Notre mixologiste enchantera, avec ou sans alcool, vos papilles avec des cocktails à base de breuvages de la région et de menthe  du jardin urbain…


300$ L’aquaponie chez toi!

Une place pour un atelier (donné à Genève et Lausanne) pour apprendre à construire ton propre système aquaponique individuel. Nous fournissons le matériel pour la construction ainsi que les éléments qui viendront le garnir, à savoir les poissons rouges et les herbes aromatiques. Ces ateliers sont ouverts aux adultes mais aussi à nos chères petites têtes blondes.

Exodes Urbains est associé aux Recyclables, association genevoise pour la promotion de l’intergénérationalité. De ce fait, si avoir un système aquaponique chez toi ce n'est pas ta tasse de thé, tu peux quand même choisir cette contrepartie et offrir ta place à l’atelier à un enfant ou un senior qui ne pourrait pas se le permettre.


1'000$ Laisse ta marque!

Le logo ou le nom de ton entreprise, institution, association ou de toi-même... en grand sur le container. Si t’es pas branché délire mégalo, tu peux y faire inscrire une citation de ton choix, bref tu laisses ta trace sur le container!!


5'000$ YEAHHHHH!!!

C'est tellement énorme qu'on ne sait même pas quoi t'offrir en retour! Contacte nous et nous organiserons une contrepartie pensée juste pour toi!




Le financement

Nous estimons notre budget à 25’000 dollars.

Cela comprend:

  • Location de la place de parking

  • Raccordement à l’électricité et l’eau

  • Démarches administratives

  • Achats et livraison du container

  • Travaux sur le container

  • Achat matériel divers (verre pour la serre, matériel d’hydro, pompe, filtre....)

  • Boutures de légumes et plantes

  • Alvins de poissons

  • Nourriture piscicole

Nous serions plus que ravies si une partie du budget pouvait  être remplacée par des dons matériels.


Si vous cultivez de boutures bio, nous sommes preneuses!

Si vous élevez des alvins, nous sommes preneuses!

Si vous possédez du matériel d’hydro, nous sommes preneuses!

Si vous avez un vieux container qui encombre votre jardin, nous sommes preneuses!

Bref nous sommes preneuses pour tout!!



Et si tu te sens l’âme d’un jardinier doublé d’un aquaculteur, n'hésite pas à nous contacter pour faire partie des petits lutins qui nous aideront à construire et entretenir la micro-ferme. Toute personne qui donnera de son temps pour l’Asso profitera d’une contrepartie spéciale!!

story:
Maestro Juan Flores & Mayantuyacu

Ever since Maestro Juan Flores was young he has been learning about the healing powers of plants. At 15 years old, Juan healed his first child. For much of his life, Juan traveled Peru in search of a sacred place where he could open a healing centre. Following his dreams, and with the help of a rainbow, the spirits guided Juan to a boiling river deep in the Peruvian Amazon. It is here, in this ancient sacred place, 15 years ago, that Juan Flores founded Mayantuyacu, a healing and learning centre dedicated to the study of medicinal plants.

Now 65, the Ashahinkan Elder Maestro Flores has become a much sought-after healer and teacher for people from all corners of the globe. At any given time, a visit to Mayantuyacu can include getting to know people from half a dozen countries. Mayantuyacu is ground zero for the healing of the world. Those that have been know this. The impact of Mayantuyacu and the work of Maestro Flores on opening the hearts and minds in this world is vast and incalculable. Like the vapor that rises non-stop, day and night, from the river of Mayantuyacu, so does the love and healing flow into the world. The Plants want the world to heal, and to help, they gave us Mayantuyacu. 

In the ceremonies of Mayantuyacu, icaros, or songs of gratitude, are sung to the plants in exchange for their help in the healing process. Spend time at Mayantuyacu and one learns the art of gratitude, humble service, and the healing power the path wields. It is with this spirit that an international group of long-time visitors to Mayantuyacu decided to give back by creating Friends of Mayantuyacu.

Friends of Mayantuyacu is a campaign to raise funds to support the future sustainability of Mayantuyacu so people from all over the world can continue to benefit from its healing power for generations to come.


Friends of Mayantuyacu

We are a group of people, from all walks of life and professions, and from all around the world, who want to help Mayantuyacu grow and support the demands it faces
as it becomes a world-renowned healing and learning centre.

This campaign is the first initiative of Friends of Mayantuyacu and the funds raised will be used to cover projects that directly reduce the ecological footprint of visitors and ensure the long-term sustainability of visitation to this sacred place.  The project goals and objectives have been developed and prioritized in direct consultation with Maestro Flores and his wife Sandra Encalada. 

1. Sanitation Filter - With increased visitation to Mayantuyacu comes increased demands on the human waste treatment system. Presently, Mayantuyacu has a primary treatment system that empties into the boiling river.  With increasing demands, however, this system is quickly reaching its capacity and more sustainable options exist that can both increase capacity and reduce the amount of waste entering the jungle altogether.   A bio-filter system will be installed that will remove any pathogens and bacteria before it flows into the river (enhanced treatment), and provide a low-cost and modern solution that can be maintained locally (increased capacity with less maintenance).

2. Solar Power - At Mayantuyacu, a diesel generator is turned on every evening to provide lights and power for visitors to charge their devices. Power is a necessity at Mayantuyacu and solar power, which is silent and ecologically-friendly, will be installed to meet the increasing electrical needs of the visitors without affecting the naturalness of the jungle.

3. Garbage Removal & Recycling - To help nurture better habits for both visitors and workers, a program is being developed to promote better systems of garbage removal and recycling. The goal of this project is to remove or recycling of waste and packaging coming into the jungle.  This is a basic necessity for us to collectively ensure that Mayantuyacu looks as beautiful and natural as possible.

Friends of Mayantuyacu is not just a campaign, it is a movement with great aspirations of bringing healing to the world and increasing awareness of the power of medicinal plants. This first initiative is small, yet incredibly powerful and important. It is like a seed, of what will be a great tree.

If you have been to Mayantuyacu then you know how special a place it is. Please donate and join us with this effort. If you have not been to Mayantuyacu, then watch the documentary film Tonkiri, learn about the place, find it in your heart to donate, and join us in our effort as well. 


The Campaign:

We are aiming for $10,000 to accomplish these three projects.

$5000 = Sanitation Filter

$3000 = Solar Power

$2000 = Garbage & Recycling

If we do not receive our total funds goal, we will prioritize the projects and spend the funds accordingly. Friends of Mayantuyacu will exist beyond this campaign and will continue to work towards funding the initial three projects and many more that are to come.

Tonkiri

Many people know of Mayantuyacu from the documentary film Tonkiri made by Jim Sanders & André Clément. This is a film done in collaboration with Maestro Juan Flores over a ten year period. Tonkiri was completed and released using crowd funding in 2014. It is the Tonkiri film campaign that gives us faith that once again we can use the internet and individual supporters to make something important happen. We know we can do this and we are excited for what is possible.

Support Mayantuyacu!

Please support Friends of Mayantuyacu in any way you can. All donations, big or small, count. If you can't donate, then spread the word. Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter or even via personal email. Thanks from the bottom of our heart.

Progress Updates

Send us your email and we will send you regular reports on the progress of the various Friends of Mayantuyacu projects.

Spend time at Mayantuyacu and one learns the art of gratitude, humble service, and the healing power the path wields. It is with this spirit that an international group of long-time visitors to Mayantuyacu decided to give back by creating Friends of Mayantuyacu. Friends of Mayantuyacu is a campaign to raise funds to support the future sustainability of Mayantuyacu so people from all over the world can continue to benefit from its healing power for generations to come. 
Friends of Mayantuyacu
We are a group of people, from all walks of life and professions, and from all around the world, who want to help Mayantuyacu grow and support the demands it facesas it becomes a world-renowned healing and learning centre. This campaign is the first initiative of Friends of Mayantuyacu and the funds raised will be used to cover projects that directly reduce the ecological footprint of visitors and ensure the long-term sustainability of visitation to this sacred place.  The project goals and objectives have been developed and prioritized in direct consultation with Maestro Flores and his wife Sandra Encalada.  1. Sanitation Filter - With increased visitation to Mayantuyacu comes increased demands on the human waste treatment system. Presently, Mayantuyacu has a primary treatment system that empties into the boiling river.  With increasing demands, however, this system is quickly reaching its capacity and more sustainable options exist that can both increase capacity and reduce the amount of waste entering the jungle altogether.   A bio-filter system will be installed that will remove any pathogens and bacteria before it flows into the river (enhanced treatment), and provide a low-cost and modern solution that can be maintained locally (increased capacity with less maintenance). 2. Solar Power - At Mayantuyacu, a diesel generator is turned on every evening to provide lights and power for visitors to charge their devices. Power is a necessity at Mayantuyacu and solar power, which is silent and ecologically-friendly, will be installed to meet the increasing electrical needs of the visitors without affecting the naturalness of the jungle. 3. Garbage Removal & Recycling - To help nurture better habits for both visitors and workers, a program is being developed to promote better systems of garbage removal and recycling. The goal of this project is to remove or recycling of waste and packaging coming into the jungle.  This is a basic necessity for us to collectively ensure that Mayantuyacu looks as beautiful and natural as possible. Friends of Mayantuyacu is not just a campaign, it is a movement with great aspirations of bringing healing to the world and increasing awareness of the power of medicinal plants. This first initiative is small, yet incredibly powerful and important. It is like a seed, of what will be a great tree. If you have been to Mayantuyacu then you know how special a place it is. Please donate and join us with this effort. If you have not been to Mayantuyacu, then watch the documentary film Tonkiri, learn about the place, find it in your heart to donate, and join us in our effort as well.  


  The Campaign: 
 We are aiming for $10,000 to accomplish these three projects. 
$5000 = Sanitation Filter
$3000 = Solar Power
$2000 = Garbage & Recycling
If we do not receive our total funds goal, we will prioritize the projects and spend the funds accordingly. Friends of Mayantuyacu will exist beyond this campaign and will continue to work towards funding the initial three projects and many more that are to come. 

  Tonkiri
Many people know of Mayantuyacu from the documentary film Tonkiri made by Jim Sanders & André Clément. This is a film done in collaboration with Maestro Juan Flores over a ten year period. Tonkiri was completed and released using crowd funding in 2014. It is the Tonkiri film campaign that gives us faith that once again we can use the internet and individual supporters to make something important happen. We know we can do this and we are excited for what is possible. Support Mayantuyacu!Please support Friends of Mayantuyacu in any way you can. All donations, big or small, count. If you can't donate, then spread the word. Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter or even via personal email. Thanks from the bottom of our heart. Progress Updates
